loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang T. D. is a 30-year-old woman with an only son who lives in  Thai Binh  hamlet. She has a small restaurant that serves Pho (soup)– a very  popular food  in Vietnam. Her  restaurant opened in 2006 one year before she got her  first loan from our credit program. With the  first loan, she   bought  a refrigerator to keep  beef  fresh. 

Year after year now, she has received 7 loans in all and used them very effectively in expanding  her business. Every month, she earns 3,000,000 VND  profit from this restaurant.  Regarding her  repayment attitude, she is always a good re-payer.  For the next loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of  7,194,000 VND  to invest in her little restaurant.

loans.use: to invest in her soup restaurant.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy M. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  Cissy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees and feeding her family. 

Cissy has a business selling clothes.  She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works seven days a week. Cissy sells her products at the market, at wholesale and retail prices. Cissy has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Cissy include thieves, transportation and seasonality.  Her goal for her business is to start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Thabita Group

texts.en:
Agnella C. is the leader of Thabita Group and she is the one seated in the photo. Agnella is 30 years old, married, and has four children who are ages 17, 14, 11, and four. Of the four children three are still attending school. 

She has a business of selling blankets, clothes, shoes, and cell phone accessories at her flea market in Gweru. Displayed in the picture are some of her products. She does not have any other sources of income apart from her husband’s; he is also self-employed. Her main challenge is low sales during mid-month. 

Agnella requested this loan through MicroKing for the purpose of buying blankets and shoes for resale ahead of the winter season. She says the extra income from this loan will help in paying for the three childrens' school fees. In the future she would like to own her own house and car.

loans.use: to buy clothes, blankets, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Patrick Mwaura

texts.en:
Patrick has practised farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 15 years. He is 35 years old, married to Priscilla Wanjiru.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 15,000 and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seed and fertilizer.

In future, Patrick hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Idimo

texts.ru: Хасанова Идимо проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 42 года. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Её муж работает в строительной кампании, мастером. Сама она занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Idimo H. lives in Vahdat. She is 42 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband works for a construction company as a skilled laborer. She works in animal husbandry. She raises cattle at home. She primarily fattens and sells cattle. She has been doing this work for four years. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Saqiba Idress' Group

texts.en:
Saqiba Idress is married with three children: two sons and a daughter. All of them are very young and have not started their education yet. Her husband is a farmer by profession. He owns a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops and sells to the required customers. Saqiba is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She is a very active and efficient lady and performs her work efficiently. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her husband’s agriculture business. With the loan, he will purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to grow better crops and increase his profits. Saqiba is hopeful that a loan will help her husband to fulfill his client's orders and improve the living standard of her family as a result of increased profits. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Saqiba Idress.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 25 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamiz City.  She is married with 1 child. 

Rosemary has a motor cycle transport business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has  requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair her existing motor cycle and to purchase tires. 

Rosemary has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to use her income for motor maintenance and to provide basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to repair her existing motor cycle and to purchase tires

loans.name: San Juaquin 2 Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "SAN JUAQUIN 2" se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco D. Emprendimiento esta representado por las siguientes socias: Presidenta la señora Roció quien es soltera, se dedica a la confección D. artesanías en tela y lana, es una joven responsable y trabajadora que sola mantiene su hogar con el dinero D. crédito comprar tela y lana e hilos para la confección D. sus artesanías, es una persona trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The "San Juaquin 2" community bank is in its second loan cycle.  The bank is maD. up of responsible and hard-working people and is represented by  Roció, the bank president, who is single and makes handicrafts from fabric and yarn.  Roció is a responsible and hard-working young woman who is solely responsible for supporting her household.  She will use her loan money to buy fabric, yarn and threads for making her handicrafts.  She is a hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads to make handicrafts

loans.name: Carmen De María

texts.es: Carmen D. María D. cuarenta y dos años vive con su compañero D. vida y sus cinco hijos. Ella fabrica y venD. canastos a base D. vara D. bambú, trabaja arduo todos los días desD. muy temprano para elaborar y poder salir a vender también, ya posee mucha clientela pues su producto es D. muy buena calidad y los da a precios accesibles. Carmen tiene un don su trabajo es inigualable y digno D. admirar, está dispuesta a ver crecer su negocio y enfrentara todo los obstáculos es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima por mayor como vara D. bambú para seguir fabricando canastos y satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes. Carmen D. María tiene la confianza que su esfuerzo en el trabajo le ayudara a darle a su familia seguridad económica y una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Carmen D. Maria is forty-two years old and she lives with her life partner and their five children. She makes and sells bamboo baskets. She works arduously every day from the very early morning to produce and to sell. She has many customers especially because her products are of very good quality and her prices are accessible. Carmen is gifted in her craft. It is incomparable and worthy of admiration. She is ready to see her business grown and to face any obstacles. She requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) and it will help her to purchase materials in wholesale, including bamboo stems, to keep making her baskets and to satisfy the needs of her clients. Carmen D. Maria believes that the efforts she invests in her business will help her proviD. her family with financial security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo stems.

loans.name: Fredy Agustin

texts.es:
El señor Fredy es un pequeño comerciante, su negocio es la venta de verdura, ubicado en el mercado, anteriormente puso una pulperia, que no lleno las espectativas, el cual decide seguir vendiendo verduras.Ha tenido dificultadescon sus ventas, el cual ha logrado equelibrar y seguir adelante, para el bienestar de su familia.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien ayuda en el mercado, es padre de un hijo, y cuenta con su propia casa, poco tiempo de vivir, el cual esta contento. 
Hoy en dia su negocio esta estable gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en dos ciclos. con este nuevo prestamo comprara verduras y frutas como: sandia, naranja, melon, granadilla, aguacate, ayote, yuca, sanahoria, chayote, pepino, repollo, remolacha entre una variedad mas de rica de verduras fresca y accesible de precio.
texts.en:
Sr. Fredy is a small merchant who has a business selling vegetables at the market. He previously owned a grocery store, but that business did not meet his expectations. Fredy decided to sell vegetables. He had difficulty making sales, but he was able to stabilize his business and move forward for the sake of his family.

Fredy manages his business at the market with the help of his wife. They have one child and own a home in which they have lived for just a short amount of time, which makes him happy.

Today Fredy’s business is stable because of the loans from AFODENIC. He has participated in two loan cycles. This new loan will be used to buy vegetables and fruits such as watermelons, oranges, melons, passion fruit, avocados, squash, cassava, carrots, chayote, cucumbers, cabbages, beets, and a variety of other fresh produce at an affordable price.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: La Ilucion Group

texts.es: Banco D. emprendimiento  La Ilución entrando a su tercer ciclo conformado por 9 integrantes que viven en la localidad del Torno, en la zona Miraflores, todos cuentan con una actividad o servicio.   La presidenta es Sra. María vive en la zona hace unos 16 años en el Zona Miraflores Su actividad es la venta D. Cds y Dvds en el mercado central el torno y también trabaja como empleada domestica en un  condominio D. la zona hace 3 años,   su estado civil esta casada con el sr.  Víctor el cual es chofer y tienen 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito comprar DVD por mayor en películas para niños, son una familia muy unida ambos aportan para los gastos del hogar, se sacrifican para sacar a sus hijos adelante, el deseo D. la Sra. es el D. poder ver a sus hijos profesionales, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
La Ilución Communal Bank, entering its third loan cycle, is maD. up of nine members who live in the town of El Torno, in the Miraflores area. All of them have a business or proviD. services. The president is Sra. Maria who has been living in the Miraflores area for some 16 years. Her business is selling CDs and DVDs in El Torno’s central market and she has also been employed as a domestic worker in a condominium in the area for the past 3 years. She is married to Sr. Victor, who is a chauffeur, and they have 3 school-aged children. With the money from this loan, she plans to buy DVDs of children’s films wholesale.  

She and her husband are a very united family: both contribute to household expenses and make sacrifices so their children can get ahead. Sra. Maria’s wish is to see her children become professionals. She is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To buy DVDs of children's films

loans.name: Kev

texts.en:
Mrs. Kev is an old mother of three children. Two of her children are school-aged, and another daughter is working as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh city where she can earn enough money. Currently, Kev is a farmer in Baray District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. Her husband is also a farmer. From farming, she can earn about $2 each day.

Apart from this business, Kev and her husband also earn additional income by raising pigs. Kev wants to purchase some pigs but lacks the money.  So, Kev and her husband would like to request some funds from Kiva in order to purchase piglets. Their future expectation is to have a bigger business, bigger house, and at least a bachelor's degree for their children. Kev said that she is very thankful to all lenders that help her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Siomara Esperanza

texts.es:
Siomara, vive con dos hijas una de dos años y la otra de 5, ella se dedica  a la venta de variedades, ropa, perfumería, cosméticos y accesorios de fantasía, ella aprendió de su madre a ser comerciante, desde muy joven cuenta con experiencia.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para hacer pan, como harina, azúcar y leche, ya que piensa ofrecer a los clientes pan, el préstamo le ayudara para ofrecer un nuevo producto y mejorar las ventas.
El objetivo de Siomara es  montar una cafetería y junto mantener el bazar de variedades, desarrollándose como comerciante y mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Siomara lives with her two daughters, ages 1 and 5. She sells a variety of goods such as clothing, perfumes, cosmetics, and costume jewelry. She learned the retail trade from her mother and has been gaining experience since she was a young girl.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for making bread such as flour, sugar, and milk. She plans to offer bread to her customers. This loan will allow her to offer a new product and improve her sales.

Siomara’s goal is to open a cafeteria while maintaining her variety store. She will continue to develop as a businesswoman and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has owned a poultry shop since 2010. His shop is an important source of income for his family. Lebanon has many poultry shops, and it‘s easy to buy chickens in one’s village or neighborhood. 

During the past year, he was able to build a good business reputation due to the fresh goods that he offers to his clients. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a refrigerator to help him preserve food products. He is very positive and hopes to achieve substantial growth with the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to help him preserve food products.

loans.name: Domingo De Jesus

texts.es:
Domingo, tiene cuarenta y cuatro años de edad, es casodo con dos hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar.
domingo a cude a los oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo prestamo para su carpinteria, este sera utilizado en la compra de madera para hacer puertas y ropero. ha trabajado cuatro creditos con la ceprodel y todos estos han sido para el negocio. agradece a ceprodel por brindarle la oportunidad ya que con estos prestamos ha tenido una mejor economia en su negocio y en su familia.
texts.en: Domingo is 44 years old, married and has two school age children.  Domingo comes by the Ceprodel offices to request a new loan for his carpentry shop that will be used to buy lumber to make doors and armoires.  He has had four Ceprodel loans that have all been for his business.  He thanks Ceprodel for providing him with an opportunity because with the loans he’s had an improved economy both in his business and in his family.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  She works hard to provide for her family. Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years.  She also earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Analiza is requesting a loan for 14,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more stock to sell.  Analiza has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF.   Analiza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Milagros tiene 27 años de edad y tiene una relación de un libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad Huyro de la provincia de La Convención. Actualmente, Milagros vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Milagros es la venta de comida típica o de la región como por ejemplo cuy al horno, asado de codero, rocoto relleno y otros más. Desde tres años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Milagros requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, verduras, arroz y la otra parte lo utilizara para el mantenimiento de la casa. Su sueño de Milagros es construir un hotel. 
  
Milagros agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Milagros belongs to the communal bank “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo” (New Hope of Ollantaytambo), and the member meetings occur every 30 days in the city of Ollantaytambo which is in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.  

Milagros is 27 years old, and she is in a common law marriage and has two children. She was born in the city of Huyro, in the La Convención province. Currently, Milagros lives in the city of Ollantaytambo and she works there. Milagro’s primary business is selling food that is traditional in her region like roasted guinea pig, roasted lamb, stuffed bell peppers, etc. She’s run this business for three years, and it’s going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

Milagros asks for a loan at this time to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, and rice, and she will use a portion for home maintenance. Milagros’ dream is to build a hotel. Milagros appreciates and values the loan, and she is committed to making her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, and rice and to spend on home maintenance.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is a hardworking businesswoman aged 58. She is married and blessed with six children, one of whom is in school. For the last 32 years, she has been running a cereal shop to bring up her family. She also sells charcoal to increase her income. She has employed one person to assist her to manage the business. Paulina has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she plans to establish a wholesale business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. Paulina has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is 33 years old, married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her largest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. For the last six years, Mwanajuma has earned a living by selling leso, a type of cloth that is very popular in East Africa. Her business is very seasonal, but she dreams of someday owning a store where she can sell her products. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 10,000 to buy more leso cloth to sell to her customers. She joined Yehu to access loans that would allow her to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magdalena, se dedica a la venta de pollos de engorde, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, ella inicio la granja por cuenta propia, y tiene 8 meses  de estar en el negocio, les vende a los vecinos y amigos cercanos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de más pollos pequeños y comprar concentrado y vacunas, toda esta inversión para aumentar en la temporada navideña, ya que en ese mes los clientes aumentan sus pedidos de pollo.
La aspiración de Magdalena es seguir con su pequeña granja, aumentándola cada día, para generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Magdalena sells broiler chickens. She lives with her husband and three children. She started the farm as a self-employment venture, and has been in business for eight months. She sells to neighbors and friends who live nearby. 

She is applying for the loan, in order to buy more small chickens, and to buy concentrate and vaccinations. All of this investment is to increase production for the Christmas season, as in that month, customers increase their chicken orders.

Magdalena's ambition is to continue with her small chicken farm, expanding it every day, so that she can generate income for her family.

loans.use: To buy small chickens, concentrate, and vaccinations.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor de 47 años, es una mujer valiente. Hace poco enviudó y sola cuidó de sus 3 hijos, a los que todos los días alimenta en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huachac. Desde que sufrió la pérdida de su esposo tubo que afrontar las responsabilidades del hogar junto a sus hijos, que en ese entonces eran unos niños y con el tiempo han solidificado sus esfuerzos, tanto así que hoy tiene varias cabezas de ganado vacuno y ovino a parte de ello cuenta con algunos terrenos donde cultiva hortalizas, papa y quinua, los cuales después de cada cosecha, vende muy bien. Cuenta que algunas verduras más las que le compra a sus vecinos, los ofrece a la capital del país. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura es revisar que sus terrenos de cultivo  estén con sus plantaciones saludables, ya que esto garantiza una buena cosecha  y por consiguiente buenas ganancias, lo que cosecha lo llevara en los próximos meses al mercado de su ciudad. Su mayor anhelo seguir creciendo y mejorar la raza de sus vacas, como también crecer en el negocio. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “abejitas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente contenta de  ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Flor de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío de papa.
texts.en:
Flor, age 47, is a valiant woman. Recently widowed and having to take care of her three children by herself, she spends every day trying to feed her household. Flor lives in the town of Huanchac. Since suffering the loss of her husband, she had to take over the responsibilities of her home and her children. Over time, she has focused her efforts and now has several heads of cattle and sheep as well as some land on which she grows vegetables, potatoes, and quinoa. After harvesting each crop, her sales have done very well. Flor keeps some of her vegetables, but most of them are sold to her neighbors. She also sells her goods in the capital. What she enjoys most about farming is being able to survey her land in order to keep her crops healthy. This guarantees a good crop and profitable earnings. Within the next few months, she will take her harvest to the market in her city. Her greatest wish is to continue growing and improving the breed of her cattle, as well as grow in her business.

Flor is a member of the Communal Bank “Abejitas” (Little Bees) and is receiving her fourth loan with MFP. She is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. For this reason, she promises to be punctual with her loan payments. With the support she will receive, Flor will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizers for her next planting of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Dolores Armida

texts.es:
Dolores, se dedica a la venta de verduras, pescado y granos básicos, es madre soltera de dos niños, ella tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio, son 12 años los que lleva trabajando.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de verdura fresca, como papas, yuca, güisquiles, repollo, zanahoria, ya que esta teniendo demanda por lo que considera que este préstamo le ayude a mejorar el servicio.
Su aspiración es mantener una buena estabilidad en el comercio, que su negocio sea prospero para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, apoyando siempre a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores sells vegetables, fish and basic grains; she is a single mother to two children. Dolores has a lot of experience in her business since she has worked in her field for 12 years.

At present, Dolores needs a loan to buy fresh vegetables like potatoes, yucca, chayotes, cabbage, and carrots since she has a demand for these products and considers that this loan will help her improve her services.

Dolores’ dream is to keep good stability with her trade, that her business will thrive, meet all of her families’ needs and to always care for her children.

loans.use: buy potatoes, yucca, chayotes, cabbage and carrots.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La socia sigue siendo profesora de computacion y tambien ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,aceite y leche,por medio de su trabajo y de su pequeño negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y mejorar en su trabajo como profesora.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ruth continues being a computer teacher.  She is now also devoted her business, a grocery story.  She sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, oil, and milk.  Through her work and her small business she wants to get ahead.

Her dream is to expand her grocery store business and to improve in her work as a teacher.

She is requesting the loan to buy products wholesale like rice, sugar, milk, and oil for her store.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale like rice, sugar, milk, and oil for her store.

loans.name: Nyahuka Joint Womengp Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, whose hand is raised in the group photograph, is a 36-year-old married woman with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a hardworking woman who deals in selling foodstuffs like rice, beans and ground nuts. She has been in this business since 2001 and has benefited a lot from the business, including paying school fees for her children. The price fluctuation of agricultural products is her major challenge as she hopes to become a wholesaler.

She wants the loan to buy beans, rice and ground nuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and ground nuts for the business

loans.name: Twizerane Group

texts.en:
TWITEZIMBERE is a group led by Mwamini, who is 40 years old. She is married with three children, aged between 4 and 12 years. They all go to school.

The group name means “Trust each other” in English. She sells clothes and has been doing a business for the past six years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and dresses to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Maria Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is 28 years old living in Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon. She has 2 beautiful sons and for that reason she works hard every day and she tries to give them the best from herself. She considered is to be a very harmonious, friendly and hard-working person. Her husband is a mechanic but his salary is lower and not enough to cover all the family expenses, so Rebeca decided to start her own business. Now she is running shoes by catalogue sales business, from that way Rebeca receivesan extra income for her family and can assist and cover all the basic necessities from her family like food and studies.

She needs a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise and have an stock of her products, from that way Rebeca has the opportunity to have more product and has a bigger variety of shoes. She expects this Christmas season her sales will be better than other years, she hopes for your help and generosity.

** (This text has been translated from the following original business description.)

Rebeca tiene 8 años de vivir en Cadereyta, Nuevo León, tiene 2 hijo pequeñitos por los que todos los días tiene que trabajar y dar lo mejor de ella misma. Se caracteriza como una persona muy armoniosa, amigable y trabajadora, su esposo es un mecánico automotriz pero su sueldo es insuficiente para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Así que Rebeca decidió iniciar su propio negocio y se dedica a vender zapatos por catalogo, de este modo Rebeca percibe un ingreso extra para su familia con el que se pueden atender y cubrir las necesidades básicas de la familias como la comida y los estudios.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar mercancía y tenerla en existencia, de esta manera Rebeca tiene la oportunidad de tener más producto y vender una mayor cantidad de zapatos, ella espera que en esta temporada de Navidad su ventas se incrementen al doble y espera de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Simih

texts.en:
Simah is a widow with four children. Her oldest son Pudin, 25 years old, has his own business of making bricks. She is a member of MBK who has requested her second loan of $100. Simah has been running her general store business long before becoming a member of MBK. A portion of the loan will be used to purchase merchandise for her store, while the rest will be used for her son's business. In a day Simah can generate IDR 70,000 of sales with IDR 10,000 of profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.en:
Ana Bertha is a single woman who is very entrepreneurial and hardworking. At first she looked for employment in her city, but because of the lack of work there, she decided to open her own business. She started looking for extra income because her mother is sick and Ana Bertha needs to pay for her medicine. For that reason, when she couldn't find work, she decided to open, in her own home, a little place to rent computers with access to the internet. Because she needed to care for her mother, she had to be close to home, and she also did not have the means to rent a space, so the best decision was to open the business in her house. She already has about a year in this business, and her brother helps her with it.

Ana Bertha is soliciting a loan for $475 for the purchase of computers. Her business has been going well and she has many people who need internet access and she has no way to supply them. She hopes for your collaboration in making it possible for more people to have access to this indispensible thing, and at the same time to improve her business. She offers to repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months, and thanks you for your support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ana Bertha es una mujer soltera, quien es muy emprendedora y trabajadora, ella inicialmente busco empleo en su ciudad pero por la falta de trabajo en la misma, decidió abrir su propio negocio. Inició a buscar ingresos extras debido a que tiene a su madre enferma y tenía que pagar las medicinas para su mamá, por ello al no conseguir un empleo decidió abrir en su propio domicilio un pequeño espacio para rentar computadoras con acceso a Internet, ya que como tenía que estar al cuidado de su mamá, tenía que estar cerca de su casa y como tampoco tenía los medios para rentar un local fue su mejor decisión abrirlo en casa, ya tiene con su negocio aproximadamente un año y su hermano la ayuda en el mismo.

Ana Bertha esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 475 para la compra de computadoras, ya que le ha ido bien y tiene mucha gente que requiere del acceso a Internet, y ya no tiene como abastecerse, por ello espera de tu colaboración para así hacer posible que cada vez más gente tenga acceso a algo tan indispensable y a la vez mejorar con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses, y agradece por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Acquisition of computers

loans.name: Meedan

texts.en: “My family and I have faced many economic constraints due to which my children were forced to drop out of primary school. In 2006, my husband managed to open a small store from which he earns $3 to $4 per day. I want to help him diversify his business and purchase an additional buffalo to keep at home. While I take care of the animals and milk them, he can sell dairy products at our store. We require a loan to purchase the buffalo.”

loans.use: Purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sovann is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. C. Sovann stays at home to take care of her children.

Her husband currently earns $2 a day as a construction worker. He would like to purchase a motorcycle and a cart so that he may become a tuk-tuk driver. C. Sovann anticipates that he could earn an extra $3 a day to support the family.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle and a cart with which to operate a business

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Mrs. Sara O. is 60 years old and is extremely active living in Acahay, Paraguay. She is a retired teacher, however, she still helps out at the private high school. In addition, Sara also runs her own telephone hub, a store that allows people to use phones to call anywhere they choose for a specific fee. She also makes yogurt and ice cream, which she sells to different companies.

Sara was not able to have her own children, however, she cares for her two nephews as if they are her own. They are her daily inspiration. Sara has had to overcome many obstacles in her life. When she was younger, her mother died so as a teenager, Sara has had to support herself. She was forced to work and study at the same time. During this time, she worked as a domestic servant and studied at night. Thanks to her dedication and intelligence, she was able to receive her teaching degree. This work has supported her for many years.

Her telephone hub is well-equipped and popular in the neighborhood. In addition to this store, Sara owns a van, which she uses to deliver the yogurt and ice cream she makes. Her next goal is to buy some land so that she can open another telephone salon in a new location.

At this time, the loan she is seeking will go towards buying a fax machine.

loans.use: To buy a fax machine.

loans.name: Lina Alicia

texts.es:
Lina belongs to the community bank "Las Colinas", and lives in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 52 years old, separated and the mother of 2 grown children, who admire their mother very much for the sacrifices she maD. to raise them. Her income was not enough to cover household expenses, so Lina, with her first loan from Manuel Ramos, decided to invest in the purchase and sale of shoes which she herself makes, baby clothing, decorations, etc.

Currently she sells clothing, towels, decorations and toys for the Christmas season. Her business is located in her home, where her clients come to buy products because they trust her good taste in the shoes, decorations and clothing she sells.

With a loan from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy 1 kilo of fabric, 30 pairs of shoes, material for decorating shoes and clothing, 2 dozen children´s toys and 1 dozen sheets (bed clothing).

Lina is very pleased to share her experience with other women, to tell them not be afraid to start up a business by themselves, as women as very capable and enterpreneurial. She encourages women to approach the Manuela Ramos organization and feels very content and happy for what she has achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Colinas”, vive en Jr. C. Calvo Araujo 778, del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años D. edad, está separada y es madre 2 hijos que ya son mayores D. edad y que admiran mucho a su mama por el sacrificio que hizo para criarlos, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para sus gastos familiares, es así que Lina, con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos deciD. invertir en la compra y venta D. zapatos que ella misma confecciona, ropa D. bebes, adornos, etc.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. ropa, toallas, adornos y juguetes para fiestas naviD.ñas, su negocio está ubicado en su misma casa, donD. llegan sus clientas para adquirir sus productos ya que confían en el buen gusto que tiene Lina en la confección D. sus zapatos y así mismo con los adornos y ropa que venD..

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 kilo telas, 30 pares zapatos, 1 ciento D. materiales para adornar los zapatos y vestidos, 2 docenas D. juguetes para niños y 1 docena D. sabanas (ropa D. cama).

Lina nos esperó muy ansiosa y contenta porque quería compartir su experiencia con las demás mujeres y decirles que no tengan miedo a poner un negocio solas, que las mujeres somos muy capaces y emprendedoras y que nos acerquemos sin dudar a la institución D. Manuela Ramos , donD. Lina se siente muy contenta y feliz por los logros obtenidos.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, shoes, toys, and bed clothing (sheets).

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 43-year-old Joyce M., who is married with two children.

In 1995, Joyce established a business packaging and selling health foods and nutritional supplements for children. Joyce has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $1,075 in order to purchase additional ingredients and packaging materials in bulk.

Joyce is a perfect example of why microfinance works and why the large majority of clients repay their loans. A lot of people who hear about microfinance (or kiva.org) for the first time, ask anxiously, “but how do you make sure people pay back? Won’t they just take the money?”

The implication is that the clientele who access microfinance (usually the ‘poor’) are less trustworthy, efficient or educated than ‘ordinary’ people. Whether or not this is true is somewhat irrelevant, for a number of reasons.

First, most MFIs have due diligence processes in place to assess client risk, as well as measures such as collateral arrangements and group lending (where a defaulted loan is borne by the group as a whole) to address this risk.

More important than any of these deterrents, however, is an incentive.

The incentive clients have to start a business, build a business, and repay their loan so that they can get another and another and another…The incentive to have ongoing access to financial services from which they had previously been excluded.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and materials for packaging in bulk.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. A. married in 1979 and has three children; two sons and one daughter. Both of her sons live with her and her daughter has married and has her own family. Mrs. A. is one of the rice wine makers in the village while her husband, Sek Saroeurn, is a motor taxi driver. She is in her late 50's but still strong enough to work. They both were unable to finish the primary school, but they try to earn money to support the two sons so they may attend school. Their house is about 11 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. A. is requesting a loA. for the third time in the amount of $700 to buy more rice and rice husk to make rice wine.

loans.use: To purchase rice and rice husk

loans.name: Raquel Lourdes' Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe, Raquel and Gloria belong to the Communal Bank “Musuq Rumi,” which means “New Stone” in Quechua, for 1 year, 1 year, and 8 months respectively.

In their Communal Bank they learned to be punctual, responsible, learned about nutrition and above all how to save money.

Guadalupe is married, 45 years old, and has 6 children. Guadalupe sells “salchipapas” (a dish maD. with potatoes and fried chicken) from her home’s door every evening, an activity she has been doing for 1 year. In addition, Guadalupe works during the day in construction. Guadalupe is planning to travel to area markets to buy cheese, grains and then sell them in Ayacucho city.

Raquel is married, 37 years old, with 6 children. Raquel travels to different markets in the region where she sells groceries and fruit; from the markets she bring grains, small animals, and cheese as products to sell in the Ayacucho markets.

Gloria is married, 54 years old, and has 7 children. Gloria has a store in her home where she sells groceries and vegetables.

Guadalupe, Raquel and Gloria need loans of 400 soles, 200 soles, and 400 soles respectively, and the money will be invested in the purchase of barley, cheese, wheat, beans, sugar and rice.

They will use their savings to educate their children and increase their earnings.

Guadalupe, Raquel and Gloria dream of having a store in their homes, that their children will be professionals, and having more capital for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Guadalupe, Raquel y Gloria pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Musuq Rumi”, que significa “Nueva Piedra” en quechua, hace 1 año, 1 año y 8 meses respectivamente.

En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables, acerca D. nutrición y sobre todo a ahorrar.

Guadalupe es casada, tiene 45 años y 6 hijos, Guadalupe venD. salchipapas (comida hecha con papas y pollo frito) en la puerta D. su casa todas las noches, actividad que realiza hace 1 año. Además Guadalupe durante el día trabaja en actividades D. construcción. Guadalupe tiene pensado viajar a las ferias para comprar queso, cereales y luego comercializarlo en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Por otro lado, Raquel es casada, tiene 37 años y 6 hijos, Raquel viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región donD. venD. abarrotes, frutas y D. las ferias trae cereales, animales menores y queso, productos que venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Mientras que Gloria es casada, tiene 54 años y 7 hijos, Gloria tiene una tienda donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, ubicado en su casa.

Guadalupe, Raquel y Gloria necesitan préstamos D. 400 soles, 200 soles, 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cebada, queso, trigo, habas, azúcar y arroz.

Sus ahorros lo utilizaran en la educación D. sus hijos y para incrementar el capital D. sus negocios.

Los sueños D. Guadalupe, Raquel y Gloria son tener una tienda en su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener más capital para sus negocios.

loans.use: Guadalupe, Raquel and Gloria need loans of 400 soles, 200 soles, and 400 soles respectively, and the money will be invested in the purchase of barley, cheese, wheat, beans, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a divorced woman. She lives in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon. She used to work as a teacher in an elementary school, but now she is retired. She has a daughter who is a student.

After her retirement she started to sell beauty products with some of her friends, relatives and neighbors. Now, she has a large customer base and has also incorporated the sale of food supplements into her business, which has been very well-received by her clients.

In order to grow her business Catalina needs a loan of $850 to purchase more merchandise. She promises to pay this back in six months. You can help her to have a successful business. She will appreciate your help.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Essodokam

texts.fr:
Mrs. Essodokam A. was born on December 23rd, 1976 in Pessare in the county of Binah. She is married with one child. In 1998, she started her sewing shop, "Couture Dieu Benit" in the Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. She is a very talented woman and employs a number of young women enjoy learning how to sew and make clothing in her shop. In fact, she has a group of nine young women who are her apprentices. Her business is going well, and she needs more machines to keep up with the work. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase a new sewing machine.

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES.

Madame A. Essodokam est née le 23 décembre 1976 à Pessare dans la préfecture de la BINAH. Elle est mariée et a un enfant. En 1998, elle a crée un atelier de couture « COUTURE DIEU BENIT » dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle est une femme très talentueuse et les jeunes filles aiment apprendre la couture chez elle. Actuellement, elle encadre neuf (9) filles qui sont en apprentissage. Son atelier marche bien et elle a besoin de s’équipier en machines nécessaires pour son métier, c’est d’ailleurs, ce qui l’amène à solliciter ce prêt pour acquérir une machine à plainte.

loans.use: Mrs. Assale will buy a new sewing machine for her shop.

loans.name: Madame Tene

texts.fr:
Mrs. Tene Traoré is a married woman aged 29 and the mother of three children. Faced with a lack of funds for running her fish selling business, she decided to join one of Soro Yiriwaso’s solidarity loan associations. After four solidarity loans, she has moved on to an individual loan. All previous loans were repaid successfully. She buys her stock mainly in Bobo Dioulasso (a town in the West African republic of Burkina Faso) and sometimes in Bamako (Mali’s capital). She plans to use this loan to buy 20 cases of fish and ice on a daily basis. She sells every day along Highway 2000 in Médine, Ségou. Sales are midway between wholesale and retail, or retail, and are generally paid for in cash. Because of the quick turnover of fish, she expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 90,000. This profit will be used to pay the interest on the loan, to pay for ice, for savings, and to contribute to the family’s expenses. She hopes to improve the appearance of her sales location and continue to grow her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Tene Traoré est une femme mariée âgée de 29 ans mère de 3 enfants. confrontée à un problème de fonds de commerce pour mener son activité de vente de poissons, elle décida d’intégrer une association de crédit solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso. Après quatre prêt solidaires, elle est passée au prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle s’approvisionne surtout à Bobo Dioulasso (Une ville de la république du Burkina Faso en Afrique de l’ouest) et quelques fois à Bamako (la capitale du Mali). Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 20 cartons de poissons de mer et de la glace quotidiennement. Elle vend tous les jours au bord de l’auto route 2000 à Médine Ségou. La vente se fait en demi gros ou en détail et généralement au comptant. En raison de la rotation rapide de l’activité de vente de poissons, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, payer la glace, épargner et participer aux charges de la famille. Elle compte améliorer la présentation de son lieu de vente et continuer à augmenter la taille de son activité.

loans.use: To buy cases of fish

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa has been dedicated to the sale of cosmetics from a catalog for 10 years. Her neighbors know that she sells beauty products, so they always go to her to buy them. She has also sold clothes to order for 3 years.

In addition, Rosa has worked doing maintenance in a doctor's office for 4 years.

The loan that she has requested will serve to pay the debts that she has and to have a stock of cosmetic products in her house.

Rosa would like to fix up a large patio outside her house to serve as a store-bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 10 años. Sus vecinos saben que ella vende productos belleza, por lo que siempre la buscan para comprarle. También, vende ropa por pedidos desde hace 3 años.

Asimismo, Rosa trabaja haciendo mantenimiento en un consultorio desde hace 4 años.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para pagar las deudas que tenía, y para tener un stock de productos cosméticos en su casa.

Rosa quisiera arreglar el amplio patio exterior de su casa y poner una tienda-bazar.

loans.use: To buy a stock of cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Felista's Muungano Group

texts.en:
Felista is 30 years old. She is a married woman with 1 child aged 10. She has owned and run a small pharmacy since 2005. She works everyday from 6.30am to 9pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Felista requests a loan to buy more medicine and medical items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatuma, who has a business selling charcoal.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Thi Loan's Group

texts.vi:
chị Nguyễn thị Loan năm nay 28 tuổi Ms 11040037 là một phụ nữ trẻ nhưng đầy nghị lực. Chị đã từng lấy chồng và có 1 con trai, nhưng vì sống không hạnh phúc nên anh chị đã ly hôn. Hiện nay chị đang sống cùng con trai, hàng ngày chị vừa làm ruộng, nuôi lợn, nhận hàng về nhà làm thuê, nên mức thu nhập của gia đình khá ổn định từ 300.000 VND đến 350.000 VND/ tuần. Chị rất thích hình thức trả dần nên chị đăng ký vay mức 3.186.000 VND để sửa chuồng lợn, mua phân đạm để bón lúa. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Hằng Ms 11040038 vay mức 1.534.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hạt Ms 11040039 vay mức 1.534.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Mỵ Ms 11040040 vay mức 1.062.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • chị Ngô thị Phan Ms 11040041 vay mức 1.062.000 VND mua cám lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Trai Ms 11040021 vay mức 590.000 VND để mua phân bón lúa
  • chị Nguyễn thị Quang Ms 11040042 vay mức 354.000 VND để mua thức ăn gia súc
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn thị Loan is 28 years old. Despite her young age, she is full of energy and has a strong will. She was married and has 1 son but things did not work out with her husband so they divorced. She is living with her son. Everyday she works in her rice field, raises pigs, works as a contractor at home. Her income is stable, 300.000 - 350.000 VND a week. She likes SEDA program a lot. She is applying for a loan of 3.186.000 VND to repair the pig pen, buy fertilizer. Other members in her group are:
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Hằng, she needs 1.534.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Hạt, she needs 1.534.000 VND to raise pigs
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Mỵ, she needs 1.062.000 VND to buy breeding pigs
  • Mrs Ngô thị Phan Ms, she needs 1.062.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Trai, she needs 590.000 VND to buy fertilizer
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Quang, she needs 354.000 VND to buy feed for her livestock

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to raise pigs

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
El Señor Gavino A. de 31 años de edad está acompañado con la señora Reina Isabel Figueredo, cabe destacar que viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Cambyreta. 

Se dedica a la compra-venta de mercaderías de primera necesidad desde Posadas (Argentina) hasta Encarnación (Paraguay), se dedica al rubro hace más de 7 años. 
El señor Gavino ha solicitado el crédito para la compra de mercaderías, especialmente cemento  y como este producto está en crisis de escasez en el mercado desea aprovechar la oferta en el vecino país y comercializarlo aquí en Paraguay.
texts.en:
Mr. Gabino A. is 31 years old. He is married to Mrs. Reina Isabel Giueredo, and it is worth noting that they own their home in the city of Cambryeta. Gabino buys basic goods in Posadas (Argentina) and sells them in Encarnación (Paraguay). He has been in this business for more than 7 years. Gabino has asked for a loan to buy merchandise, especially cement, which is currently scarce. Gabino would like to take advantage of the cement supply in neighboring Argentina and sell it here in Paraguay.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of cement

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa M. se dedica con gran esfuerzo al negocio de venta de reposterías en las afueras del mercado central de Chinandega.

Ella se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 19 años y gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel ha mejorado por lo que ahora ha comprador una vitrina para almacenar las reposterías. La razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un nuevo crédito para continuar con la mejora de su negocio y así brindar las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo
texts.en:
Mrs Rosa M. works very hard in the sale of pastries in the area outside of the central market of Chinandega.

She has worked in the business for the past 19 years and thanks to the support that Ceprodel has provided her she has made improvements which is why she has purchased a display cabinet to store her pastries. The reason why she has come to Ceprodel is to apply for a new loan to continue improving her Business and in this way provide the conditions necessary for its development.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of pastries.

loans.name: Srey Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Neang O. is a farmer and lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Srey Neang O. is 26 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Phoeng Horn, is presented on her right in the photo.

Mrs. Srey Neang O. owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband uses the rice to make wine for his business. The plot of land is infertile and she does not have oxen to plow the fields. Mrs. Srey Neang O. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her land. She will use the rest of the money to buy pesticides to protect her crops from insects.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticides and hire oxen to plow her fields

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 40 years old and married with 5 children. Doris molds and sells traditional clay pots. After molding the clay pots, she takes the clay pots to the local market to sell. She hopes to expand this business by meeting the needs of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more clay to produce more traditional clay pots. Doris says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clay to produce more clay pots

loans.name: Switberitha K.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Switberitha M. from Tukuyu. She is divorced with 2 children, aged 5 and 24. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 1 dependent because he is an orphan. Switberitha has been running a bar since 1992. Her business is selling drinks such as beer and soft drinks.

Switberitha works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by 1 employee. Switberitha currently earns about 540 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 1175 USD in order to purchase additional stock of drinks for her bar. In the future, she plans to sell drinks on a wholesale basis. Switberitha thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of drinks for her bar

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es:
Edilberta es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Edilberta es viuda, tiene 55 años y 10 hijos, Edilberta vende golosinas, frutas en la puerta de un colegio ubicado en el distrito de Carmen Alto, Edilberta también se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallina, conejo.
Edilberta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chocolates, galletas, caramelos.
Edilberta sueña con terminar de construir su casa, tener una tienda y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Edilberta is a member of the Communal Bank “Pura Vida”. She is 55 years old, a widow, and has 10 children. She sells small treats and fruits near the entrance of a high school located in the district of Carmen Alto. Edilberta also breeds and raises animals such as chickens and rabbits. She needs a loan of 1,000 new soles to purchase more merchandize such as chocolates, cookies, and candies for her retail business. Edilberta dreams of finishing the construction of her house, owning her own store, and helping her children reach the culmination of there studies.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chocolates, cookies, and candies

loans.name: Ni Luh Murtini

texts.id:
Melalui organisasi di desanya Ni Luh Murtini mendapakan dana dari Yayasan DINARI.  Pada periode kedua dana pinjaman itu dipergunakan untuk menambah modal dalam usaha jual beli gula merah. Pada periode pertama, Ni Luh Murtini mendapat cukup keuntungan untuk kebutuhannya dan keluarga. Saat ini ia ingin mengembangkan usahanya dengan cara membeli lebih banyak gula merah dari petani sehingga ia akan mendapat lebih banyak keuntungan. Ni Luh Murtini sangat terbantu dengan adanya pinjaman ini karena dengan  dana ini ia  dapat melanjutkan usahanya. 
Suaminya sudah beberapa lama meninggal. Saat ini Ni Luh Murtini tinggal bersama dengan kedua anaknya yang masih sekolah tingkat pertama dan tingkat dasar.
Ni Luh Murtini sangat mengantungkan hidupnya dari usaha ini sebagai sumber pendapatan dalam keluarganya. Hampir setiap hari Ni Luh Murtini dapat memperoleh keuntungan bersih sekitar Rp. 40.000.- s/d Rp. 50.000.-  yang sangat berarti dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Through an organization in her village, Ni Luh Murtini obtained her first loan from DINARI foundation. She plans to use the second loan to increase her working capital to purchase more "red sugar." In the first period, Ni Luh Murtini obtained enough profit to fulfill her family's need. Currently she plans to expand her business by purchasing more "red sugar" from farmers so she can increase her business profitability. Ni Luh Murtini benefited tremendously from the loan as her husband has passed away. Currently Ni Luh Murtini lives with her 2 children that are studying in grade school. Ni Luh Murtini depends on this business for her livelihood. Each day, Ni Luh Murtini gains net profit of $3.20 to $4 that helps a lot in fulfilling her family's needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Antoine

texts.fr:
G. Antoine est né vers 1982 à Cotonou. Antoine est marié et a deux enfants dont l'aîné seul est scolarisé; le second est encore un bébé. G. Antoine aidait ses parents à faire la pêche. Adulte depuis neuf ans , Antoine recueille avec l'aide d'un groupe d'amis, le sable de la lagune de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin et le revend à un autre exploitant qui, à son tour le revend aux convoyeurs de sable par camion. G. Antoine est à son troisième prêt avec ALIDé.  Antoine dit avoir connu une amélioration substantielle de son niveau de vie depuis qu'il a commencé par avoir de prêts à ALIDé. G. Antoine demande un troisième crédit pour acquérir dans les mois à venir une barque motorisée et commencer par ériger des appartements semi-durs qu'il mettra en location tout en continuant par mener son activité de vente de sable. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Antoine G. was born circa 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. He's married and the father of 2 children, out of which only the elder one attends school, the younger one being still a baby. Antoine G. used to help his parents fish. He's been an adult for 9 years, and he now collects sand in the Cotonou lagoon with a group of friends. He then resells it to another man who, in turn, resells it to truck conveyers. Antoine G. is seeking his third loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé, in order to purchase a motorized small boat in the coming months, and to start building semi-rigid apartments for renting. He will also continue his sand selling business.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two tons of cement and a motorized small boat

loans.name: Alba Edith

texts.es:
Pulpería Albita es el nombre de la pulpería cuya propietaria es la señora Alba C. en la ciudad de Chinandega donde vive actualmente. Es de importancia destacar que la señora Alba se ha dedicado a esta labor desde hace 10 años y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos para continuar comercializándolos.

Por esta razón es que ella espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que su crédito será otorgado y así saldrá adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Alba C. owns a grocery store called Pulpería Albita in the city of Chinandega, where she also lives. It is important to note that Alba has been working in this business for 10 years and now she has come to Ceprodel (a Kiva Partner) to benefit from a loan, which she will use to buy products that she can sell in her store.
For this reason, she has great hope that her loan will be approved and that she will be able to to advance in her business that requires this support.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
V. Shuhrat is 25 years old and has been married for about two years. His wife is a housekeeper.

Shuhrat has been running his business for about two years. He rents a retail store where he sells different kinds of housewares. His business is the family’s main source of income. Shuhrat is trying to have a wide range of goods of good quality to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income.

Today, Shuhrat requests $3000 for the term of 12 months. This is the first time that Shuhrat has asked for a loan through IMON International and Kiva. It will be used to buy more housewares in order to increase the range of his goods. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro-entrepreneur and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new housewares to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Zuhura A. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children, between the ages of 4 and 10. Zuhura has been running a soft drinks business since 2006. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Zuhura currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more inventory. In the future, she plans to open another business. Grace thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: M. Winnie is 45 years old and the mother of two children. She is in the bar business on the beach side of Lake Victoria, serving drinks to the people who go out to the beach for recreation. She has been in her business for 4 years.  She will use this loan to purchase various kinds of drinks to meet her customers' demands. Her future plan is to renovate the rental houses for more tenants.

loans.use: To purchase various kinds of drinks

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra S. was born in 1953. She is a widow and comes from the suburbs of the town of Bratunac. She has KM 650 monthly income. She keeps herself busy working in agriculture and taking care of her livestock. The work is very important for her needs. When she works, she doesn`t think about the bad things from the past.

Now, Zuhra wants to extend her business by buying chicks for fattening and selling. She requested her first loan from WWI (Žene za Žene International) of KM 1,000. Zuhra already has cows and sheep and her little farm will be fully operational when she purchases the chickens.

loans.use: To buy chicks and poultry food

loans.name: Dior Ndiaye

texts.fr: Dior ndiaye C. a vend des tissus, des sacs, et des ustensiles de cuisine aux femmes de son quartier à Mbour  ville située à 80 km de la capitale sénégalaise. Elle est marié  et mère de  famille. Les revenus  tirés du commerce lui permettent de participer aux dépenses du manage  et à l’entretien des enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt pour194  accroitre son activité.
texts.en:
Dior Ndiaye C. sells fabric, bags and cooking utensils to women in her neighborhood in the town of Mbour, located 80 km from the Senegalese capital. She is married with children. The income she makes from her business allows her to contribute to the household expenses and the care of the children. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru: Парвиз Сулаймонов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 23 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Парвиз имеет высшее образование "юриста". Но Парвиз более 3 лет занимается бизнесом. Он имеет торговую точку, где торгует национальными материалами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Parviz S. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 23 years old, married and has 2 children. Parviz has higher education in law. However, Parviz has been involved in business for over 3 years. He has a retail store, where he sells traditional fabrics. He is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Eligia

texts.en:
Eligia is a member of the Mtwivila borrower group In Kihesa,Iringa,she is 33 years old woman,she is widowed and a mother of 3 children.her children are aged 16,14,11 years.

Eligia started her own business selling chicken 4years ago,she works 11 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Eligia`s first loan from BRAC Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 In order to buy more chicken for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Eligia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more chicken

loans.name: Opoku

texts.en: Opoku is forty-eight years old. He is married and has six children, four sons and two daughters, who are all still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Opoku is a trader. He trades in foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, maize, etc. He sells in his community and also supplies other food vendors. Opoku procures the goods from nearby communities. He has been in business for seventeen years and wants a loan to buy food items in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina E. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 51 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marcelina joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Natividad

texts.es:
El banco comunal Unión Progresista se encuentra ubicado a unos 45 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, vía a el Valle en la comunidad de Ñariviña, aquí podemos disfrutar de unos hermosos paisajes siendo una comunidad que nos brinda la libertad de estar en el campo, respirar aire puro y admirar la belleza natural de nuestro ciudad.

La señora Rosa Natividad M. vive en el barrio de Pillcha Calchi Chico en la  comunidad de Ñariviña, tiene 26 años, vive en unión libre fruto de esa unión concibió tres  hijos de:  8, 5, 1,5 año de edad, su primera hija estudia en la escuela de la comunidad de Inga Pirca, su hijo de 5 años es minusválido tiene parálisis cerebral epática, no tienen casa propia al momento  viven en una casa pequeña de tablas  prestada por un familiar, mientras que su  esposo trabaja en su aserradero siendo su gran apoyo para sobrellevar la enfermedad de su pequeño hijo.

Rosa  trabaja junto a su esposo en el aserradero, llevan varios años en este negocio, ella debe combinar su trabajo con las actividades del hogar y sobre todo con el cuidado de su hijo que necesita mayor atención y  cuidados especiales.

Dentro de su banco comunal Rosa es una socia muy alegre y solidaria, trabaja junto a la fundación desde hace tres años y nos manifiesta que los créditos recibidos le ha permitido mantener el aserradero bien abastecido,  con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra  de madera para  su negocio, dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes e  incrementar  el mismo para  darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.

El sueño de Rosa es  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The Unión Progresista Communal Bank is located 45 minutes from the city of Cuenca on the way to El Valle in the Ñariviña community. Here we can enjoy the beautiful scenery because it is a community that offers the freedom of being in the country, breathing fresh air, and admiring the natural beauty of our city. Rosa Natividad M. lives in the Pillcha Carchi Chico neighborhood in the Ñariviña community. She is 26 and in a common law marriage. They have three children, ages 8, 5, and 1. Her oldest daughter goes to the Inga Pirca community school. Her five year old son is disabled. He has Cerebral Palsy. They do not have their own house. At the moment they live in a small house made of boards, which a relative lent them. Her husband works in his sawmill. He is a great support in dealing with her small son’s illness. Rosa works with her husband in the sawmill. They have had the business for several years. She has to combine her work with her household chores, especially taking care of her son who needs more attention and special care. Within her communal bank Rosa is a very happy and supportive member. She has worked with the foundation for three years. The loans she has received have allowed her to keep the sawmill well stocked. With the loan from Fundación ESPOIR she will buy wood for her business, give her customers better service, and increase the number of customers she has in order to give her children a better future. Rosa’s dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood to stock her sawmill

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a widow with six children: Edgardo, a farmer; Evangeline, a full-time housewife; Egentor, a farmer; Edmund, a factory worker; Edison, a fisherman; and the youngest, Emma, a factory worker. She also has an adopted child. Narcisa wants to improve her family's standard of living and her motivation in life is to work hard to support her family's needs. The family live in San Pablo, Alicia, Isabela, a rural area. Their house is near an irrigation area and rice farm.

Narcisa has managed a livestock business for more than five years and her net monthly income from her hogs ranges from 2,500 to 5,000 PHP. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva lenders in order to have enough capital to purchase feed supplies. She also wants to have an additional pig pen for her hogs.

loans.use: To buy feed and an additional pig pen

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a 27-year-old married businessman. His business is located at Eldoret in the Rift Valley Province of Kenya.

Bonface runs a store where he sells cooking fat, flour, washing soap, and calling cards, and provides calling services. Bonface sought out a KADET branch and applied for a loan. He intends to use the loan to improve his business by increasing his stock of items. His future plan is to improve his entire business, specifically his M-PESA phone services.

About KADET: 	
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his retail business

loans.name: Ener

texts.es:
Ener es un hombre muy laborioso de 31 años, está casado y es padre de dos hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.

Por más de 16 años se dedica a la extracción de madera de las zonas más recónditas y  profundas de la selva peruana y desde que se casó también empezó a sembrar café en las chacras de sus suegros. Pero lo que más le agrada realizar a Ener en sus tiempos libres (cuando se espera la cosecha) es cortar los arboles, lo hace desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, y después los va cortando con la rapidez y agilidad en sus manos, y el dominio de sus máquinas. Ener corta la madera de acuerdo a las medidas y pulgadas que le solicitan, de ese modo entrega prontamente sus pedidos, y esto le permite captar buen dinero. 
Él es le único en su pueblo que realiza esta actividad, por lo que le resulta rentable, pues todos sus vecinos requieren de su servicio para la fabricación de sus casas de madera. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que se vuelve a comprometer a seguir trabajando con la misma responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita es para compra de sierras, además de fertilizantes químicos para los cultivos que tiene con su esposa.
texts.en:
Ener, 31, is a hard-working, married, father of two children who all live together in their own home.
