For over 16 years he has worked extracting lumber from the deepest and most hidden areas of the Peruvian jungle. Since he got married, he also began to plant coffee on his in-laws' farmlands. What he likes to do most on his spare time (while they are waiting for harvesting), though, is to fell trees. He does this from 4am until 2pm and then, with great speed, agility in his hands and dexterity in handling his machines, he cuts them into lumber according to the measurements and sizes requested. He is able to deliver his orders quickly and this provides him with good earnings. He is the only one in town that does this which makes it very profitable since all his neighbors require the service in order to build their wood houses. This is his second loan with MFP so he, once again, commits to continue to work with the same degree of responsibility and punctuality in his repayments. The money he requests this time is to buy saws as well as chemical fertilizers for the crops he has with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy saws to cut lumber and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia VIRGINIA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 24 años de edad y tiene un hijo varón de tres años. La socia y su hijo viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda de sanck en el terminal terrestre de buses de la provincia de Urubamba donde vende golosinas, galletas, gaseosas y panes a los visitantes que están de paso por esta ciudad. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender más mercadería para estas fiestas navideñas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the communal bank "Llankachinapac." She is 24 years-old and has one three-year-old son. Our member and her son live in the province of Urubamba, located north of the city of Cuzco. Our member has a small snack store in the Urubamba province bus terminal, where she sells candies, cookies, soft drinks, and bread to visitors that pass through the city. She has been working in this business for a few years and it has gone very well, thanks to all the effort she has invested in her work. Virginia is a young mother, hard-working, and enterprising, and wants to get her family ahead. She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise to sell during the Christmas season, allowing her to increase her business capital and earn better profits, and thus be able to provide a better quality of life to her son. Our member is very grateful for the opportunity offered by this institution and promises to make all the payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member needs this loan to purchase more merchandise to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Munhtuul

texts.en:
Munhtuul A., 38, lives with her elderly parents and her 15-year-old daughter, a secondary school student, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Munhtuul has a small business retailing traditional snuff bottles. Snuff bottles are a part of the local culture, and people carry them, especially during national celebrations, and use them while greeting other locals. She sells various precious stone stuff bottles imported from Ereen, China - a border town from which many inexpensive Chinese products are imported. Munhtuul's brother also makes snuff-bottles, which gives them a competitive advantage over others.

Now requesting a loan to purchase more bottles for her business, Munhtuul says that her goal is to build a small house for her family, as she wants them to live in a warm shelter.

loans.use: To purchase more snuff-bottles

loans.name: Kimlun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimlun N., 50, and her husband, Mr. Sarun Yoy, 53, have been married since 1981 and have three sons and two daughters. Three of them have full-time employment and other daughter attends University. The family lives in a small village along national road number 4 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kimlun has been selling medicine in front of her house for two months. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver since 1990. The couple hopes to support their daughter's further education so that she will get a good job when she finishes her studies.

Hence, Kimlun is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to pay for school fees for her daughter.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris le métier de couture et s’est installé depuis 2004 à son propre compte, elle sait très bien coudre, ce qui attire beaucoup de personnes, elle veut associer à son activité la vente des articles de mercerie,raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de 14 rouleaux de popeline, 12 petits rouleaux de fil, des fermetures de pantalon, 5 boîtes  de boutons et divers.
texts.en:
This woman has acquired sewing skills and started her own business in 2004. She is a fine seamstress, which attracts many customers. She would like to diversify her activities by selling haberdashery items, which is why she is requesting a first loan from WAGES. The loan will be used to buy 14 bolts of poplin fabric, 12 small spools of thread, zippers for pants, five boxes of buttons and various other items.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy haberdashery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pharmaceutical drugs for resale

loans.name: Kelly Azucena

texts.es:
La señora  KELY tiene 34 años, vive en el distrito DEL PROVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES DECIDIDAS. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, está casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Se dedica a la venta de ropa que trae de la ciudad de Lima. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles empezó a  viajar a Lima a traer la ropa que le solicitaron sus amistades, familiares y vecinos. 
Ahora con su próximo crédito de 1,200.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para viajar a Lima y cubrir los pedidos de ropa que tiene pendientes como: polos, camisas, blusas, faldas, vestidos, etc. 
Actualmente se encuentra realizando sus ultimas cobranzas para reunir más dinero y ha planinificado viajar a Lima dentro de 2 semanas para realizar las compras de sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Kelly is 34 years old, and she lives in the Del Provenir District, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres Decididas ("Determined Women") Communal Bank. The member finished 11th grade. She is married and has two children who are economically dependent on her. She works selling clothing that she brings from the city of Lima. With her first loan of 300 soles she began to travel to Lima to bring back the clothes that her friends, relatives and neighbors asked her for. Now she will use her next loan of 1,200 soles to travel to Lima and fill the outstanding orders she has for clothes like: polo shirts, shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses, etc. She is currently collecting her final payments in order to raise more money, and she has planned to travel to Lima within 2 weeks to make the purchases for her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing: pants, shirts, blouses, jeans, etc.

loans.name: Gran Fortaleza De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “GRAN FORTALEZA DE SAN JERONIMO”, actualmente se encuentra en el X ciclo y esta conformado por 11 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la distrito de San Jerónimo de la provincia del Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo, venta de cebiche, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de auto partes de carros, venta de comida de forma ambulatoria y venta de artesanía y otros brindan servicio de albañilería y servicios de hospedaje. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Constantina es socia del banco comunal Gran fortaleza de San Jerónimo, tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. La socia Constantina alterna sus actividades del hogar con preparación y venta de comida. Su esposo de la socia Constatina se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la provincia del Cusco. La socia nos cuenta que su esposo sale trabajar a las 4 a.m.  y regresa a las 7 p.m. Constantina lleva desayuno y almuerzo para su esposo todos los días y para sus empleados, ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta y confección de mantas y ponchos. Ella requiere el crédito para su aumentar el capital de su negocio, con una parte del préstamo comprara lana y con la otra parte pagara a su empleado la mano de obra.    

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Gran Fortaleza de San Jeronimo” (Great Fortress of San Jeronimo) is currently in its tenth loan cycle and consists of eleven hardworking and enterprising individuals who look at each moment as an opportunity to succeed. Through their daily efforts, they have been able to provide a better future for their children. The members of this Communal Bank live in the District of San Jerónimo in the Province of Cusco. Cusco is a city known for its archaeological sites, its historical center, its landscapes, and its history for being one of the most charming cities in the southern part of the country.

The business activities of the members include selling ceviche, food, clothing, automobile spare parts, snacks via traveling sales, and handicrafts. Others provide services such as masonry and lodging. The members indicate that the Communal Bank has participated in numerous loan cycles and that they are happy and satisfied with the loan services, savings, and training classes. One ongoing aspect of the Communal Bank that is of value is the group savings account that opens the possibility for building up assets, which is what this service provides.

Constantina is a member of the Communal Bank “Gran Fortaleza de San Jeronimo”. She is 55 years old, married, and has five children. Constantina divides her time between her household activities and her business of preparing and selling food. Her husband manufactures bricks and tiles in the District of San Jerónimo in Cusco Province. Constantina says her husband leaves for work at 4am and returns at 7pm. She takes breakfast and lunch every day to her husband and his employees. In her spare time, she makes and sells blankets and ponchos. She is requesting a loan to increase her business capital. Part of the loan will be used to buy wool and the remainder will be used to pay an employee for performing work by hand.

The members, in general, are grateful for this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool and pay employee wages

loans.name: E. Germain

texts.fr: Né en 1986 à Dangbo dans le département de l'Ouémé, D. E. Germain vit depuis près de 16 ans à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Germain est célibataire et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Germain vit donc seul et assure seul ses différentes charges. Germain a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite la patisserie. En effet, depuis trois ans, Germain fabrique et vend des gâteaux faits à base de farine de blé. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Germain achète ses matières premières. Germain voudrait renforcer son activité et produire davantage de gâteaux afin de se faire plus de clients et plus de revenus. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1986 in Dangbo in the "département" (administrative district) of Ouémé, E. Germain D. has lived for almost 16 years in Sèkandji in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. He is single and has no children yet. He therefore lives alone and covers his various expenses himself. Germain left school during secondary level and afterwards learned the art of "patisserie" or confectionery. In fact, for the past three years, he has been making and selling cakes made from wheat flour. He gets his basic products at Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Germain would like to strengthen his business and produce more cakes in order to get more customers and make more money. It is for this reason that he is applying to ALIDé for a first loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bagsof wheat flour to make cakes

loans.name: Leidi Adai

texts.es: Leidi Adai R. S. de 22 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja haciendo viajes para personas particulares en un pick up, y su pequeño hija de meses de nacido. Leidi posee una venta de zapatos deportivos para niños y adultos, la cual esta ubicada en el centro de Santa Rosa de Lima, en el departamento de La Unión, lugar en el cual cuenta con muchos clientes, ya que es una zona muy concurrida, ya sea por personas del lugar como de otros lados de todo el país las cuales vienen hasta Santa Rosa de Lima,  ya que es un lugar de mucho comercio, donde se puede encontrar todo tipo de artículos a muy bajos precios. Debido a la amplia competencia que posee, Leidi solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de zapatos en diferentes estilos y precios, esto será de mucho utilidad para ella ya que permitirá aumentar sus ventas, las cuales beneficien a su familia en primer lugar, o que es el deseo de Leidi.
texts.en:
Leidi Adai R. S. is 22 years old and she resides in the district of Sonsonate. She lives together with her husband, who works making trips for specific people in a pickup. Leidi also has a baby girl who was born a few months ago. Leidi owns a stand selling sport shoes for kids and adults, located in the center of Santa Rosa, Lima in the district of La Union. La Union is a place which has many customers and it's a very busy area because of locals or others from around the country who have come into Santa Rosa, Lima. La Union has a lot of trade, where you can find all types of articles at very low prices. Owing to the level of competition, Leidi is requesting a loan, through which she can obtain the necessary capital to invest in her business, allowing her to buy larger numbers of shoes in different styles and prices. This will benefit her and allow her sales to increase. The increase in sales will benefit her family first, which is Ledi's desire.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity of shoes

loans.name: San Joaquin Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Joaquín está integrado por cuatro personas trabajadoras. El coordinador del grupo es el señor Pablo Ricardo P. Silva quien vende granos básicos desde hace siete años junto a su esposa.  
Sus compañeros de grupo son José Aviluz Arias B. quien vende ropa y zapatos, Tania Liseth R. M.  que comercializa prendas de oro y plata y Santiago Felipe S. Áreas comerciante de productos varios.
texts.en:
The San Joaquín Group consists of four hardworking individuals. The group coordinator is Sr. Pablo Ricardo P. Silva, who has been selling basic grains with his wife for seven years.

His fellow group members are José Aviluz Arias B. who sells clothing and shoes, Tania Liseth R. M. who sells gold and silver jewelry, and Santiago Felipe S. Áreas who sells various products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Path

texts.en:
Mrs. Path N., 29, owns a small wooden house and a pigpen where she breeds pigs for sale. She is able to raise pigs twice a year and gets some income to ensure that her family avoids financial crises. Path N. became a pig breeder a long time ago and earns an average of $2.50 a day.

She has a life partner in her husband, who is a firewood seller. This couple helps each other in order to earn money to support both their kids, who are dependent on their income. Additional, the family always takes time to farm rice when the farming season approaches.

Path N. is taking out her loan to buy a cow to make it easier to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow farmland.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men S., 42, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in, Cambodia, in an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

S. sells green coconuts for an income of about USD $10 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD $10 per day. Her husband and S. also have a business of using the balloons for people to break.

S. is requesting a loan of USD $1200 to purchase a new motorbike and eggs to grill for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and eggs to grill for sale

loans.name: Kukatornon. Group

texts.en: Yarfee R., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Kukatornon. He is single and has two children who are 6 months and 4 years old. He also cares for three siblings. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty. For 3 years, he has been operating a mini cinema in the Redlight Market community, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 7,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 32,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more of the latest movies. He describes himself as "principle minded." His dream is to become an international business man and educate his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more of the latest movies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase SOAT (mandatory vehicle accident insurance)

loans.name: Bemma Romano Group

texts.en:
Bemma R. is from the village of Sepac Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Bemma is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Shasta Daisy 1.

Bemma is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Bemma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as eggs, noodles, salt, sugar, shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Bemma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bemma is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Adjo Délali

texts.en: Madame Adjo Délali A. is a 25-year-old married woman who works selling men's dress shirts and sheets in Lomé, Togo. She does not have a set location where she sells her products – mostly she carries them with her and sells them as she walks through her neighborhood. Adjo used to work as a secretary but in 2009 she took on this commercial activity as jobs were hard to find and her income was insufficient. She is now taking her second loan from Kiva partner, WAGES, of 300,000 XOF in order to purchase more sheets and dress shirts to sell.

loans.use: To purchase men's shirts and sheets

loans.name: Na We This Ii Group

texts.en:
Alhaji M. T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alhaji was born in Magburaka town. The 29-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have two children. One of the children is in primary school and the other is not of school-going age. 

This is not the first loan that Alhaji and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. A previous SMT/Kiva loan made a lot of improvement in the lives of these borrowers. However, with the help of this new loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to further improve their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Alhaji is a lorry driver and he has been in this profession for 10 years now. He will use this loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora C., 59, a resident of the Municipality of Gen. Mariano Alvarez, Cavite, Philippines. Since she has been widowed, Leonora has been both father and mother to her five children, and grandmother to her darling grandchild. She is blessed with a good and healthy physique which enables her to work hard for her family.

Leonora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Leonora earns by buying supplies at the wholesale price and selling retail in single quantities. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Leonora is requesting a Php 35,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Leonora dreams of being able to give her grandchild a good and high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S., 47, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. is a housewife while her husband is an electronics repairman, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her son.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano de 65 años, es un hombre muy bueno y alegre, esta casado con Eusebia, ellos tienen 7 hijos y viven en su casa propia en el pueblo de Jacahuasi. Él afirma con mucha alegría que todos sus hijos son responsables y 3 de ellos profesionales, “fue por eso que no pude comprar mi terreno”, menciona. Sin embargo está juntando capital para comprar un terreno y poder cultivar mayor cantidad de verduras y de esa manera tener mayor ganancia. Ya tiene 40 años dedicándose a la agricultura y agradece a Dios porque en todo estos años las cosechas fueron buenas; las espinacas y zanahorias que cultiva las vende en el mercado de su ciudad y también en la capital, es lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, el poder viajar. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y está contento de poder pertenecer a la entidad más respetada de su localidad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono orgánico para sus plantaciones de verduras, asimismo contratará peones para que pueda arar la tierra antes de sembrarla.
texts.en: 65-year-old Feliciano is a very good and cheerful man. He is married to Eusebia. They have 7 children and live in their own home in the town of Jacahuasi.  He happily affirms that all of his children are responsible and that three of them are professionals, “that’s why I couldn’t buy my land” he mentioned. However, he is gathering capital to buy land and to be able to cultivate a greater quantity of vegetables, and in this way make a bigger profit. He has worked in agriculture for 40 years already and is grateful to God, because in all those years the harvests were good. He sells the spinach and the carrots that he grows in the city market and also in the capital. Being able to travel is what he likes most about his work. It is his first loan with MFP and he is happy to be able to belong to the most-respected entity in his town. With the loan that he is seeking, he will buy organic fertilizer for his vegetable plantations and will also hire agricultural workers to help him plow the fields before sowing them.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and to hire laborers to help him plow the fields.

loans.name: Budumbuli  East Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Being amiable, evergreen and down to earth has helped 39 year old K. Glades a great deal. For over a decade now she has been plying a roaring restaurant business in Bugembe-Jinja. The underlying fact that her business has been doing well is something she does not put a veil on. Of cardinal importance in establishing a firm foothold on the market for her business has been the embrace of good customer care skills. This has in many respects been a winner. She began with a pancake sale business before she nurtured the whole idea of setting up this business. To manifest that she and her family can live within the means and ways of this business, all of her five children are attending good schools. In the course of time, Glades has reached a satisfactory profit maximizing point in her business. In a week, she makes profits totaling to 120,000 shillings and she is anticipating even better prospects with the acquisition of this loan. The purchase of substantial amounts of food and furniture for her restaurant is what is in the offing for her.

loans.use: The purchase of food and furniture for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gold-plated anklets, men's perfume, gold-plated earrings, gold-plated chains, gold-plated rings and hair-straightening cream

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
In a world far different from fairy tales, people still dream of a happy ending. Our CCT* community partner, Remedios H., certainly dreamed of a happy ending not just for herself, but also for her family. Remedios finished only high school, but for her, dreaming does not end even at the age of 55. She is married to Jaime, a retired Philippine Air Force personnel, and together they live in Pasay City, Philippines along with their three children.

Remedios currently manages a computer shop, which caters to the youth and working professionals in her community. Being fourteen years in business, Remedios knows how to handle her business well, and makes around Php500 per day.

To help her continue with the operation of her business, Remedios has applies for a Php12,000 loan. She intends to use this money to buy materials such as keyboards and printers needed in order for her computer shop to function more efficiently. She also has in mind other equipment which she would buy to add to her business. She hopes to earn enough profit to pay her loans and buy modern computers for her computer shop.

Remedios is challenged by customers who do not pay their dues on time. Remedios always keeps in mind personal debts which she has yet to pay. However. She knows that happiness would surely come her way as long as she perseveres to go above her challanges. She anticipates seeing her children surpass her achievements by finishing college with flying colors. Soon, it will be, for her, a happy ending.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: purchase of needed materials for a computer shop

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma Y. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Elma is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack foods, in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like biscuits & snack foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Elvia Leonor

texts.es:
Elvia Leonor C. P. tiene 21 años de edad, Es soltera, vive con la madre en  el Cantón Ventanas en la  Provincia de los Ríos.  No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD  se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a lobores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, maracuyá esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Elvia Leonor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Viscarra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Escudero.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta la música.
texts.en:
Elvia Leonor C. P. is 21 years old and single.  She lives with her mother in the Venantas canton in the Los Ríos province.  She does not have children.

The members of the Señor de la Salud Communal Bank are located in the Soloma area in the Echeandia canton.  The members of this communal bank dedicate themselves to growing short cycle corn, rice, and passion fruit.  They have been doing this for a long time.

Elvia Leonor grows corn, rice, and passion fruit.  She buys her products at the Comercial Viscarra, and she sells her products at the Comercial Escudero.

She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for her corn, rice, and passion fruit crops.  The support from the loan will help her financially in order to supply the necessities.  The crops face challenges like pest infestation, diseases, and climate changes.

Her dream is to buy a piece of land.

She likes music.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
Maria Cleofe G. J., tiene 54 años, es viuda, vive con los hijos en el  Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

Maria  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una desgranadora y un carro.

Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Maria Cleofe G. J., age 54 años, is a widow. She lives with her children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has 2 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Narcisa de Jesus are located in the San Temistocles region, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Maria works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. She buys and sells her products in stalls in the Peña shopping center and also sells them at home or in the market every day.

She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and buying supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy a sheller and a car.
She enjoys cooking.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Ambenakan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe AMBENAKAN de l’association SINIGNESSIGUI est composé de 6 femmes mariées de la sous-préfecture de Kimparana, préfecture de SAN, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du MALI). Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles, se sont connues à travers le voisinage, la  parenté et ont en moyenne 43 ans et en moyenne 9 enfants. 
Les membres de ce groupe ont intégré le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’ a 5 ans, elles sont à leur 9ème cycle. 
Elles évoluent dans les activités génératrices de revenus il y’ a environ 17 ans et font l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires, diverses marchandises et les  calebasses.
KOROTIMI M. compte  acheter,  35 colis de calebasses à San, Bla et les différentes foires  environnantes. Elles effectuent sa vente à  Kimparana et dans les autres foires environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Elle vend en espèce et à crédit. Elle espère réaliser mensuellement à un bénéfice de 29000 FCFA tandis que les autres membres du groupe compte sur un bénéfice de 24500 FCFA, qui serviront à rembourser les dettes, subvenir aux besoins familiales et réinvestir dans l’entreprise pour pouvoir l’agrandir.
texts.en:
The group named Ambenakan of the Sinignessigui association is composed of 6 married women who live in the sub-prefecture of Kimparana, prefecture of San, and Region of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional families and they are known through neighbors, and through family. They are 43 years old on average and they each have 9 children. 

The members of this group joined the loan program at Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) five years ago and they are on their 9th loan cycle. 

They have had their revenue generating activity for about 17 years, involved in the buying and selling of condiments, various merchandise, and gourds. 

Korotimi M. plans on purchasing 35 packages of gourds at San, Bla and at the fairs in the area. They carry out their sales in Kimparana and at the fairs in the area to a clientele made up primarily of women. They sell in cash and credit. She expects to earn a monthly income of 29000 FCFA but the other members of the group expect a monthly income of 24500 FCFA. This income will be used to repay debts, to provide for her family’s needs and to reinvest in the business in order to increase it.

loans.use: To purchase gourds.

loans.name: Milka Akinyi

texts.en:
Milka Akinyi W. is a 37-year-old mother from Migori County, an expansive region along the shore of Lake Victoria, Kenya. She is married to Edward, and they have seven children who depend on them.

Milka runs a business selling fish in the town of Migori. She has been operating her business for the last two years. She currently earns a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Milka joined KADET LTD to gain access to microcredit and has been awarded a first loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more fish for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. Her dream is to open a store where she can stock her fish while they await sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothing sales business

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is 45 years old. He is from Bungoma and is married to Margaret. They have two children aged 10 years and seven years old.

Lucas is a tailor and is known for making nice outfits for his clients. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client here. Lucas intends to use the money to buy more materials to add to his stock to enable him serve his clients well. He earns a monthly income of KES 13,500.

He desires to open up a tailoring college in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials (fabric) to add to his stock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Grace has a restaurant. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail.

Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Grace include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and hopes for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel and to buy a plot of land. Grace lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, rent, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy sweet and Irish potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in butchery business for seven years. He started his business with a capital of 200,000 shillings and now has two million shillings as working capital. His hardship is the high cost of cows; his hope for the future is to own a ranch and buy a car. Hussein intends to use this loan to buy cows to slaughter.

loans.use: To purchase cows for slaughtering

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد عمره25 سنة اعزب يعمل في بيع الخضار والفواكه له في عمله 13 سنة يحب عمله ويريد التطور والتحسن في العمل والمدخول يريد من خلال تحسين عمله الى زيادة المدخول اليومي حتى يؤمن مستقبله وخاصة انه في طور تكوين عائلة يطمح محمد في زيادة مدخوله وتغيير مستقبله خاصة انه يعاني من صعوبة في المنافسة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء خضار وفاوكه للعمل وتأمين بعض الادوات المنزلية الخاصة في منزله الجديد يتميز في تنوعه في البيع حيث يشمل بضائع عديدة في المحل خاصته ويحلم بتوسيع العمل وتكبير المصلحة محمد ايضا يساعد اهله في تخطي المصاعب المادية وذلك حرضاً منه على الترابط الأسري
texts.en: Mohamad is 25 years old and unmarried. He works selling fruits and vegetables. He has 13 years of experience in his work. He likes his work and would like to develop and improve both his business and his income. He wants to increase his daily income by improving his business so that he can secure a good future for himself, especially since he is in the stage of his life where he will soon be starting a family of his own. Mohamad aspires to increase his income and improve his future, especially since he is having some trouble competing in his field. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy fruits and vegetables for his business, as well as some home appliances for his new home. He stands out in his field due to the diversity of the goods he sells. He dreams of expanding his business. Mohamad also helps his family overcome their material difficulties as he is very interested in maintaining his family ties.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables for his business, as well as some home appliances for his new home.

loans.name: Isibekezelo Group

texts.en:
Lillian (pictured with her hand raised) is a 43-year-old woman. She and her husband have four children, who are between the ages of 6 and 21. Three of their children currently attend school. She also cares for one relative.

She runs a clothing business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Emandini in South Africa. She explains that she has been in this business for years. Her main business challenge is dealing with customers who do not want to pay on time after they purchase clothes on credit. 

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses (WDB) and Kiva to buy clothes for resale. She will use the extra income to help take care of her family. In the future, she sees her business growing and hopes to sell bags and shoes. 

In her comments she thanks WDB and Kiva for lending money to those who are unemployed like her.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hameedan's Group

texts.en:
Hameedan is a caring & supportive lady who stays at home and does her household work. She is married and her husband runs a grocery store in the community. He sells daily use items like lentils, cooking oil, spices, etc. to his clients at reasonable rates. 

Hameedan also supports her husband by visiting his grocery store and handling his clients. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his store and sell.

She is confident that her husband's business will be improved after the loan and her family will be able to enjoy a better living standard as a result.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Hameedan.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk to sell

loans.name: Marjie

texts.en:
Marjie is 24 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past two years, she has run a shop that sells perfume. Marjie earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Marjie joined PMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC and this will be her second loan. Marjie is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more perfume to sell in her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the living standard of her family. 



About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase perfume to sell

loans.name: Jesukpego (Cocotomey) Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO (Cocotomey) est un groupement constitué de onze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Christine. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née le 06 Avril 1965 au Bénin, Christine est mariée à un électricien du nom de Bertin et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Christine vit avec ses enfants et assure leurs charges respectives grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Pour y arriver, Christine vend des tissus, des bijoux et des chaussures par le système de distribution. Christine achète ses produits au Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Christine et aux autres membres du groupement JESUKPEGO (Cocotomey), de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: Jesukpego (Cocotomey) is a grouping of eleven people and its president (who has her hand raised in the photo) is called Christine. The group members all live in the same district of Benin. With a view to increasing their working capital, this group is requesting a second loan from Alide. Christine, who was born on 6th April 1965 in Benin, is married to an electrician called Bertin and is mother to three children, all of whom are at school. She lives with her children and provides for their respective expenses thanks to the income she gets from her business. She sells fabric, jewelry and shoes through the distribution system and buys her products in Benin. This second loan will without doubt allow Christine and the other Jesukpego (Cocotomey) group members to increase their business volume, their customer bases and their income.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus, des chaussures et des bijoux.

loans.name: Rosamie

texts.en: Rosamie is 21 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married with two children. Rosamie works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Rosamie has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos vive en la zona 5to anillo la cuidad de Santa Cruz, en casa familiar, en la cual vive con sus hijos y su esposa la Sra. Yeini. El Sr.se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano, cuenta con un vehículo propio el cual fue adquirido con su esfuerzo propio, además de esto también tiene conocimiento de mecánica automotriz, su esposa es ama de casa, el fin del préstamo será invertido para hacerle un buen mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que el hace muchos viajes a las provincias y desea que este en buen estado así para brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros, es un apersona muy trabajadora a gradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in Santa Cruz’s 5th Ring in the family home with his wife, Yeini, and their children.  He provides urban transportation services.  He has a car that he acquired through his own efforts.  He also knows auto mechanics.  His wife’s a housewife.  

The loan will be used to do a thorough maintenance repair on his car because he does many trips out to the countryside and he wants it to be in good condition to provide better service for his customers.  He is a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Edward Lihanda

texts.en:
Edward is forty-nine years old and married to a housewife. They have four children aged between fifteen years old and five years old. He runs a general store at Kivagara in Kakamega. He has been in this business for six years. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. 

Edward is using his loan of Kes 30,000 to increase his stock of maize and sugar to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow his business to a big supermarket. He also hopes to give his children a good education to the university level. He describes himself as humble, social and persistent.

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 66 years old and married. She has three children.

Sonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. 

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries.

Sonia has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Sonia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Priscila Nohemi

texts.es:
La señora Priscila Nohemi es casada, tiene 39 años de edad, cursó los tres años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, la confección de playeras, inicio este negocio con el apoyo de su familia, y hasta el momento lleva 25 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de telas para la confección de playeras, y de esta forma mejorar su producción, espera que su negocio sea prospero.
texts.en:
Priscila Nohemí, 39, is married.  She went to three year of elementary school.  She has five children; there of them are in school.  She manufactures t-shirts.  She started the business with help from her family and to date has twenty-five years’ experience.  Her husband helps her economically.

She wants to ask for a loan to buy fabric to make t-shirts to improve production.  She hopes that her business will be profitable.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make t-shirts.

loans.name: Jocotal Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Jocotal lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora María Lucrecia de 49 años propietaria de una pulpería donde comercializa arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pollo, jabón…etc. desde hace 14 años con su propio esfuerzo y luego empezó a prestar para aumentarlo.
Las otras integrantes son Nelly Susana de 35 años quien vende cosméticos, cremas, champú y desodorante y Lila de 25 años compra y vende pan desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Jocotal" is comprised of three hard-working women entrepreneurs, one of whom is Mrs. María Lucrecia, 49, who runs a grocery store.  She sells rice, beans, sugar, chicken, soap, etc. and has been in business for 14 years.  She started out with her own capital but has taken out loans to expand her activity.

The other members are Nelly Susana, 35, who sells cosmetics, creams, shampoo and deodorant, and Lila, 25, who buys and sells bread for a living.  She has been in business for three years.

loans.use: To buy basic grains and other products to increase business.

loans.name: Maria Urbana

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 43 años, está casada con el Señor Alberto D. 45 años, el señor es empleado en una empresa privada tienen 4 hijas, una D. las cuales se encuentra en España trabajando, la otra está en la facultad estudiando Licenciatura en Obstetricia, y las demás están en el colegio y escuela respectivamente.
La señora Maria tiene un local D. ventas D. comestibles y bebidas, anteriormente era empleada domestica, vendió una propiedad que poseía para poder abrir su negocio que actualmente cuenta con una importante cantidad D. clientes, ya que esta ubicado en el centro del mercado D. Luque. Le gustaría  abrir una ferretería algún día ya que es su sueño D. siempre, por eso su hija viajo al exterior para poder conseguir mas capital ya que en nuestro medio no conseguía trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. huevo, pan, discos para empanadas, carne, mayonesa y otros, los cuales son esenciales para la elaboración D. sus alimentos.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and married to Alberto, 45. Alberto is has a job with a private company. They have four daughters, one of whom is working in Spain, another is studying for a degree in obstetrics, and the other two are still in secondary and elementary school.
María has a stall where she sells food and drinks. She used to be a maid and sold a property she owned to be able to open a business. She currently has a good client base, since she's located right in the middle of the Luque market. She'd like to open a hardware store one day, which has always been her dream. That's why her daughter traveled abroad to earn more money, since she couldn't find a job locally.
María is requesting a loan to buy eggs, bread, discs for making empanadas, meat, mayonnaise, and other ingredients that are essential to preparing her foods.

loans.use: to buy eggs, bread, discs for making empanadas, meat, mayonnaise, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: Bernardina, D. 56 años es una mujer ejemplar. Vive en compañía D. su esposo Donato, con quien se casó desD. hace 16 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con uno D. ellos: Roger, el menor; en su casa propia ubicada en el Centro Poblado Villa Ashaninka. Como todos los días desD. las primeras horas, sale a cuidar D. su pequeño recreo turístico a las afueras del centro poblado. DonD. ella venD. diversas bebidas, dulces y demás productos comestibles. Le va muy bien en su negocio, pues se ubica en una zona estratégica. Además comparte su tiempo con la actividad D. la  “agricultura”, principal ingreso económico D. su familia; cuenta que desD. hace 40 años comenzó a sembrar plátano, café y cítricos en toda su variedad, los cuales venD. a los comerciantes D. la ciudad D. Pichanaki, que visitan su zona constantemente. En todo este tiempo D. trabajo, logró obtener 5 terrenos, cuenta que hace 4 años que lo adquirió y se siente orgullosa D. ello; ahora su reto es mejorar la calidad D. sus cultivos y D. su negocio. Sabe que lo logrará, pues siempre para activa. “También crío cerdos, gallinas y cuyes, los que engordo para luego vender su carne”, afirma contenta. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donD. agradece el apoyo D. todos ustedes, pues le permiten continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas. Bernardina, D. recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. diversas bebidas, galletas, dulces y demás productos para su pequeño recreo turístico.
texts.en:
Bernardina, 56, is an exemplary woman. She lives with her husband, Donato, who she has been married to for 16 years. Together they have 8 children, but only one lives with them: Roger, the youngest. They own a home in the area of Villa Ashaninka. Every day very early she goes out to work at a small tourist attraction on the outskirts of town. There she sells various drinks, sweets and other food items. The business is going very well because she has a strategic location. She also spends some time farming, the main source of income for her family. She has been farming for 40 years and plants plantains, coffee and a variety of citrus, which she sells to the merchants in the city of Pichanaki who come to her zone frequently. After all of her time working, 4 years ago she was able to buy 5 plots of land and she is very proud of it. Now her challenge is to improve the quality of her crops and her business. She knows that she will achieve it because she is always active. "I will also raise pigs, chickens and guinea pigs, which I'll fatten up to sell for meat," she says happily. 

She belongs to the village bank Los Naranjales and this is her 8th credit with MFP. She is thankful for all of your support because it has allowed her to continue working towards her goals. She promises to be punctual in her payments. Bernardina will invest the loan in the purchase of different kinds of drinks, cookies and sweets and other products for her small tourist attraction.

loans.use: to buy sodas, cookies and candies to stock her business.

loans.name: Ma.teresa

texts.en: Ma. Teresa is 41 years old and has three children. She is married, and her three children are in school. Ma. Teresa is in the agricultural industry, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ma. Teresa has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to renovate her family home and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es: Celedonia de 27 años, convive con Vidal de 27 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Celedonia, es perseverante, desde pequeña fue ganándose el cariño de las personas gracias al carisma que ella tiene. En un principio se dedicaba a las labores agrarias donde extraía frutos de cacao para luego comercializarlas. Su parcela agrícola es muy pequeña, y por ese motivo empezó  a comprar animales menores, para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos. Entre sus galpones podemos encontrar desde cuyes, aves, corderos, y cerdos; ella comenta, que desde que empezó este negocio siempre le ha ido muy bien. Pero sí resalta que hay que estar siempre pendiente de la limpieza, alimentación de estos animales. Ella esta contenta con este oficio que tiene, por que gracias a ello tiene un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su  familia. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por el que Celedonia se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará más animales y alimento balanceado.
texts.en: Celedonia is 27 years old and lives with Vidal who is 27 years old. They have 2 children and live together in their own house located in the district of Pichari. Celedonia is a persistant person; since childhood she would win people's affection thanks to the charisma she has. At first she worked farming, extracting cocoa seeds for subsequent sale. Her plot of farmland is very small and for this reason she started to buy small animals to fatten and then sell. Among her animal pens we can find everthing from guinea pigs, fowl, sheep to pigs. She says that since starting this business she has always done well. But she stresses that one must always be mindful of cleaning and feeding these animals. She is happy with this business she has as thanks to it she has an income that covers the family expenses. This will be her first loan with MFP and Celedonia agrees to make her repayments punctually. With the 3,000 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy more animals and balanced feed.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, fowl and pigs as well as balanced feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is 43 year old woman who has been involved in farming for the past 11 years. Bahar is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and two daughters in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

Bahar raises fruit and vegetables and sells them in the local bazaar.  Her monthly profit from this business is 200 AZN. This is the only financial income in her family and Bahar would like to increase it. She applied for 1000 AZN loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sonia Mariela

texts.es:
Sonia Mariela  tiene 21 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con la hija y el hijo de tres y cuatro meses de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC. SAN JOSE Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El Rosario, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Sonia se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos hace muchos años, se dedica también a la agricultura hace tres años y a la cría de chanchos, ganados y gallinas.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita este crédito para poder sembrar maíz, comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos.
El sueño es poder construir una casa , no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión.

CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO ANTERIOR  ha podido invertir en la agricultura ha sembrado maíz, arroz y fréjol ayudado muchísimo a obtener beneficios económicos para el bienestar de la familia.
"Está muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada"
texts.en:
Sonia Maria, age 21, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband, three year old daughter, and four month old son in Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province.

The San Jose Communal Bank is located in the El Rosario section of Ventanas Canton. This communal bank concentrates on short cycle agricultural work—the planting of corn and rice.

Sonia has been involved with domestic work for many years. She also has been engaged in farming for three years and in raising pigs, cattle, and chickens. She carries out her purchases and sales in Ventanas.

Sonia is applying for this loan in order to be able to plant corn by purchasing fertilizers, urea, and compost. Her dream is to construct a house. She hasn’t had any problems with her business. During her free time, she likes to watch television.

With the help of her prior loan she was able to invest in farming and planted corn, rice and beans. This helped very much in obtaining economic benefits for the wellbeing of her family. She is very thankful for the help she has been offered.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, urea, and compost.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora de 58 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora  y empeñosa, además de alegre y sociable, es separada de su esposo, vive en compañía de uno de sus hijos de 37 años de edad siendo aún soltero, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Nora es la venta de ropa de segundo uso, de toda las variedades tanto para damas, caballero y niños, la cual compra en los centros comerciales de la ciudad de Pucallpa, para luego llevarlo por zonas alejas como los caseríos y centro poblados en donde los vende al doble de su precio de costo. Tiene más de 4 años desdeicándose a este negocio, y en un inicio lo hizo sola con un capital propio, con el tiempo ha logrado ser conocida por esa zona y ahora también vende a crédito a 30 días. Con los ingresos que le deja ha logrado solventarse sus gastos de alimentación, así como también ha podido conocer nuevas personas  llegando a hacer nuevas amistades. Por lo contrario lo que no le gusta es que algunos de sus clientes se han retrasado en el pago de sus créditos otorgados. Por otro lado, comenta que desea incursionar en otro negocio como la venta de comida. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, pues dice conocer a sus miembros y los considera ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de ropa al por mayor de todas las variedades y modelos para ésta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
58-year-old Nora is a hard-working and dedicated woman.  She is also cheerful and sociable.  Nora is separated from her husband and lives together with one of her children who is 37 years old and still single.  They live comfortably together in their own home.

Nora's business is selling second-hand clothing of all kinds for men, women and children.  She buys her products in the shopping centers in the city of Pucallpa.  She then takes them to remote areas, small villages and hamlets, where she sells them for double the price she pays.  She has been in this business for more than four years.  At first she carried out her business with her own capital but, over time, she became well known in the area and now she also sells her products on 30 days credit.  Nora uses the income that she makes to cover her family's food expenses.  She has also come to know new people and has made new friendships.  What Nora doesn't like about her work is that some of her customers have delayed making payments to her.

Nora says that she would like to start out in a new business selling food.  This will be her fifth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive a small loan so that she can achieve her goals.  She says that she feels comfortable being a member of her community bank as she knows the other members and considers them to be good people.  Nora will use the sum that she has requested (1,000 soles) to invest in buying all kinds of clothes wholesale to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr:
Mme SOLANGE est  mariée  et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé  a 28ans et  le moins âgé a 02ans. 02 vont   à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend du riz préparé et du pain au sandwich (restauration) depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de pissy. Ses clients sont  les voisins et amis du quartier.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac de riz, 01 bidon d’huile, 01 carton de tomate concentré, 60 miches de pain par jour et du poisson.

 Mme épargne  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir un grand restaurant  et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. SOLANCE is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 28 and the youngest is 2.  Two of them attend school. She has five people in her care. 

She has been selling cooked rice and sandwiches (in food service) for 11 years. She gets her supplies at the market in Pissy.  Her customers are neighbors and friends in her area. 

She wants to buy one sack of rice, 1 can of oil, one case of tomato concentrate, 60 loaves of bread per day, and fish. 

Mrs. Solange saves her profits.  Her goal is to open a large restaurant and provide an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy one sack of rice, 1 can of oil, one case of tomato concentrate, 60 loaves of bread per day, and fish.

loans.name: Santos Alejandro

texts.es: Santos Alejandro tiene 30 años de edad, su actividad económica a la que se dedica es a la toma de fotografías y esta actividad la desempeña de forma domiciliar y también en su lugar de domicilio lo cual tiene ya sus clientes que le solicitan su servicio en los diferentes eventos . Santos Alejandro aprendió desde muy joven este negocio en lo cual le ha puesto mucho amor a su trabajo y la calidad del servicio que el brinda es muy bueno es por ello que sus clientes lo visitan. Santos Alejandro está solicitando crédito para poder comprar material fotográfico para esta temporadas altas.
texts.en: Santos Alejandro is 30 years old, he works as a photographer, work that he has done at his customers’ home as well as in his home since he has customers that need his services for different events. Santos Alejandro learned his trade from a very young age, this business has given him a lot of love for his work and the quality of the service that he gives is very good which is why he has so many customers. Santos Alejandro needs a loan to be able to buy photography equipment for this busy season.

loans.use: buy photographic equipment.

loans.name: Ana Rosa El Pilar

texts.es:
ciudad nombrada por la  cultura de los Chinchas, célebre por sus avanzados conocimientos de la agricultura y sus proezas marítimas. Hoy en día Chincha es una increíble mezcla de culturas, con una gran población afro-peruana, debido a los restos de un pasado indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto a otras ciudades cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañada en el año 2001 y 2007, fechas en las que ocurrieron terremotos de fuerte dimensión, pero ha soportado como siempre lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia.

Ella es una mujer soltera que se dedica a trabajar día a día, se dedica a la venta de artesanía desde hace ya 1 año, actividad que le ha permitido solventar los gastos que ha tenido durante todo este tiempo. Son sus amigos y familiares los que constantemente compran de sus productos debido a que los consideran muy interesantes y bonitos.

Actualmente Ana desea poder comprar mucha más mercadería y así ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y continuamente se sientan motivados a comprarle, ella desea que sus ingresos mejores y convertirse en una gran microempresaria, ella tiene muchos sueños y metas, las mismas que serán logradas con el esfuerzo y dedicación que le brinde diariamente a su curioso negocio.
texts.en:
Chincha is a city named after the Chinchas, a civilisation who were famous for their advanced agricultural expertise and their maritime exploits. Nowadays Chincha is an incredible mix of cultures and has a large Afro-Peruvian population, due to the remains of its indigenous past and the influence of the Spanish empire. Together with other cities near the Pacific coast, Chincha was damaged in 2001 and 2007 by severe earthquakes, but it survived, just as it always has throughout its history. 

Ana is single and for a year she has worked every day selling craft items, an activity which has allowed her to settle her bills during this period. Her friends and family are always buying her products because they consider them interesting and very pretty.

At the moment Ana would like to be able to buy a lot more merchandise and thus offer her customers more variety so that they keep buying items from her. She would like to increase her income and become a large-scale micro-enterprise. Ana has a lot of dreams and goals, and they will be achieved thanks to the effort and dedication she brings to her remarkable business every day.

loans.use: to purchase new craft items.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.en:
My name is Teresa de Jesus R.. I make and sell tortillas. I’ve had my business for four years. I have several clients, since I distribute my product all over my community. My kids help me distribute. My income allows me to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to produce more, so I can remodel my store (located in my home), and provide good education for my kids.

Loan Use: Purchase corn flour, lime, salt, wood, water.

Mi nombre es Teresa de Jesus R. me dedido a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años y mi clientela es muy buena ya que reparto mi producto en mi colonia, tengo la ayuda de mis hijos para repartir mi producto, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio (casa de habitacion) y darles un buen estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de Harina de maiz, cal, sal, leña, agua

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.en:
Laurinda João M. is 37 years old, originally from Boane, a mother of three and a widow. Her family’s financial condition did not allow her to study past the 5th grade. She had a traditional marriage, but became an early widow and had to take over the business left by her husband. She heard about HLUVUKU-ADSEMA and applied for a loan to grow her business. With a loan for 10,000MT she plans to increase her stock volume to meet the needs of her customers and increase her income. Her business has a large impact on the community. She creates her own employment and income to support the basic needs of her three fatherless children and her grandson. In addition, she provides a useful service to her community.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Laurinda João M. de 37 anos de idade, natural de Boane, mãe de três filhos, viúva, as condições de vida não lhe permitiram estudar para alem de 5º classe, teve um casamento tradicional precoce, ficou viúva muito cedo e assumiu o negócio deixado pelo Marido. Quando soube da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA pela necessidade de serviços de crédito, aproximou-se e solicitou um empréstimo para ampliar o seu negócio. Com o empréstimo de 10.000,00 MT (dez mil meticais ) pretende aumentar o stock em produtos, de modo a responder as necessidades dos clientes e consequentemente aumentar os rendimentos. A sua actividade tem um grande impacto, pois providencia emprego para ela própria, cuja fonte de rendimento suporta as necessidades básicas dos seus três filhos órfãos de Pai e do seu neto, para além de prestar um serviço útil para sua comunidade.

loans.use: To increase stock volume in her shop

loans.name: Catarino

texts.en:
Catarino has been selling clothing for fifteen years. He is married and has two children, one of whom helps him with the business. He used to work in construction but he injured his arms and couldn't continue, so to support his family he decided to start his own business and since then he has seen his business grow. At this time Catarino is seeking a loan for $1200 to buy merchandise and meet customer demand. He would like to continue to grown his business and you can help him and his family. They would sincerely appreciate your support

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 15 años, Catarino se dedica a la venta de ropa, él es casado y tiene dos hijos, uno de los cuales le ayuda en el negocio. Anteriormente Catarino era albañil, pero debido al esfuerzo que requiere ese tipo de trabajo, se lastimó los brazos y ya no pudo continuar trabajando, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para el sustento de su hogar, Catarino decidió iniciar su propio negocio, desde entonces ha visto crecer su negocio y la demanda por sus productos cada vez es mayor.

En estos momentos, Catarino necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, él quiere continuar creciendo con su negocio y con tu ayuda lo hará posible. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Buston

texts.ru:
Buston N. has been an active client of Microinvest for over 3 years. She has been in the sales business for at least 8 years. She is married with 1 child. She stared her business by selling dishes. Her assets were initially worth $100, today they are worth $600. She personally travels to the neighboring country to buy her inventory.

Buston has a stall at the ‘Pharovon’ marketplace, located in the town of Gafurov. This is an open market place, so she is forced to pack up her dishes/plates every evening, take them home and then bring them back in the morning. In this daily transport process she looses ¼ of her inventory ! She sees having her own shop as the solution to her problem. She needs $500 to open her own shop.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Набиева Бустон, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 8 лет. Она замужем и имеет 1 детей. Свою деятельность начала с продажи посуды, ее актив составлял 100$. На сегодняшний день ее актив составляет 600$. За товаром ездит сама в соседнюю страну.

Набиева Бустон торгует на рынке «Фаровон», расположенный в г. Гафурове. Это открытое помещение и ей приходиться каждый вечер убирать и отвозить товар домой, а утром привозить их на рынок. При транспортировке она теряет ¼ часть своего товара. Она видеть решения своей проблемы в открытие собственного магазина Ей необходимо 500$, открытия собственного магазина.

loans.use: To open her own shop

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Mrs. Jane Osakuguomwan is 40 years old, a married mother of three children, and lives in Benin City. She sells drinks and food items wholesale and retail. According to her, the loan of US$ 400 will help her improve her business and achieve a better standard of living for her family. She has been in this business since 1993.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and beans for resale

loans.name: María Marlene

texts.es:
Maria is 51 years old and lives in the Paijan District, Province of Ascope, Department of Liberty. She has 4 children but only one of them depends on her support. Maria attended school and completed her studies through high school. Ever since she was young, she loved business, and began her first business by selling beauty products. With her earnings, she was able to sell soft drinks, beer, empanadas (meat pastries) and candies, etc., out of her home.

One of her aunts invited her to become involved with the United Hands Community Bank (Banco Comunal Manos Unidas), where she received her first loan of approximately $100 USD. With this loan she was able to begin selling foods, soups, etc. She also used part of the money to buy rice and cooking oil to supplement her grocery items.

Now she is requesting this loan, which will bring approximately $333 USD, and which will be repaid within 6 months. She'll use this money to buy other grocery items like: chocolates, yogurt, milk, etc. to supplement her grocery store inventory.

Maria dreams about travelling outside of her country, and also of starting her own creole restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María tiene 51 años de edad, actualmente vive en el Distrito de Paiján, Provincia de Ascope, Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 4 hijos, solo uno depende de ella. La señora María estudió secundaria completa.
