Desde muy pequeña le gustó el negocio, empezó vendiendo productos de belleza y con las ganancias que obtenía puso en su casa una mesa pequeña para vender gaseosas, cervezas, empanadas, caramelos, etc. Una tía la invitó a integrar el Banco Comunal Manos Unidas y con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300 ($ 100 aprox.) comenzó a vender comida (shambar, caldos, etc.). y otra parte del dinero lo utilizó para comprar arroz y aceite para continuar implementando su bodega. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,000.00 ($ 333 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará otros como: chocolates, yogurt, leche, para surtir un poco más su bodega La señora María sueña con ir a pasear al extranjero y también con poner un restaurante para vender comida criolla.

loans.use: To purchase grocery store items such as:  chocolate, yogurt, milk, etc. to supplement her store and continue to grow her business.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
The Seagulls Communal Bank started 2 years ago and has 23 members. Most of the members joined Finca through invitations from family and friends. They’re a united and happy group that loves to celebrate birthdays and they say that they’re like sisters.

The members need different amounts of money but the grand total to the Communal Bank would be $3825.00.

The members have different businesses such as selling fruits, prepared food, candies, CDs, clothes, and seasonal items depending on the festivals and times of year. Other businesses incluD. the production of traditional breads for the area, and emoliente which a local hot medicinal beverage that contains linseed and natural herbs that is sold at night and in the morning.

Each member has a story to tell, such as Lucia who sells clothes. Her biggest wish was to buy land and she was able to accomplish this thanks to the money she saved in the Communal Bank; now she has other dreams.

They will use the loan to buy rice, oil, noodles, papers, cookies, sugar, gums, cigars; those that make bread will buy basic necessities such as flour, yeast, and wood; and those that produce the herbal emoliente, linseed and herbs.

The main dreams of the members is to see their businesses prosper, they want day by day to have a bigger store, a commercial store, or a mechanic shop.

At Finca they learned to be punctual and always save.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Hernandez, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas se inició hace 2 años y actualmente tiene 7 ciclos y 23 socias. Muchas D. las socias llegaron a Finca a través D. L. invitación D. familiares y amigos. Es un grupo unido y alegre que les gusta festejar cumpleaños, ellas mencionan que son como hermanas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 11400 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. frutas, comida, golosinas, CDs, ropa, artículos D. novedad por campaña esto depenD. D. las fiestas y fechas. Otros negocios son L. elaboración D. panes tradicionales D. L. zona, emoliente que es una bebida caliente y medicinal que contiene linaza y hierbas D. L. zona que se venD. en las noches y mañanas.

Cada socia tiene una historia que contar, como el caso D. Lucia que venD. ropa y su mayor sueño fue comprar un terreno y lo logró gracias a lo que ahorró en su Banco Comunal y ahora tiene otros sueños.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. arroz, aceite, fideo, papeles, galletas, azúcar, chicles, cigarros, y los que elaboran pan para L. compra D. insumos como L. harina, levadura, leña y los que elaboran emoliente hierbas, linaza que es una semilL. proveniente D. L. planta D. lino y las hierbas.

Los sueños D. las socias principalmente es que su negocio prospere, otros mencionan que poco a poco puedan tener una tienda granD., una tienda comercial, tener un taller.

En Finca aprendieron a ser puntuales y ahorrar siempre.

loans.use: The loans will be used to buy rice, oil, noodles, papers, cookies, sugar, gum, cigars; those that make bread will buy basic necessities such as flour, yeast, and wood; and those that produce the herbal emoliente, linseed and herbs.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Mastura Z. is 40 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 2 children. Mastura has been in business for 13 years. She sells her goods at the “Tidjarat” market in the Yavan region. Her main products are national fabrics to make national women’s clothing and warm winter clothing.

Mastura will use her loan to purchase new products for sale and to expand her business. This loan will help local residents to acquire necessary clothing at reasonable prices. Mastura will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase porducts for sale and expand business

loans.name: Jinja Kawempe A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Rebecca N.. She is currently in business selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rebecca is 37 years old and is married. She has 2 children, aged 2 and 4, both of whom go to school.

Rebecca is joined in her small group by Milly N., Betty N., Joeria N., and Betty N.. Milly N. has a poultry business and wants to construct another poultry house. Betty N. is currently operating a restaurant and wants a loan to buy more equipment, like foodstuffs and a fridge. Joeria N. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to construct a shade for the charcoal. Betty N. is currently in the business of hair dressing and is requesting a loan to put up a personal salon.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Quả, 54 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2008. She lives with her husband and 3 children, two are still in school. Besides farming she raises pigs for extra income. Because of small capital, the income from pigs has been modest. In 2008, she decides to join and apply for a loan at the Fund to invest in her pigs operation. She agrees with the initial maximum amount that set for her at 325USD. She hopes the income will be better this year.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Quả, 54 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2008. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 người con, trong đó 2 người đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Ngoài làm ruộng chị Quả còn chăn nuôi lợn để tăng thu nhập. Do ít vốn nên thu nhập từ việc chăn nuôi Q. các năm trước chỉ bình thường. Sang năm 2008 này, thấy nhiều chị em trong xã vay vốn Quỹ Tình thương và sử dụng hiệu quả, chị Quả quyết định xin tham gia và vay vốn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi. Mức đề nghị của chị ở vòng vốn đầu tiên là mức tối đa 325USD theo quy định của Quỹ. Chị hy vọng thu nhập năm nay sẽ có nhiều tiến triển so với năm trước.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela P. is married and works selling shoes through catalogue. She started this activity to help her husband with the family expenses. She began selling to her relatives and friends, but little by little she increased her clientele. She started four years ago.

She is now requesting a loan for US $250, which she will pay in 4 months, to buy merchandise. With your help Adela will continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Adela P. es casada y se dedica ala venta de zapatos por catalogo actividad que emprendió para ayudar a su esposo con lo gastos familiares primero empezó vendiendo a sus familiares y conocidos pero poco a poco ha incrementado su cartera de clientes, de esto ya 4 años.

Ahora solita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprara mercancía. Con tu ayuda Adela seguirá con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Ramon Bartolo

texts.es:
Mr. A. has obtained ten loans with Fundación Leon over the past nine years. He has invested this capital to improve his mobile sale of cleaning products: he recently bought a bike, no longer having to move around on foot.

Mr. A.'s wife sells tortillas from their house. Their family is large and they live in terrible conditions. Despite this, he is an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor A. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos nueve años obteniendo diez creditos los que ha utilizado para comprar productos de limpieza su principal actividad, tambien compro una bisicleta en la que se moviliza a vender sus productos anteriormente andaba a pie, es casado la esposa tiene negocio en la casa vende tortillas y productos derivados del maiz su familia es numerosa y viven en pesimas condiciones. a pesar de ello el es un exelente cliente.

loans.use: Invest in

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, her husband and two children, ages 22 and 20 respectively, live on Gracilazo de la Vega Street in the Nueva Jerusalén neighborhood located in the city of El Alto. She works together with her husband in a small iodized salt processing operation whose production is sold directly to the public in the cities of El Alto and La Paz. The loan will be used to acquire the principle product (salt) at wholesale prices thereby benefiting from economies of scale due to the reduction in cost of said product. This is her third loan with Impro. Her track record and previous evaluation qualify her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana, su marido y sus dos hijos de 22 y 20 años respectivamente, viven en la calle Gracilazo de la Vega de la zona Nueva Jerusalén ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo en una pequeña procesadora de sal yodada, comestible cuya producción es vendida directamente al público de las ciudades de El Alto y La Paz. El crédito servirá para adquirir el principal insumo (sal) al por mayor y asi beneficiarse de las economias de escala, debido a la reducción del costo de dicho insumo. Este es su tercer crédito con Impro, sus antecedentes y la evaluación previa la califican para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase salt for an iodized salt production business

loans.name: Janet Jackeline

texts.es:
Janet is father and mother to her three children. Driven by her great hope to earn her own income, she set up a small shop, selling basic commodities, two years ago. Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has seen her business improve day after day. Janet feels in her bones the effects of the increase in the cost of living in her country and she dreams of having a mini-market, selling all kinds of products that are both of good quality and low price, where all her neighbors can come. For her shop to keep growing, she needs to buy more products, so she's asking for your help and trust.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Janet es padre y madre para sus tres hijos, movida por sus grandes deseos de generar ingresos propios, puso una tienda de productos de primera necesidad hace dos años. Ella ha visto como ha mejorado su negocio día tras día con su esfuerzo y dedicación. Janet sueña con tener un minimarket, al cual acudan todos los vecinos de su localidad, vender toda clase de productos de muy buena calidad y a precios bajos, ya que ella sufre en carne propia el aumento del costo de vida en su país. Para que su bodega crezca día a día, necesita comprar más productos, y es para lo que ella ahora pide su apoyo y confianza.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en:
Adenike is 39 years old and married with three children. She sells drugs and produces liquid soap. She supplies the liquid soap to supermarkets to sell. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more drugs and materials for making liquid soap.

Adenike started her business in 2002. This loan will go a long way in helping her business grow. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To increase her stock of drugs and purchase materials for making liquid soap

loans.name: Ajibola

texts.en:
Ajibola O. is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Egan, Lagos State, Nigeria. Ajibola sells foodstuffs like garri, plantains, yams, and coco yams, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a LAPO client.

Ajibola needs the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible. She says that this will increase her sales and her profit.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
La señora Elvia López tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera pero vive en pareja desde hace mucho tiempo con el señor Diego Closs, de 49 años de edad. Viven en su propia casa que se ubica en el Barrio San Miguel Cambyreta.

Ellos tienen 4 hijos que viven con ellos y aun dependen económicamente de los padres porque son menores de edad, a excepcion del mayor que vive con ellos pero igualmente trabaja y cuenta con su ingreso.

La señora Elvia y su cónyugue, el señor Diego, se dedican desde hace mas de 10 años, a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante, es decir tienen un vehículo en el cual distribuyen en las ciudades de Capitán Miranda, Trinidad, Hohenau y otras localidades de la zona. Mediante este trabajo ellos pueden cubrir todos los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos.
La señora ha solicitado el crédito para la compra de mercaderías de primera necesidad, tales como: harinas, yerbas, fideos, aceites, azucar, arroz, productos enlatados, y otros. Ya que la idea de ella es empezar a comercializar también este tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elvia López is 40 years old, single but living with 49 year old Mr. Diego Closs for quite some time. They live in their own home located in the San Miguel Cambyreta neighborhood. They have 4 children who are still economically dependent upon their parents because they are still young, except the oldest who lives with them but works and has his own income. Elvia and her partner, Diego, have been selling fruits and vegetables for more than 10 years. They have a vehicle with which they distribute to the cities of Capitán Miranda, Trinidad, Hohenau and other locations in the neighborhood. Through this work they can cover their household expenses and their children’s education. Elvia has asked for a loan to buy basic needs merchandise such as: flour, tea, noodles, oil, sugar, rice, canned goods, and more. She is planning to expand to sell these types of products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs merchandise such as: flour, tea, noodles, oil, sugar, rice, canned goods, and more.

loans.name: Orifdjon

texts.ru:
Азизов Орифджон, 1982 года рождения, женат. Начал свой бизнес с продажи хозтоваров и его стаж в этой деятельности 7 лет. Он торгует на рынке «Мубориз» Гисарского района хозяйственными товарами. В его ассортименте имеются электропечь, электроплита, светильники, ведра. Также в продажи имеются разновидность чайников, посуды, термосы, утюги, кухонные комбайны и т.д. С наступлением осени увеличивается спрос на электроплиты и печи. Орифджон  хочет пополнить свой товар, увеличить товарооборот и получить больше доходов. Покупает товар в оптовом рынке Корвон и у поставщиков из Китая. 
Орифджон хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить электропечи.
texts.en:
Orifdjon A. was born in 1982, he is married. He started his business selling household products and he has seven years of experience. He sells on the Muboriz market of the Gissar region. His assortment includes items such as electrical ovens (grills), electrical stove, lamps and buckets as wells as different types of pots, pans, china, thermos, irons and food processors. With the beginning of autumn the demand for electrical stoves and ovens increases. Orifdjon wants to increase the variety of his products, increase sales and get more profits. He buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon and from suppliers from China.

Orifdjon wants to receive a loan with the help of Kiva for 4000 somoni (USD$1,200) to stock up on electrical stoves.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical stoves

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Mrs. Dominga A. lives in a small nipa (palm leaf) house in Barangay Danao, one of the depressed coastal areas in the Municipality of Plaridel. She was married as young as 16 years old and had three kids. Two of her kids worked at the fishing ferryboat, while the other one was disabled by polio and died when he was still young. In 2007, her husband died and she received a full insurance benefit from Paglaum MPC. 

Her main source of income is derived from the selling of fresh fish. Being a member in good standing, she always pays attention to her loans. She wants financial assistance amounting to PHP 13,000.00 for the purchase of a fishing net. Through this project, she dreams of obtaining additional income in order to repair her house and for their daily needs.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing net

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es: Liduvina tiene 45 años, está separada de su pareja y vive con sus tres hijos; Yen de 15, Antonia de 11 y Juan Daniel de 8 años. Se dedica a la venta de emoliente, que no es más que un surtido de mates que son benéficos para la salud, lo hace de forma ambulante. Empieza su trabajo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 y luego nuevamente desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche, disponiendo de tiempo para velar por sus hijos. Lo bueno de su negocio es que arroja buenas ganancias, ya que Liduvina le pone mucho empeño y dedicación y sale desde muy temprano para ganar más clientela y se recoge tarde para conseguir mejores ganancias. Ella se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mates para elaborar sus bebidas y refaccionar su triciclo comprando nuevas llantas.
texts.en:
Liduvina is 45 years old, separated, and lives with her three children: Yen (15), Antonia (11), and Juan Daniel (8). She is a street vendor who sells medicinal drinks for a living - nothing more than an assortment of infusions with health benefits. She works from 6:00 until 8:00 in the morning, and then later from 6:00 to 9:00 or 10:00 in the evening, which leaves time for her to watch her children. The good part about her business is that it provides good income since Liduvina shows lots of effort and dedication. She leaves the house early to find more customers, and comes home late to make more money. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will purchase a larger supply of infusions for making her remedies and will refurbish her tricycle with new wheels.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a larger supply of infusions for her preparations

loans.name: Kararaka- Asiyo Colostine Group

texts.en:
Colostine A. (2nd right) is 32 years old. She and her group members are involved in the selling of fruits and vegetables. A. is married with 5 children who attend school. She has 10 years of experience in the business. 

Colostine purchases her stock from local farmers and sells it in various markets. She is using the loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, cabbages and fruits like watermelon. She dreams of opening a retail shop. She also wants her children to study successfully.

loans.use: To purchase onions, tomatoes, cabbages and fruits like watermelon.

loans.name: Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco Abejitas Trabajadoras inicia su primer ciclo con  16 socias, muchas D. ellas viven en el mismo barrio. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. plásticos, comida, cosméticos por catálogos, verduras, frutas, abarrotes en general, ropa y pescado.

Como es el caso D. Aydee que es casada, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Aydee tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado en donD. venD. cebiche y chicharrones, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijas.

Mientras que Judith es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Judith tiene una bodega en su casa en donD. venD. verduras, abarrotes, carnes. Además Judith esta culminando sus estudios universitarios.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles,  haciendo un total D. 6,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. platos, ollas, azúcar, arroz, leche, cosméticos, cebolla, zanahoria, chompas, polos y frutas variadas.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos continúen sus estudios, ampliar su negocio, tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Abejitas Trabajadoras (Little Worker Bees) microfinance institute is starting its first loan cycle with 16 members, many of whom live in the same neighborhood.

The members have different types of businesses, such as plastic sales, food sales, cosmetics by catalog, fruits, vegetables, provisions, clothing, and fish.

Aydee is a 31-year-old married mother with 3 children. She runs a restaurant in a rented business space, where she sells ceviche (citrus marinated fish) and pork rinds everyday with the help of her daughters.

Judith, on the other hand, is 30 years old, has a common law spouse and 2 children. She has a general store in her home where she sells vegetables, provisions and meat. Judith is also finishing her college degree.

The members of the group need different loan amounts—some 300.00 PEN, others 450.00 PEN, and still others 600.00 PEN—bringing the total to 6,450.00 PEN from the microfinance institute.

The loans will be invested in purchasing dishes, pots, sugar, rice, milk, cosmetics, onions, carrots, sweaters, T-shirts, and assorted fruit. The group members dream of helping their children continue with their studies, expanding their businesses, and owning their own houses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dishes, pots, sugar, rice, milk, cosmetics, onions, carrots, sweaters, T-shirts, and assorted fruit

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem Baji is the wife of A. L. and has resided in a city named Kot Radha Kishan for the past 21 years. Her husband is involved in a spice-selling business. He packs spices in small plastic packets and sells each packet for Pak Rs.5.

Naseem Baji is the mother of two daughters. Both of her daughters are getting an education from a local school. Naseem Baji is a very hardworking lady. She gets up early and do all the household work and then she milks her buffalo and goes to the milk shops to sell it. She sells milk to pay the school fees of her daughters. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy spices for her husband.

loans.use: To buy spices for selling

loans.name: Mulkadar

texts.en: Mulkadar A. has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure that his family would never goes without their daily bread.  Mulkada has a general store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs.  With a loan from AqroInvest and thanks to perseverance and dedication, Mulkadar began this enterprise eight years ago.  He successfully completed his loan. Today he needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods.  With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of $1225 for a term of 15 months.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.  AqroInvest believes Mulkadar's perseverance and clear vision will become key to success in his small business.  Over time, Mulkadar believes his business will become a family business with his future children engaged.

loans.use: Purchase more food stuff

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabaly sont deux mariées et deux célibataires, âgées de 20 à 45 ans avec en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  Tougoumela de la sous-préfecture de Garalo, préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes viennent de commencer le partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire et sont unies par des liens de voisinage et d’amitié.
Le présent prêt sera utilisé pour acheter 15 complets d’habits (chemises+ culottes, chemises+ pantalons pour les garçons, robes et jupes pour les petites filles) à Bamako et 5 cartons de savon. Ces articles  seront vendus à Garalo. Les jours de foire sont les occasions de grosses ventes.
Ce commerce permet  à chacune des membres du groupe de gagner en moyenne 15.000FCFA par mois. Cette marge bénéficiaire leur permet de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et de satisfaire également quelques dépenses de la famille (éducation des enfants, santé et habillement surtout).
texts.en:
Two of the women of the Sabaly group are married and two are single. They are between 20 and 45 years of age with on average, 3 children. They live in big traditional extended families in the Tougoumela district of the Sous-prefecture of Garalo, Prefecture de Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women have just begun their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first solidarity loan and are united by ties of neighborhood and friendship.

This loan will be used to buy 15 outfits (shirts and shorts or shirts and pants for boys, and dresses and skirts for girls) in Bamako, and 5 cases of soap. These articles will be sold in Garalo. Market days are occasions for making lots of sales.

This business allows each member of the group to earn on average 15,000 F CFA per month. This profit permits them to make repayments on the loan and also cover some family expenses (children's education, health, and clothing above all).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Marame

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Marame M. sollicite un crédit pour acheter des poussins, 18 sacs d’aliments, et les vaccins.  Elle compte en même temps réhabiliter le poulailler, avec le prêt.  Elle exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans. Parallèlement, elle est aussi facilitatrice à Tostan, une ONG qui aide la société Sénégalaise.  Elle a déjà reçu deux crédits auprès de l’IMCEC et elle les a bien remboursés.   Elle a 30 ans et habite à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.   Elle est célibataire, et avec les revenus de son entreprise, se prend elle-même en charge.
texts.en:
Ms. Marame M. is requesting a loan to buy chicks, 18 sacks of feed, and vaccines. At the same time, she intends to refurbish her chicken coop with this loan. She has been in this business for three years. Concurrently, she is also a facilitator at Tostan, an NGO that helps Senegalese society. Ms. M. has had two loans from IMCEC, and she has repaid them. She is 30 years old and lives in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She is unmarried and supports herself with the revenues from her enterprise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed, and vaccines

loans.name: Bolaji

texts.en: Bolaji O. is 34 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions like noodles, toothpaste, brushes, detergent, etc. She is requesting a loan for the amount of N40,000 to purchase more to provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Niagnéguéton 4 Group

texts.fr:
Niagnéguéton 4 est un regroupement de femmes du   hameau Sinsina Sesso de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région du Mali) qui   vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et sont mères d’au moins 4 enfants.
Elles cultivent principalement de l’arachide et du mil.
Pour satisfaire leur besoin en semences, intrants et petits matériels agricoles pour la culture de l’arachide et du mil, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a quatre  ans (4 prêts de campagnes). Tous le précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, de mil et d’intrants. 
Elles se procurent  en ces différents articles au marché de Koutiala. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues. Elles vendent les céréales  dans tous les marchés qui sont aux environs de Koutiala et au grand marché. 
Après la vente des récoltes, les femmes du groupe Niagnéguéton 4 comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 80 000 FCFA chacune qui sera utilisé pour faire face aux dépenses familiales et pour le remboursement du prêt.
texts.en:
Niagnéguéton 4 is comprised of women of the Sinsina Sesso hamlet of the town of Koutiala (third region of Mali) who live in big, extended traditional families. They have have an average age of 28 and are the mothers of at least 4 children each. They grow mainly peanuts and millet.

To satisfy their needs in terms of seed, entrants, and minor agricultural material for cultivating peanuts and millet, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso, four years ago (four rural loans). All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

The present loan will be used to buy minor agricultural material, a sufficient quantity of peanut and millet seeds, and entrants. The women buy these various articles at the market in Koutiala. After the rainy season, the harvests are stocked for a time so that they gain in value before being sold. They sell cereals in all the markets around Koutiala and in the big open-air market.

After the sale of the harvests, each of the women of the Niagnéguéton 4 group expects to make a profit of 80,000 F CFA which will be used to cover current family expenses and reimburse the loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of entrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en: Sobir is married with two children and is from Isfara in the southern part of Tajikistan. He sells foodstuffs in his grocery store. His merchandise is assorted and of very good quality. He has been in this trade for almost three years. Sobir is very disciplined and responsible. He is thorough and his mind is very sharp – he can keep all his business details in his head. All these qualities have helped him to overcome many challenges that have come his way and allowed him to reach success in business. He has always sought to achieve economic freedom and independence. He is hoping this loan will help his venture to continue growing and continue bringing him profit. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Jose Trinidad

texts.es: Jose Trinidad es soltero, de 31 años de edad, de profesion psicologo clinico, y ademas trabaja como deocente en la universidad en Nueva Guinea, es una persona muy estudiosa, ya que tiene 2 carreras universitarias y esta estudiando derecho, el hecho de no tener compromisos personales le ha permitido prepararse, pues manifiesta que no quiere que le sucesa lo de sus hermanos que se casaron y no continuaron sus estudios.  No tiene ni compañera, ni hijos, habita en casa de sus padres y es donde hará la mejora, pero ahi habitan otros hermanos y no tiene privaciadas los fines de semana que el viene. Esta solicitando su 4to credito para la construccion de un anexo, el que utilizara para dormitorio y tener mayor comodidad, sus creditos anteriores los utlizo para pagos de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jose Trinidad is single, 31 years old, and a clinical psychologist. He also works as an instructor at a university in New Guinea. He is a very studious person and in addition to his career in psychology, he is also studying to become a lawyer. Since he is single and has no children, he has had the freedom to study and to better himself. In Nicaragua he lives with his parents. He has to share a room with his siblings and he does not have privacy on the weekends when he comes home from work. He is now requesting his 4th loan which he will use to build his own room so that he is more comfortable and have more privacy. The loans that he has requested before has been used to pay for his education.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The constuction of a bedroom

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is newly married and runs a stationery business with a family member. He also provides typing and photocopy services. He supplies stationery to the schools in the rural areas. His major challenge is transporting the stationery to these schools. He has been in this business, which has big potential for growth, for the past two years. The stationery business is a big market in Kenya and is dominated by big players who able to undercut prices and squeeze the margins for the small players. However, Alex has discovered a niche market in the rural areas. He is now requesting a loan of Kshs 50,000 to buy more stationery for the needy schools.

loans.use: To buy more stationery to be supplied to institutions in the rural areas

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is a member of the Semkini borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 26 years old woman ,she is married and a mother of 1 child,Her child is aged 1 year.

 Happy started her own food business selling meat 3 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 130,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Happy`s fist loan from BRAC_Tanznaia she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more meat.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Happy hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: For the past ten years, Rebeca has been trading in palm oil. She is 40 year old woman, married six children who are schooling. She treks to Asamang, a town in the Eastern region of Ghana to purchase her palm oil from the producers in bulk and retail to her customers. She treks them to Accra to trade and she can no longer buy enough quantities. She hopes the loan will enable to inject more capital into the business to meet the demands of the market. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk gallons of palm oil to avoid price hikes and frequent travels. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy bulk gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is 33 years old and married with two children.  She sells yams to make a living.  Roseline lives in Delta State, Nigeria.  She has been in business for a long time.  Roseline hopes for the loan of N100, 000 to purchase more yams to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more yams to sell.

loans.name: Carla Karina

texts.es:
Carla tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre y sus dos hermanos  menores de 14 y 3 años de edad en el centro poblado menor San Agustín, ubicado en la carretera a Pimentel, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Con el ahorro familiar y mucho sacrificio pudieron comprar una combi (vehículo con capacidad para 15 pasajeros) la cual inscribió en una compañía de transporte público que cubre la ruta Pimentel – Chiclayo, esta es la única fuente de ingreso con la cual se solventan los gastos económicos diarios y también los gastos de educación y cuidado de sus hermanos menores.

El continuo uso de esta unidad móvil ha hecho que empiece a sufrir considerables daños en el motor, dejándola fuera de operatividad, lo que le ha llevado a solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y en el mantenimiento general de su fuente de ingreso.

Carla sueña con tener una flota de vehículos dedicados al servicio de transporte público y también estudiar una carrera técnica de administración para seguir apoyando a su familia.

Ella es una joven muy responsable, sus vecinos la estiman mucho ya que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se la necesita.
texts.en:
Carla is 23 years old and single and lives with her mother and two younger siblings, 14 and 3 years old, in the small town of San Agustín, located on the highway to Pimental, 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. With her family's savings and great sacrifices, they were able to purchase a combi (a 15-passenger van) which was then registered with a public transportation company that covers the route between Pimental and Chiclayo. This is the only source of income with which they cover daily expenses as well as education and childcare expenses for her younger siblings. The continuous use of this vehicle has begun to cause considerable damage to its engine, leaving it inoperable. This is what has led her to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2500 nuevos soles, which she plans to invest in the repair and general maintenance of her source of income. Carla dreams of owning a fleet of vehicles dedicated to public transportation as well as pursuing a technical degree in administration in order to continue supporting her family. She is a very responsible young woman whose neighbors greatly respect her because she is always happy to help when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repair and general maintenance of a vehicle

loans.name: Faizihon

texts.ru: Шодиев Файзихон проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Файзихон имеет среднее образование. Жена домохозяйка. Файзихон более 4 лет занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает их на рынке в качестве мяса.
texts.en:
Faizihon S. lives in the Yavan district. He is 46 years old, married and has 6 children. Faizihon has secondary education. His wife is a homemaker. Faizihon has been involved in animal husbandry for over 4 years; he raises and sells livestock at a market for meat consumption.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es: Carmelina T. D. H. resiD. en Zacatecoluca del departamento D. La Paz. Carmelina tiene 47 años D. edad vive con su esposo quien trabaja como motorista y sus tres hijos D. 21, 17 y 10 años D. estas, todos estudiantes. Carmelina ha dedicado la mitad D. su vida  a su negocio, una tienda con productos D. consumo, son veintitrés años D. constancia en su negocio, con el cual ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar a su esposo, ahora ella ha amplificado sus ventas con la producción D. antojitos que ofrece cada tarD., el deseo D. Carmelina es continuar creciendo en sus negocio y es por ello que solicita este crédito, que le ayuD. a surtir su tienda e insumos para sus antojitos.
texts.en:
Carmelina T. D. H. lives in the Zacatecoluca department of La Paz. Carmelina is 47 years old and lives with her husband, who works as a motorcycle driver, and their three children, who are 21, 17, and 10 years old respectively and they are all students. Carmelina has spent half her life, a consistent 23 years, running her business, a general store. Over the years, she has been able to use her business's income to support her husband. Recently, she has expanded her sales by making snacks and selling them in the afternoon. Carmelina's wish is to continue expanding her business, which is why she is seeking this loan to increase her store's inventory and buy ingredients for her snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La Señora Gabriela vive en el Barrio Jardin Latino en la zona de la Radial 17 y 1/2, actualmente ella tiene su tienda de venta de ropa en la Nueva Feria de Barrio Lindo los dias miercoles y sabado, necesita capital de trabajo ya que las ventas en los ultimos meses del año suben porque salen a vender todos los dias a partir de diciembre por las fiestas de fin de año, ella tiene dos hijos que aun no van a la escuela, su pareja trabaja de cajero en una farmacia todos los dias, por lo que ella ademas de atender su negocio esta criando sus hijos, ella su pareja esperan poder comprarse una casa el año que viene y poder pagarla de a poco con su negocio, para poder darle a sus familia ambientes comodos y poder independizarse, ella se siente muy orgullosa de su trabajo y esta muy contenta con las oportunidades que le brinda Emprender .
texts.en:
. Gabriela lives in the Bario Jardin Latino in the Radial 17 and 1/2 zone. She has a clothing sales stand in the Barrio Lindo New Fair on Wednesdays and Saturdays. She needs working capital because sales tend to increase during the final months of the year because she sells every day during December leading up to the end-of-year holidays. She has two young children who are still too young to go to school. Her partner works as a cashier in a pharmacy every day which means that she, besides tending to her business, must care for her children. She and her partner hope to be able to buy a house next year and pay for it little by little with profits from their business to give their family a comfortable environment and to be able to become independent. She is very proud of her work and happy with the opportunities that Emprender offers her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
JANET ISABEL C. A., TIENE 41 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE 4 HIJOS, Y A PESAR D. ESTAR SEPARA D. SU ESPOSO, TIENE UNA BUENA RELACIÓN PARA EL BINESTAR D. SUS HIJOS.
JANET, INTEGRA EL GRUPO “NUEVO AMANECER”, AL  IGUAL QUE SEIS SOCIAS MAS QUE VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS.
HACE SEIS MESES INCIÓ EN LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA A TRAVES D. CATALOGOS, FUE INVITADA POR UNA AMIGA A PARTICIPAR Y LE HA IDO BIEN.
ADEMAS TRABAJA EN UNA EMPRESA D. PROGRAMACION D. EVENTOS LOS FINES D. SEMANA, LE GUSTO MUCHO ESTA LÍNEA D. TRABAJO POR LO QUE TIENE PLANIFICADO EN UN FUTURO TENER SU EMPRESA D. EVENTOS SOCIALES.
CON SU TRABAJO ELLA HA PODIDO LOGRAR UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA, APOYAR A SUS HIJOS EN SUS ESTUDIOS Y COMPRATIR GASTOS CON SU ESPOSO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN PEDIDO D. TORTAS
texts.en:
Janet Isabel C. A. is 41 and has four children. In spite of being separated from her husband, she has a good relationship with him for their children’s well being. Janet is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer Group. There are six other members who live in the Comas district. Six months ago she started selling beauty products by catalog. She was invited to participate by a friend. It has gone well for her. She also works in a business which schedules week end events. She really likes this line of work. In the future she plans to have a business of social events. With her work she has been able to achieve economic stability, support her children’s education, and share expenses with her husband. She will use the loan for cake orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cake orders

loans.name: Santa Elisa Group

texts.es:
La Srta. Rosmery tiene 31 años desde muy jovencita vendía verduras en un puesto del mercado junto a su abuelita a quien ayudaba, pero al ver que su padre y sus tíos fabricaban seguros de puertas (cerraduras, candados, cerrojos) ella decide iniciarse en ese negocio pero ofreciéndolos directamente a los comerciantes ferreteros. al principio su timidez fue una barrera, pero con el pasar del tiempo logro consolidarse  logrando que los hombres que son la mayoría de sus clientes puedan confiar en ella.
 Rosmery tiene muchos clientes y su negocio cada día crece, actualmente reparte sus productos al por mayor, con  sus ganancias ha logrado adquirir 3 puestos de venta en una galería, los que esta construyendo poco a poco, tiene en mente para el futuro importar maquinarias para convertirse en fabricante de lo que ahora vende, con el préstamo de EDAPROSPO terminara la construcción de uno de sus puestos de venta, entre sus planes para el futuro esta  seguir progresando, quiere convertirse en una empresaria de éxito. Por eso ella se prepara y le gusta asistir  capacitaciones y conferencias sobre empresas para lograr todo lo que quiere.


*La Señorita Rosmery es la de casaca marron y chompa roja
texts.en:
Srta. Rosmery is 31 years old and had been selling vegetables since a very young age. She managed a market stand with her grandmother working as her assistant. When her father and uncles started manufacturing security devices (locks, padlocks, and bolts), she decided to get into the business of selling these products directly to hardware merchants. At first she had to overcome her shyness, but over time she successfully stood firm with the men who make up the majority of her customers and now have confidence in her. Rosemery has many customers and her business continues to grow each day. She currently distributes her products wholesale. With the earnings she generated, she was able to acquire three vending posts at a shopping center. As she continues to gradually build her business, Rosmery has plans in the future to import machinery for manufacturing the same products that she currently sells. With her loan from EDAPROSPO, Rosemery will complete construction of one her vending stalls. She wants to continue progressing and become a successful entrepreneur. Rosmery prepares herself by attending seminars and business conferences so that she can achieve everything she wants. *Srta. Rosmery is the woman wearing the red sweater and brown jacket.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of a vending post

loans.name: Bernadette's Group

texts.en:
Bernadette B. is from the village of Pulay, Luna, Isabela. She is 37 years old. Bernadette is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Bernadette is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Bernadette owns & operates a general store where she sells food & daily use products in the local community. Bernadette has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bernadette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadette is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bernadette from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is married and mothers five children, all of whom are currently in school. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. 

Adwoa is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside in her community. She buys her raw materials from nearby towns. Adwoa has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Youmou

texts.fr: Youmou S. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de SANTHIABA-SUD depuis 2 ans et a eu 4 expériences avec le crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus et de denrées alimentaires tel que du riz, du sucre et de l'huile végétale. Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa famille et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Youmou S. is a 60 year old woman, she is married with 2 children. She has been a member of the "Banc villageois" of SANTHIABA-SOUTH for the past 2 years and has had 4 loans. She is building up a small business selling fabrics and food staples such as rice, sugar and vegetable oil. Her goal is to support her family and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her capital investment

loans.name: Victor Raúl

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Victor Raúl,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 53 años de edad, nuestro socio es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 27, 25, 23 años de edad, Nuestro socio es profesor jubilado, nuestro socio está educando a su menor hijo en la universidad y al segundo está terminando de pagarle los últimos semestres de sus estudios, el socio solicita el préstamo para poder hacer el pago de mensualidades de su hijo.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member Victor Raúl belongs to the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank. He lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district 45 minutes from Cusco. He is 53, married, with 3 children ages 27, 25 and 23. He is a retired professor, currently educating his youngest son at the university as well as completing payments for the education of his second son. He is requesting a loan in order to make the monthly payments for his son. He appreciates this opportunity and commits himself to complete his payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University tuition for his son

loans.name: Barbara Graciela

texts.es:
Bárbara León de 51 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento. Es soltera pero ya todos sus hijos se han independizado.   

Bárbara aprendió a coser desde muy pequeña ya que su madre le enseño a hacer bordados, tejer, etc. Debido a la necesidad que tenia cuando cumplió 15 años comenzó a realizar su propio trabajo con cliente de su madre. 

Ahora ella tiene su propia maquina de coser en su casa y con clientes fijos. Trabaja desde las muy temprano hasta terminar todas las piezas de tela. La diabetes que tiene es una de las complicaciones más fuertes que tiene para su negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tela, hilos, una cortadora para su negocio. En el futuro  quiere tener un taller bien construido y poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Bárbara León, 51, lives in a periurban area along Guayaquil's beltway. Her house is cement. She is single and all her children are now independent. Bárbara learned to sew as a little girl because her mother taught her to embroider, to knit, etc. Because of need, at the age of 15, she began her own work with some of her mother's customers. Now, she has her own sewing machine at home and regular customers. She starts her work very early in order to finish all the fabric pieces. One of her greatest challenges in her work is her diabetes. She will use the funds to buy fabric, thread and a pattern cutter for her business. In the future, she would like to have a well-supplied shop and to do some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Fabric, Thread and a Pattern Cutter.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent sells used clothes to earn a living. She is 36 years old and married with two children who go to school. Her business is located in Kiserian, on the outskirts of Nairobi city. She has been in her business for five years. She also keeps poultry to get enough money to provide her family with basic needs and pay school fees for her children. Thanks to her customer care skills, she makes a good turnover, though it is not much money due to her limited capital. She hopes to grow her business and improve her standard of living in the future. Millicent has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en: Mrs. Sovann H. is 40 years old and lives in Prey Mean village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Bunthorn Chea, is a construction worker. He receives a small salary to support his family. Even with both businesses, they still don't earn enough to improve the family's standard of living. Thus, Mrs. Sovann H. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. This couple has two children. One child stays at home and supports the mother's business and the other one is six years old. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Rosa Argentina es una mujer emprendedora, de 57 años de edad, con una familia de tres hijos, y su esposo. Su negocio es una variedad, de productos como: venta de tropigas, frijoles cocidos, alquiler de cuartos, a demás recibe remesa de una hija que tiene en el extranjero, en donde con estas ha logrado la inversión de su negocio, su esposo vende y compra oro, lo cual ha permitido el desarrollo y crecimiento del mismo.
Su casa es de concreto y logrado las mejoras gracias a las ganancias de sus ventas. Con este financiamiento comprara materiales para poner cielo raso y así evitar la alta temperatura. Contenta por que gracias a los esfuerzos de su familia y el financiamiento obtendrá mejor comodidad en su vejez
texts.en:
Doña Rosa Argentina is an empresarial woman of 57 years old. She has a family of 3 children and her husband. Rosa has a varied business, such as selling gas and cooked beans, and renting out rooms. She also receives a remittance from one of her daughters, who lives overseas. With this help Rosa has been able to invest in her business. Her husband buys and sells gold, which has also permitted her to develop and grow her business. Rosa's house is made from concrete and she has been able to make improvements to it thanks to her sales. With this loan she will purchase materials to put a ceiling in and avoid the high temperatures. Rosa is content because thanks to the efforts of her family and this loan she will have better comfort in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 54-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has four children. He has been renting a shop to sell sinks, pipes, and other plumbing devices since 2008. He has 26 years of experience in the industry. Because of his extensive experience, he has a broad customer base that includes friends, neighbors, and professional contacts.  Majed is extremely proud of his work and believes that it is his experience that has helped him succeed. 

He is requesting a loan of US$ 2000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He is planning to use the loan to purchase a new sink that he can then sell. This will be his first loan from Al Majmoua. In the future, Majed hopes to further expand his business. He learned about Al Majmoua through the local loan officer.

loans.use: To new sink for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Melhim

texts.en:
Melhim is a 31-year-old married man from Lebanon who has owned a barber shop since 1999 that he opened in his hometown. He's an experienced hairdresser, having more than ten years of experience. He caters to a wide range of clientele in the village and its neighborhoods.

Today, Melhim wishes to improve the decor of his barber shop and buy new tools for his work. He will also increase his merchandise such as shampoos, gels, sprays, etc. In order to do so, he is requesting a $1,500 loan.

Melhim is certain that, with the help of the loan, his business productivity will be increased, as well as his income. In the future, he plans to expand his shop by putting in a sauna, jacuzzi and more for his clients.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his barber shop and buy new tools for his work

loans.name: Jackeline Baltazara

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en el caserío Punto Cuatro, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito agrícola de Mochumí, el lugar pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace dos años en la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella ofrece estos productos a los vecinos de su localidad, actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes ya fidelizados que siempre acuden a ella para solicitar los productos que necesitan. Jackeline no se conforma y siempre se encuentra buscando nuevos clientes, ya que mientras mas clientes capte la empresa que le provee de productos suele darle más puntos por los cuales percibe más ganancias.

Adicionalmente ella también se dedica a la preparación de tortas y dulces típicos los cuales ofrece en venta en su domicilio, con estos ingresos ella apoya a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía familiar, el trabaja en un taller mecánico.

Jackeline desea adquirir productos de belleza por su cuenta para instalar un pequeño puesto de venta en su vivienda que cuente con stock permanente, esto le permitirá dar una mejor atención a sus clientes ya que podrán contar con productos al alcance de la mano y no tendran que esperar hasta el fin de mes que llegue el pedido para obtenerlos.

Para lograr su objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos le consideran una persona tranquila y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. She lives in the country in Punto Cuatro, a rural area that belongs to the Mochumí agricultural district. This is part of the Lambayeque province and is forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been working for two years selling beauty products from a catalogue. She offers these products to the neighbors in her area. She currently has a group of loyal customers that always go to her to order the products they need. Jackeline is never satisfied and she is always looking for new customers. The company that supplies the products to her usually gives her more points the more customers she attracts so she earns more. She also works preparing typical cakes and sweets which she sells from her home. With her earnings she helps her husband with family expenses. He works in a garage. Jackeline wants to acquire beauty products on her own to set up a small sales stand in her home that is permanently stocked. This would allow her to give her customers better service by having the products on hand and not having to wait until the end of the month to get them when the order arrives. In order to reach her goal she saw that she needed to apply for a loan of 1000 PEN for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa. Her neighbors where she lives consider her quite a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to expand catalogue sales business.

loans.name: Elma Guimalon Group

texts.en:
Elma G. is from the village of Bunawan Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Elma is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Blueberry.

Elma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & provide working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Khusen

texts.en:
J. Khusen is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children. For about sixteen years he has dedicated himself to farming wheat and vegetables. Khusen enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious parts of farming are the preparation of land for planting and protecting the crop from insects that spoil his harvest. Fortunately for Khusen, his products are in high demand in his area and fetch high prices at the market. 

This is his 5th loan from IMON International. He will use the money to buy seeds and fertilizer for his fields. Khusen thanks all who support him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice O. is 25  years old and married to Elly Osindi who is a casual employee at Old Nyanza hosipital. They are blessed with two children ages five years and two years respectively. Eunice does maize roasting at Kisumu stage which is a very busy place. She is able to sell hot maize to her clients. Eunice has been in this business for about two years and she is able to get a profit of Kshs.7,000 per month. Her husband's work also contributes to part of the family income. 

Eunice learned about KADET LTD from a friend. She is applying for her first loan of Kshs.10,000 from KADET. She plans to buy more stock of fresh maize for her business. The anticipated income will be used to diversify her business to also sell roasted groundnuts.

Eunice's hopes are to give her children a better education and to support her elderly parents who are living in the village.

loans.use: To add stock of fresh maize to roast

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa K. is a 30-year-old married father of two children aged eight years and four years. His wife, Peris Tabu, is a tailor.

Karisa is a carpenter in Kilifi and his business has been in operation for six years. He is borrowing his first loan from KADET and plans to buy trees in KIlifi to split and make timber. He operates his carpentry business in an area called Kwa Charo Wa Mae and his customers are the area locals.

Karisa hopes to become successful and meet all his family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy trees in Kilifi to split and make timber

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Saylla en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha;  La socia tiene 47 años de edad;  ella es casada  y tiene 3 hijos, La socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella compra y vende cervezas en la calle pasión en Saylla, ella tiene su tienda también prepara botanas y vende en el mismo local. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar cervezas al por mayor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cervezas para el negocio.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is part of the Los Rosales de Saylla communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Saylla, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Martha is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She works as a retail merchant, buying and selling beers on Calle Pasión (Passion Street) in Saylla. She has a store and also makes and sells snacks there. Martha is requesting the loan to buy wholesale beers for her business.

She appreciates and values the loan provided and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: To purchase beers for her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort V. sells palm kernel oil at Teterem near Elmina. Comfort has received senior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Comfort has been selling palm kernel oil for some time now. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy palm nuts to process into oil to sell. She hopes to reinvest her profit back into her business.

In this picture, Comfort is demonstrating one of the steps in the palm kernel oil making process. She is pouring the milled palm fruit from a height to remove any dirt that might be stuck within the kernels.

loans.use: To buy palmnuts to process into oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Susie Fe

texts.en:
Mrs. Susie Fe L. is from the Barangay of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married to Sergio L. and blessed with four children. Two of her children are now working abroad and the other two are school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a Sari-sari Store and a Carenderia (restaurant) business. She is also receiving support from her husband's salary as a government employee. She’s been engaged in this kind of Sari-sari Store and Carenderia business for 13 years already. She is earning an average amount of not less than PHP 8,000 from this kind of business. 

Just this year, Susie Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susie Fe, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is now requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 as her first loan, which will be used for the financing of her agricultural activity. Any remaining amount will be used as additional capital for her existing Sari-sari store and carenderia business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To finance her agricultural activity and for additional capital for her business

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana C. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 52 years old. Feliciana is married and has 2 children aged 24 and 23. To make a living, Feliciana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Feliciana wishes to be a successful entrepreneur.

Feliciana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Feliciana is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory L. is 37 years old, separated from his spouse and has four school-aged children. He is from the village of Balbagon, a part of the municipality of Mambajao in Camiguin province on the Mindanao islands. Lory operates a business providing habal-habal or motorela services to local community members. Lory has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lory joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Lory is requesting a loan, his first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for maintenance

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina A. is a married woman who lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: sari-sari (general) store and a gasoline retailing business.  Her husband Ricky A., who is 41 years old, works as a pay-load operator to earn his living.  They have 3 children who are between the ages 3 to19 years old.  

Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her increase her monthly profit to 30,000 PHP,  increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she could continue to save up for the future purchase of a second hand tricycle to use as another income source. Gina A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El señor Juan Bautista A. Hernández cuenta con un negocio de la venta de tacos de cabeza de res desde hace 4 años el cual es denominado “Tacos A.”. El acondiciono una carrucha como cocina móvil pensando en trasladarlo a cualquier lugar de la ciudad; pero aun no cuenta con que moverlo para esto el necesita un camioneta grande que pueda soportar el peso para moverlo.
Juan es padre de tres pequeños  los cuales desea ofrecer lo mejor, por ello sale cada día a vender para sustentar los gastos.
texts.en: Juan Bautista A. Hernández has a business selling beef tacos.  He has had his business for 4 years and it is called "Tacos A.".  He fitted out a cart as a mobile kitchen thinking that he could move it to any spot in the city.  However, in order to move it he needs a big truck that will support its weight.  Juan is the father of three young children for whom he would like to provide the best he can.  For this reason, he goes out every day to make his sales in order to cover their expenses.

loans.use: To buy a truck for his business

loans.name: Jackson Wamutu

texts.en:
Jackson Wamutu M., age 38, owns a retail shop as a primary business and also manages a green grocery shop in Mbotela estate. He is married to Anne, age 32, who is a farmer and contributes additional income for the family. They have three school-going children. 

Jackson has been in his business for five years with an income of 16,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. He was introduced to KADET by staff. He is applying for his fourth loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more stock for the shop, e.g., rice and sugar, and also to buy assorted vegetables for the green grocer shop. He plans to use the extra income to educate his children and expand the business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add more stock like rice and sugar, and buy assorted vegetables

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a thirty-nine-year-old mother with six children .She wants a loan to buy cosmetics and hair extensions for resale. She runs a salon in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She dreams of expanding her business, educating her children, and having a modal home.

loans.use: Buying  cosmetics and hair extensions for resale

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es:
Elsa García E. residente en una urbanización muy cerca  al mar,  donde la playa, la brisa el sol y la alegría son las características de este ambiente, en el cual se desenvuelve su  negocio de preparación de fritos y pasteles de pollo, carne, y queso, con el que  hace 11 años viene trabajando, para lograr el sostenimiento de sus dos hijos en las edades de 16 y 18 años.  Ella inicio su idea emprendedora en su casa, vendiendo fritos solamente y gradualmente se fue trasladando para tiendas vecinas a quienes le da un dinero diario por concepto de alquiler. Su hija mayor trabaja con ella especialmente en las ventas y con ellas ha salido adelante con su negocio,  pues ha logrado tener su casa propia y aun todos los días se esfuerza por aumentar su bienestar familiar, por eso necesita mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y justamente ese es su gran desafío, porque requiere capital con el que en la actualidad no cuenta, para este propósito.
En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer credikiva, con el comprará insumos al por mayor, como aceites, arroz, y azúcar principalmente,  pues  son los que mas aumentan de precio constantemente.
