He sells all kinds of pants, jeans and skirts. His business is located in a market close to his home. What is more he travels to various provinces of Guayaquil also to complete his sales. Jose works from 7 am until 2 pm from Monday to Sunday. He travels one day a week to the provinces to sell his merchandise.

Use of the Loan:

Mr. Jose desires the loan to buy more pants, since he does not account with sufficient capital to invest. He travels to the city of Cuenca to buy merchandise and what is more spends for travel expenses. He desires the poan to be able to travel with more money and in this manner acquire more merchandise which will permit him to give a better sales price to his customers.

Personal Information:

Mr. Jose is 45 years old, is married to Mrs. Monica and they have two children of minor age who are in college. His wife helps him in the business when he goes out to travel. His house has two floors but is in construction. They have a stable home and good family realtions. Mr. Jose aspires to grow his business through loans and in this manner to give a better education to his children and better the quality of life for him and his family.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don José lleva 8 años dedicado al comercio, el inicio esta actividad desde muy joven, porque ayudaba a su mamá para obtener los ingresos para el hogar. El vende todo lo que son pantalones jeans y faldas. Su negocio esta ubicado en un mercado cerca de su domicilio. Además el viaja a distintas provincias de Guayaquil para también realizar sus ventas. José trabaja desde las 7am hasta las 14pm de lunes a domingo. El viaja 1 vez a la semana a las provincias para vender su mercadería.

Uso del Préstamo

Don José desea el crédito para comprar más pantalones, ya que no cuenta con suficiente capital para invertir. El viaje a la ciudad de Cuenca a comprar la mercadería y además gasta en viáticos. Desea el crédito para poder viajar con más dinero y de esta manera adquirir más mercadería lo que le permitirá dar un mejor precio de venta a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Don José tiene 45 años, es casado con doña Mónica ellos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que están en el colegio. Su esposa le ayuda en el negocio cuando el se va de viaje. Su casa es de 2 pisos pero esta en construcción. Tienen un hogar estable y buena relación familiar. Don José aspira crecer son su negocio a través de los créditos y de esta manera darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida de él y la de su familia

loans.use: Increase his inventory of pants - Incrementar su inventario

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. Rosemary I. is 36 years old, and is a happily married mother of 4 children. She hails from the urban sector of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for 2 years as a secretary of her union. She has a boutique where she sells all kinds of women's clothes and she needs the loan amount of $1175 to buy more clothes for sale. She has been in this business since 1999.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es:
Miss Leocadia belongs to the Rosales Communal Bank. Her business is located at San Martin de Alao, El Dorado province, San Martin state. Her charisma and working spirit has allowed her to maintain her clients. Her clients have also recommended her to other people. She has her store at home but she preferst to go out to sell at the village town centers. She feels that going to the town centers allows her to have more direct contact with her clients.

With the recent loan given by Manuela Ramos of S/. 2,000.000 (US $667.00) which will be repaid in 6 quotas, she will purchase various assortments of merchandise. The end of the year holidays are coming and it is the time of year when her clients purchase the most. She will assort her business with the purchase of gentleman's dress pants (two dozen of diverse colors), lady's dresses (12 units), ladies', gentleman's and boys' underwear (6 dozens of each), dress polos ( two dresses), dresses and outfits for girls (two dozens) and other clothing items requested by her clients.

She is 48 years old and her adventurous spirit has allowed her to have a better contact with her clients because she is not afraid of knocking on their doors to offer her products. She has four children, two boys and two girls. The two oldest, a girl and a boy, help her sell her merchandise from home.

Her husband works in agriculture. This activity has allowed her to meet more people and increment her sales. She always does her best not to miss an opportunity to increment her client portfolio.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

señora Leocadia pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Rosales, su negocio está ubicado en la localidad de San Martín de Alao, provincia de El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Su carisma y espíritu trabajador le a permitido mantener a sus clientes y que ellos mismos la recomienden. Tiene su local en su domicilio pero ella prefiere salir a vender en los centros poblados aledaños, ya que allí siente que tiene un contacto más directo con sus clientes. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ($ 667.00) el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará mercadería muy surtida ya que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año y es una de las principales épocas donde sus clientes compran en mayor cantidad. Surtirá su negocio con la compra de pantalones de vestir para caballeros (02 docenas de diversos colores), vestidos para damas (12 unidades), prendas interiores para damas, caballeros y niños (06 docenas de cada tipo), polos de vestir (02 docenas), vestidos y conjuntos para niñas (02 docenas) y entre otras prendas que le vayan pidiendo sus clientes. Ella tiene 48 años y su espíritu aventurero le a permitido fidelizarse más con sus clientes, ya que ella no tiene temor para tocar sus puertas y ofertarles su mercadería, tiene 04 hijos, dos de los cuales son varones y 02 mujeres, los dos mayores, una de ellas mujer y el segundo varón son quien le apoyan en la venta de la mercadería en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ya que es una actividad que le ha permitido a ella conocer a más personas e incrementar sus clientes, trata de no perder la oportunidad de aumentar su clientela.

loans.use: Purchase clothing items

loans.name: Bangkok Group

texts.en:
Abdugapur (second from left in the photo) leads this team of Microinvest clients, who call themselves the Bangkok Group. He was chosen as leader because he has been in the business of rearing and selling farm animals for 10 years. He is widely known in his community as an expert in this field, and people routinely come to him for help or advice about how to breed cattle.

The second member is Turgunoi (far left), who has been in the business of animal husbandry for more than three years. Currently, she is raising one cow with the help of her three children. Mamadjon (second from right) is raising three young calves, which he plans to sell when they are grown. Mavlonkul (far right), the fourth and last member of this group, is very experienced at raising sheep and hogs.

The Bangkok Group is one of the most honest and diligent clients we have at Microinvest. The members are very friendly and always willing to help each other repay their loan on time. Abdugapur will use his portion of the new loan to buy fodder. Turgunoi will buy two baby calves. Mamadjon and Mavlonkul will use their money to rebuild their farm.

loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
The job that María del Carmen’s husband has did not provide sufficient money to pay for her and her son’s expenses. As a result, María began to look for alternatives so that they could make more money. It was through this route that she began to sell fashion accessories such as tiaras, glasses, and bracelets. Little by little, women started spreading the word about what she sold, and her sales started to increase.

Currently, she has an order that she has not been able to fulfill since she does not have enough capital to buy and resell the goods to her customers. As a result, María is soliciting a credit of US $375, which she will repay within 6 months. With this money, María will be able to stock her business, attract more customers and make more money in order to pay for her son’s school expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

El trabajo que tiene el esposo de María del Carmen no le deja suficiente dinero como para pagar los gastos de ella y su hijo. Es por eso que María comenzó a buscar alternativas para poder obtener ingresos extras. Fue ahí como comenzó a vender artículos personales de moda, como diademas, lentes, pulseras, y poco a poco las mujeres se fueron dando cuenta de lo que vendía y los pedidos se le fueron incrementando.

Actualmente tiene un pedido que no a podido surtir puesto que no cuenta con el capital suficiente como para poder comprarlo y revenderlo entre sus clientes. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá surtir su negocio y así poder atraer mayor clientela para poder sacar dinero y pagar las necesidades que tiene su hijo en los gastos de la escuela.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Arkinaz

texts.en: Arkinaz, born in 1956, is a widow with 6 children. . She lives in Khachmaz region and has 10 years of experience in the dairy business.  Arkinaz now  needs a loan of $725 in order to buy a cow to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Kikabala Central A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane N.. She is currently in the business of selling fruit and vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Jane is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 5 children ranging from age 2 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Rehema N., Mayi N., Florence K., and Florence N.. Rehema N. has a business selling fish and wants to boost business. Mayi N. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to diversify to a restaurant business. Florence K. operates a business selling fish and wants to add more working capital. Florence N. is currently in the business of selling cabbages and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To stock large volumes of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 47 years old and is a married woman with 6 children, ranging in age from 8 to 20 years old. Zainabu owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella has a small business selling interior decorations at the Central Market in Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. Her little kiosk is filled with attractive, reasonably priced items that appeal to many customers who are looking to decorate their homes or businesses. Ella has been in business for about 10 years. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise.

Ella has requested a short term loan to help purchase a new supply of items to sell.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Madame Maimouna

texts.fr:
Mrs. Maimouna D. is a 29-year-old married woman who lost the use of a foot when she was younger. In order to provide for herself, she quickly learned to run a business, and now has 10 years' experience. She began five years ago with a solidarity loan through a women’s association, before requesting an individual loan. All her loans were repaid successfully. In addition to selling wood (her main activity), she also sells condiments, fabric and soap. She sells these items at Sikasso’s Médine neighbourhood market and in the villages surrounding Sikasso. She runs her business all year round without any major difficulties, compensating for the weaknesses of one business with the success of the others. She makes an average monthly profit of CFA 30,000. With this profit, she meets most of her expenses and helps her husband meet the expenses of the family (health, education, food, clothing, etc.). She has also bought a moped for getting around during the course of business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Maimouna D. est une femme mariée de 29 ans ayant perdu l’usage d’un pied dès sa jeunesse. Pour subvenir à ses besoins elle a vite appris à faire le commerce dont elle a une expérience de 10 ans. Elle a commencé il y a 5 ans par le prêt solidaire dans une association des femmes avant de demander le prêt individuel. Tous ses prêts ont été correctement remboursés. En plus de la vente de bois (son activité principale), elle vend aussi des condiments alimentaires, des tissus et du savon. Elle vend ses articles au marché du quartier Médine de Sikasso) et dans les villages environnants de Sikasso. Elle mène son activité durant toute l’année sans difficultés majeures en compensant les faiblesses d’une activité par les réussites des autres. Elle réalise en moyenne un bénéfice de 30.000 FCFA par mois. Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle assure l’essentiel de ses dépenses et aide son mari à assurer les dépenses de la famille (Santé, Education, Nourritures, Habillement, etc.). En plus, elle a acheté une mobylette pour ses déplacements dans le cadre de son activité.

loans.use: To buy wood supplies, cases of condiments, fabric and soap.

loans.name: Vaalotu

texts.en: 24 year old Vaalotu T. is married with two children. She has many years of experience as a seamstress, selling her products  to the general public four days per week. She earns a weekly net cash flow of 520 Tala (~216 USD).  SPBD loans are Vaalotu’s only access to capital because she has not qualified for a loan from traditional banks. She would like to request a loan in order to purchase a new industrial sewing machine to speed up her production due to increased demand. She has received six previous loans from SPBD.

loans.use: To expand her production

loans.name: Belinda Soledad

texts.es:
Belinda is a 31-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 5 children. She sells precooked food and chopped vegetables for a living. She started out by selling gelatin as a street vendor, but upon realizing that this business was not lucrative, she felt the need to start a business that would produce revenue for her yet not occupy all of her time. For this reason, she decided to set up a booth in the market a year ago. She opens everyday, except weekends, until noon. She really likes this schedule because it gives her time to look after her children. Her increasing clientele motivates her to continue. She has a difficult time with the rising cost of goods, which decreases her profits. However, this problem does not restrain her efforts. She is determined to improve her family’s quality of life.

Belinda is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of wholesale merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Belinda tiene 31 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de alimentos precocidos y verduras picadas, se inicio vendiendo gelatina de manera ambulante, pero la ver que no tenía ganancias, vio necesario abrir un negocio que le permitiera ingresos económicos y que no ocupara todo su tiempo, por ello decidió a emprender este nuevo negocio, ya va un año con su puesto en el mercado, atiende todos los días, excepto los fines de semana, que es hasta medio día. Le agrada este horario porque puede disponer de tiempo para atender a sus hijos, el aumento de la clientela la anima a continuar. Las dificultades que percibe son que a veces el incremento de los precios le dejan menos ganancias, pero esto no detiene sus esfuerzos. Está dispuesta a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Belinda solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor.

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Claude in Gisenyi, Rwanda! Jean Claude is 34 years old, married with five children and has adopted one orphan.
 
Jean Claude grows flowers and sells them in the markets and to people for wedding decorations, to churches, and for burial ceremonies. He has two flower gardens. Besides growing flowers, he also buys goats and sells them to restaurants for meat in Gisenyi town.  He earns about US$ 92 per month.

He is requesting the loan amount of 300,000 frws to be able to grow more flowers because of the increased demand of his growing clientele. He will be repaying this loan in monthly installments for 8 months.

loans.use: Increase his working capital to grow more flowers

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
La Srta. Daisy D. vive en la ciudad de Santa Maria Mnes. Posee una cabina telefonica en la ciudad de San Ignacio Mnes. donde tambien tiene venta de accesorios para celulares y celulares, y ademas una fotocopiadora. El negocio es familiar, en el trabajan Daisy, su mama y su hermano. Cuenta con una antigüedad de 8 años y tiene clientela formada.
El préstamo solicitado en nuestra institución fue para la compra  de  accesorios para celulares y telefonos ya cuenta con mucha venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
Miss Daisy D. lives in the city of Santa Maria Mnes. She owns a pay phone stand in the city of San Ignacio Mnes. where she also sells cellular phone and cell phone accessories, while offering photo copy services as well. This is a family business, attended by Daisy, her mother and her bother. They have been in business for 8 years, and they have an established customer base. The loan that they are requesting through our organization will be used to purchase cell phones and accessories, as these items are selling well.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cellular phone accessories.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao Y. is a farmer in Samraong Khang Kiet Village in Takeo Province. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to amend the field to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Lao Ream, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make only a small income to support his family. Mrs. Sao Y. is 49 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a farmer while the remaining three are attending the local school. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to amend the field

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana C., 50 years old and married with seven children, lives in Benin City with her family. She has sold provisions and a local gin called Ogogoro for several years, and now hopes to expand her business through a loan to purchase more provisions and gin to sell. Christiana says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin and provisions to sell

loans.name: Neris Del Socorro

texts.es:
Neris B. es una dama cuya labor es la venta de verduras ubicada en el sector de verduras en el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes.

El negocio lo inició desde hace 12 años habiendo obtenido los primeros productos gracias a sus propios ahorros que ella hacía anteriormente y hoy en día ha logrado mejorar dicho negocio . La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de las verduras para luego venderlas en su establecimiento en el mercado La Terminal
texts.en:
Neris B. works selling vegetables in the produce section of León's La Terminal market, where she attentively serves her customers. She started the business 12 years ago, having purchased the first products with her own prior savings. Today she has improved that business. Through Ceprodel she hopes to get a loan to buy vegetables that she can later sell from her business in the La Terminal market.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with a four-year-old daughter, Diana. She is a small entrepreneur from Velikaya Znamenka. Galina runs a small venture selling household items and clothing in the local market. She owns a small vending kiosk which is located in the busy entrance rows of this marketplace.

Galina started her small business with the help and financial support of her family. She has been at it for three years and additional lending assistance has only added to consistent growth of her sales. Galina has repaid 5 loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any problems. This time she is asking for a loan of $1025 to re-stock her merchandise with seasonal inventory.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Yohana De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Yohana de la Concepción Alarcón tiene 33 años, está casada, y tiene dos hijos. La actividad económica a la que Doña Yohana se dedica es la venta de pollo y pulpería. Hace cinco años que tiene este negocio, y lo inició porque su marido estudió zootecnia y él le sugirió establecer una venta de pollo. Sus propósitos son de mantener su fuente de ingresos y a la misma vez, crecer un poco con el fin de seguirle proporcionando a su familia lo que necesita. Al comienzo, el negocio fue muy difícil ya que no tenían muchos clientes, y por eso, Doña Yohana estableció una pulpería que ofrecía otros productos necesarios del hogar, como golosinas, huevos, sopas, jabón y detergentes. Con esta combinación, su pequeño negocio pudiera salir adelante, y a ella le gustaría este financiamiento de Kiva para que la pulpería y la venta del pollo puedan continuar a ofrecer lo que sus clientes soliciten. Sus sueños son de suministrarle a sus hijos una buena educación para que lleguen a ser unos buenos profesionales, y con este sentido, a ella le gustaría mejorar su situación económica ya que el costo de la vida está cada día más difícil por las circunstancias de las personas pobres.
texts.en:
Yohana de la Concepción Alarcón is 33 years old, married, and has two children. Yohana’s economic activity involves the sale of chickens as well as groceries. She has had the business for five years, having started at the suggestion of her husband who studied zoology. Her intention is to maintain her source of income and, at the same time, grow the business a little to continue providing for the family’s needs. At the beginning, things were very difficult because she didn’t have many customers. For this reason, Yohana established a grocery store that offered products such as snacks, eggs, soups, soaps and detergents. With this combination, her small enterprise could get ahead. She would like this financing through Kiva so that her poultry and grocery store businesses can continue to offer what her customers demand. Her dream is to provide her children with a good education so they can become professionals. Along with this sentiment, she would also like to improve the family’s financial situation since the cost of living becomes more difficult each and every day for people who are poor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Kafayat

texts.en: Kafayat, 30 years old and married with three children, wholesales and retails crates of drinks at the Ojoo Market in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more drinks for the business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Manuela Azucena

texts.es: Manuela Azucena C. A. tiene la edad de 50 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Manuela tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Manuela es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Manuela inicio este negocio por una amiga y más tarde ella decide experimentar con este negocio vendiendo productos como ropa interior, cosméticos y bolsos. Los propósitos de Doña Manuela son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que es una de sus mayores fuentes de ingresos. Los deseos de Doña Manuela son de mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia. La cantidad que solicita es de C$20.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Manuela Azucena C. A. is 50 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom work. Her main work is the purchase and sale of general merchandise. She has more than 14 years of experience in this work. Manuela began this business through a friend, and later decided to experiment with it, selling products such as undergarments, cosmetics, and handbags. Manuela intends to keep moving forward with her business as it is one of her largest sources of income. She hopes to improve the quality of life both for herself and her family. She is requesting $1000.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of goods for resale

loans.name: Telvina

texts.es:
La señora Telvina C. D. A. tiene 60 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito D. Trujillo,  provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 3ro D. primaria, abandono sus estudios debido a que su madre no tenía los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola. Tiene 04 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella. 
Telvina se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en el mercado D. la zona, cuando inició su actividad económica, se dedicaba a la venta D. ropa, negocio que abandonó debido a que tenia que cuidar a sus hijos y se dedico a la venta D. condimentos y plásticos casi 5 años; hasta que  adquirió un puesto en el mercado en donD. venD. abarrotes.  Con sus ganancias ha logrado construir su puesto en el mercado El cortijo donD. desarrolla su negocio actualmente. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en la compra D. abarrotes para ampliar su capital. 
Con el crédito D. 1200 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.) para surtir su puesto. 
Telvina tiene el sueño D. terminar D. construir su casa y lograr que sus nietos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Telvina C. D. A. is 60 years of age and lives in the Cortijo Development, in the District and Province of Trujillo, Libertad Department, Peru. She left school after the third graD. because her mother did not have the means for her to continue her education. She has four children, none of whom rely on her economically. Telvina is engaged in selling groceries in her neighborhood's market. The first business she started was selling clothing but she had to put this asiD. to care for her children. She was selling condiments and plasticware for almost five years until she acquired her stand in the market where she now sells groceries. With her earnings she has been able to build her stand in the El Cortijo market where she is currently developing her business. With her first loan of 300 Sols which she received from her bank, Nuevo Peru Communal Bank, she bought groceries in order to build up her inventory. With this loan of 1,200 Sols, which will be repaid in six months, she will be investing in the purchase of groceries (sugar, rice, noodles, etc.) in order to stock up her stand. Telvina dreams of being able finish building her house and that her grandchildren will grow up to be professional people.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 34-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Wissam has owned cattle for fifteen years. He produces milk and cheese. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to increase the number of his cattle by purchasing goats. This is the first time that Wissam has requested a loan. 
His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capitA.. JamA. decided on doing his business because of his experience since he took over his father’s business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business. 
In the picture, Wissam is shown with a donkey. He uses the donkey like in the old time. The donkey is here to help him in his transportation when he goes to far away field and he can't take his truck.  Sometimes he also uses it to carry his stuff.

loans.use: To increase the number of his cattle.

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en: Waheed O. is 48 years old and married with four children. He sells medicines and provisions. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions

loans.name: 7 Monday Group

texts.en:
This credit goes to the purchase of merchandise and basic needs. All the women have a credit from between 300,000 to 500,000 Gs.

1 Liz Fabiana M. . Used clothes sale 2 Benjamina O.. Sale of Cleaning products 3 Pablina G.. Food sales 4 Primitiva A.. Small grocery store 5 María L. . Clothing sales 6 Zulma G.. Avon product sales 7 Deolinda C.. Clothing sales 8 Josefina O.. Small grocery store 9 Presentación R.. Lingerie sales 10 Lourdes O.. Hair salon 11 Celia C. Food sales 12 Tomasa G.. Small grocery store 13 Selva E.. Coal sales 14 Lucy R.. Clothing sales 15 Basilia S.. Sports clothing sales 16 Maria A.. Food sales

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice E. is 39 years old and married with two children.

Eunice sells second-hand clothes. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell.

Eunice says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente es un cliente antiguo de la institucion, comenzo con su grupo solidario "la bolivianita"  a medida que pasaba el tiempo el demostro responsabilidad y puntualidad, su negocio es la fabricacion de joyas, su lugar de venta esta ubicado en la avenida Tiwanaku, su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico de la ciudad de El Alto, su esposo se dedica a  la joyeria juntos ellos trabajan y elaboran joyas de diferentes modelos, ella se dedica a la elaboracion de joya y ella lo vende en su tienda, el destino del credito es la compra de oror en bruto para la elaboracion de joyas de diferentes modelos.
texts.en:
Vicente is a long time client of the institution. He began with his solidarity group “La Bolivianita” and as time passed, he proved his responsibility and punctuality. He makes jewelry and sells it on Tiwanaku Avenue. His business is located in a strategic place in the city of El Alto. His wife is a jeweler and they work together, making pieces of jewelry of different models. She makes jewelry and sells it in their store. This loan will be used to purchase gold to make pieces of jewelry of different models.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase uncut gold

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: Don José Ramón tiene la edad de 44 años, reside en el barrio Villa Canadá en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa le tiene tres hijos los cuales cursan sus estudios, ella trabaja como domestica para poder salir a delante con su familia. y el trabaja en servicio de seguridad. Sus planes para su familia es  terminar de hacer su casa y poder dar estudio a sus hijos es por eso que ambos trabajan para salir adelante con su familia. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de materiales de  construcción para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y hacerla de perlines para no mojarse como el año anterior. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los préstamos el cual ha sido de muchos beneficios para lograr los objetivos de mejorar cada día, su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. José Ramón is 44 years old, and he lives in the Villa Canadá neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He is married, and he and his wife have three children who are studying. His wife works as a domestic worker to help their family get ahead, and he works in security services. Their plans for their family are to finish building their house, and for their children to continue studying. That is why they both work, to help their family move forward.

With this loan, he will invest in construction materials to change the roof of their house and build it with beams so it doesn't leak like it did last year. He gives his thanks to the Afodenic organization for their support with loans, which have helped him to achieve his goal of improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to change his roof

loans.name: Adjowa Lydia

texts.fr: Cette dame vend des plats, seaux et des objets en plastique depuis 2007 à Soviépé, l’un des quartiers périphériques de Lomé. Elle n'est pas mariée mais a 04 enfants, ce commerce lui permet de se prendre en charge et de couvrir également les besoins alimentaires et scolaires de ses enfants. Pour cela, elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour pouvoir s’approvisionner avec 20 plats, 15 seaux et une douzaine d'objets en plastique de toute sorte.
texts.en:
This is a lady who has been selling dishes, buckets, and plasticware since 2007 in Soviépé, one of the outlying districts of Lomé. She is unmarried but has four children. This commerce allows her to support herself and also to feed and school her children. For these reasons, she would like to obtain a WAGES loan to be able to stock up with 20 plates, 15 buckets, and a dozen items of plastic goods of all sorts.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dishes, pails, plasticware

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Mujeres Responsable Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Mujeres Responsables está conformado por Justina Antonia Soriano B. y Modesta del Socorro G. M. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas Justina se dedica a la venta de refrescos ella se levanta muy temprano para una buena cantidad de refrescos para la variedad de clientes ambas son muy humildes, pero siempre están luchando para salir adelante con sus negocios. Ella quieren proporcionarle la oportunidad a cada uno de sus hijos para que el día de mañana logren estudiar. Ellas solicitan este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos para cada uno de sus negocios. El sueño que comparten es mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Responsables (Responsible Women) Solidarity Group is made up by Justina Antonia Soriano Briceno and Modesta del Socorro G. M.. Each one of them has slightly different economic activities: Modesta sells second-hand clothing and Justina sells soft drinks. Justina starts her day very early in the morning when she fetches a large quantity of soft drinks to supply her various customers. Both women are very humble but are always struggling to get ahead in their activities. Both of them want to provide for their children so that they may get good educations. They will use these funds to purchase inventory for each of their businesses. Their shared dream is to improve their families living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: C. Sylvie est née le 03 Novembre 1975. Sylvie a fait les études primaires. Sylvie a abandonné les études très tôt par manque de moyens financiers. Après son mariage, Sylvie s’est mise à vendre la bouillie de maïs avec le soutien  financier de son mari. Puis Sylvie a  élargi son commerce à la vente de condiments de sauces (tomate fraîche et en boîte, oignon, poivre, ail, gingembre, gombo, crincrin, légumes, piment, sel, œufs, huiles végétales, etc.). Quand Sylvie a eu son premier crédit à ALIDé, elle a associé à ses activité la vente de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). Aujourd'hui encore, Sylvie compte à nouveau sur l’appui financier d’ALIDé pour associer à son activité la vente des produits vivriers.
texts.en:
Sylvie C. was born on November 3, 1975 and attended primary school. She abandoned her studies at a very young age due to lack of financial means. After her marriage, Sylvie began selling corn mash with the help of her husband. Sylvie then expanded her business into selling condiments for sauce (fresh and canned tomatoes, onions, pepper, garlic, ginger, okra, crincrin (mallow leaves), vegetables, chili peppers, salt, eggs, vegetable oils, etc.). When Sylvie received her first loan from Alidé, she added to her line-up items such as candies, cookies, canned food (milk, sardines and tomatoes), sugar, pasta, laundry and dishwashing detergent, soap, batteries and candles. Today Sylvie is once again relying on financial support from Alidé to add food staples to her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy misc items (pasta, canned tomatoes, sardines, milk, butter, detergent, etc) and food staples (beans, rice, cassava flour, etc)

loans.name: Julia Patricia

texts.es: Julia Patricia E. reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Julia tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos William de 21 años, Luis de 16 años y Brenda de 13 años de edad. Julia ha sacado a su familia adelante brindándoles estudios a sus tres hijos y una estabilidad familiar, Julia posee una panadería, que distribuye a varias tiendas cercanas, el crédito que Julia solicita es para comprar insumos que le permitan aumentar su producción de pan.
texts.en:
Julia Patricia E. lives in the town of Ilopango, which is in the department of San Salvador. She is 44 years old and a single mother with 3 children – William (age 21), Luis (age 16), and Brenda (age 13). Julia strives to move her family forward by providing her children with an education and a stable family life. She owns a bakery and distributes her goods to several nearby shops.

Julia is requesting a loan to buy supplies so that she increase her bread production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making bread

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando D. P. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. He is 28 years old. Armando is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Armando owns and operates a small bakeshop. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread such as cinnamon bread in the local community. Armando has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Armando joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Armando from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Kelly Betzabeth

texts.es: Kelly Betzabeth H. D. D. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Colon municipio del departamento D. La Libertad. Kelly vive con su esposo y su hijo Noé D. 17 años D. edad estudiante D. básica. José el esposo D. Kelly se dedica a las ventas D. manera ambulante y ha Kelly la ha apoyado a instalar un negocio donD. venD. variedad D. artículos como zapatos, perfumes, ropa entre otros. El deseo D. esta paraje es seguir ampliando su negocio con mayor cantidad D. mercadería y es por ello que ahora Kelly solicita D. un crédito para comprar nuevos productos par su negocio.
texts.en:
Kelly Betzabeth H. D. D. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Colon in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and son Noé, who is a 17 year old student. Kelly’s husband José is a traveling merchant and she helps him by selling various items such as shoes, perfumes, clothing, and other products from a fixed location. The couple hopes to increase their business by securing a large quantity of merchandise. For this reason, Kelly is requesting a loan to purchase new products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Ismael Flores

texts.es:
Ismael tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su madre y sus seis hermanos en el caserío Punto 9, ubicado en el distrito de Mochumí, a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, pero como esta actividad no lo provee de ingresos permanentes para apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia, hace 5 años adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utlizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que trabaja durante el tiempo en que no está haciendo labores agrícolas.

Usualmente cubre las rutas que unen a su caserío con el pueblo de Mochumí y con otros caseríos. Las distancias que tiene que cubrir son largas y muy accidentadas por lo que su unidad móvil ha sufrido serios deperfectos que necesitan de urgente reparación. Por este motivo Ismael está solicitando por primera vez  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ismael es un joven dinámico y muy emprendedor. Su más grande anhelo es mejorar la casa de su madre, debido a que está construida de material rústico y construir la suya para acoger  a su futura familia.
texts.en:
Ismael, 34, is single and lives with his mother and six brothers in the Punto 9 settlement, located in the Mochumí district, which is half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a farmer since a very young age but this occupation does not provide him with steady income to contribute to his family's support so 5 years ago he acquired a mototaxi (a motorized, 3-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) with which he works when he isn't doing his farming chores. Usually he covers the routes that unite his settlement with the town of Mochumí and with other neighboring settlements. The distances he must cover are long and over rough roads so his vehicle has suffered serious damages that need repair urgently. This is why Ismael has come to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to ask for a 1000 new sol loan. Ismael is a dynamic, very enterprising young man. His greatest wish is to improve his mother's house because it is made out of rudimentary materials and to build his own house to welcome his future family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Munay Kente Ii Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “MUNAY KENTE”. Este banco comunal está conformado por 10 miembros, ellos se reúnen una vez al mes en el local principal de La Asociación Arariwa.  

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista en la ciudad del Cusco, una gran parte se dedica a la venta de comida, de artículos, de granos, etc. Los socios Raúl y Alex se dedican al servicio de transporte en la ciudad. Las socias Francisca y Juana son empleadas domesticas. La socia Leonor se dedica a la venta de granos como maíz, cebada, trigo y mucho más. La socia Yanet trabaja como secretaria.  

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(Las socias Juana y Leonor no aparecen en la fotografía porque pidieron permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal y se fueron antes de tomar la foto).
texts.en:
Our members belong to the communal bank "Munay Kente". This village bank consists of 10 members that meet once a month at the Arariwa Association's main office. Our partners alternate their various activities with retailing in the city Cusco. A large part is devoted to selling food items, grains, etc. The members Raul and Alex work in transportation services in the city. Members Francisca and Juana are domestic employees. The member Leonor sells grains, such as corn, barley, wheat and more. Member Yanet works as a secretary. They are requesting the loan in order to use it as work capital to increase their products and sales, and thus to provide a better quality of life for their families. They value and appreciate this loan granted through this medium. Likewise, they agree to pay their dues on time. (Members Juana and Leonor do not appear in the picture because they were given permission from the communal bank's board to leave before taking the picture).

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use it as work capital and increase their products and sales

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide T. is from the village of Poblacion, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Heide is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Heide owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Heide has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Heide joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Heide has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Heide is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Heide from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and in working capital

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en: Kayode is 33 years old and married with 2 children. His children are still dependent on him and they attend school. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. His wife sells shoes to help support the home. He is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa. He is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Sobeida María

texts.es:
Antes de las 5 de la mañana Sobeida María G., hace el desayuno de su familia, se pone su gorra para protegerse del sol, encomienda a Dios que le guarde su vida y le pide gracia para vender sus productos; es entonces cuando toma su nevera de poliestireno llena de hielo, pescado y marisco, la sube en su carretilla y se va caminando muy alegre a cumplir con los pedidos que ha tomado de sus clientes el día anterior; ella está acostumbrada a caminar  diariamente, desde las 6: 00 A.m. hasta las 11:00 A.m. recorriendo mas de 10 barrios aledaños a su vivienda en Villalozano, ubicada en el municipio de Soledad - Atlántico.

Sobeida sintió la necesidad de trabajar cuando su esposo murió dejándola con 5 hijos, al principio fue empleada doméstica,  pero una amiga viendo la necesidad y la tristeza  que expresaba al dejar a sus hijos menores solos,  le recomendó buscar un negocio independiente que le permitiera atender de cerca a sus hijos y a la vez generar ingresos; fue así como con su ayuda se inició en la venta de pescado y mariscos, negocio del cual se siente orgullosa porque con el sostiene su hogar, apoya el estudio de sus hijas y hasta compró una nueva mejora y se trasladó a ella arrendando la vivienda que le dejó su marido al morir, la cual representa un nuevo ingreso.

Aunque Sobeida no estudió sabe lo importante que es educarse para la vida por esos su máximo propósito es que sus dos pequeñas hijas de  13 y 15 años lleguen  a ser profesionales, para eso les enseña a ser persistentes y  les proporciona lo necesario para que Angie Paola cumpla su sueño de ser fisioterapeuta y Marcela tenga la oportunidad de estudiar y ser profesional de la hotelería y el turismo. 

El negocio de Sobeida tiene más de 5 años, pero solo ingresó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace dos, a ella le recomendó su amiga Diosa, que también es financiada por esta entidad, porque observaba que sus deudas con pagadiario “no le rendían el dinero por los onerosos intereses que pagaba”; fue así como solicitó financiamiento y desde entonces lleva 2 créditos, este último por valor de $1.200.000, que aplicará en  la compra de mayor volumen de pescado y mariscos especialmente, proveniente del departamento de la Guajira pues le sale más favorable; manifiesta que su clientela ha crecido en más de 100 clientes y su meta es hacer algunas adecuaciones básicas en su nueva vivienda y en un futuro condicionar un punto de venta de coctel de mariscos,  preparados con deliciosas salsas, cilantro y  cebolla picada  pues en los alrededores del barrio no hay de este negocio y la gente debe caminar hasta muy lejos para degustar estas delicias.

Sus clientes la prefieren porque les enseña la preparación del pescado mediante la aplicación de exquisitas recetas lo cual le suma valor agregado a su negocio; es muy usual ver a Sobeida explicando a las amas de casa y propietarias de pequeños restaurantes, que rellenen  un bocachico con zanahoria, habichuela, ajo, cebolla ají limón, lo condimenten al gusto, lo amarre con una pita y lo pongan a asar, este es el ya famoso Cabrito, el cual es servido con patacón o  yuca, ensalada verde y agua de panela. Es así como gana el corazón de sus clientes y se ha posicionado en la venta de este estos exquisitos productos.
texts.en:
Before 5 in the morning, Sobeida María G. makes breakfast for her family, puts on her cap to protect herself from the sun, entrusts herself to God and asks for help in selling her products. It is then she takes her cooler full of ice, fish and seafood, puts it in her wheelbarrow and goes off happily fulfilling the orders she took from customers the previous day. Sobeida is used to walking daily between 6 and 11 a.m., traveling through more than 10 neighborhoods surrounding her home in Villalozano, Soledad - Atlántico. She felt the need to work when her husband died, leaving her with five children. At first she was a housemaid, but a friend saw the sadness she showed in leaving her small children alone and recommended that she look for an independent business that would allow her to be close to her children and at the same time generate income. This is how she started selling fish and seafood, a business that she feels proud of because it is her family's sustenance. The business supports her children's education and even helped her buy a new and improved home that the family moved to, and she rents the home her husband left her when he died, which adds to her income. Although Sobeida didn't go to school, she knows the importance of education in life, and for this reason her biggest goal is for her two small daughters, ages 13 and 15, to become successful. That is why she teaches them to be persistent and provides what is necessary for Angie Paola to fulfill her dream of being a physical therapist and for Marcela to have the opportunity to study hotel management and tourism and become a professional. Sobeida's business is more than five years old, but she has only worked with Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the past two years after her friend Diosa, also a client of the institution, recommended it to her after seeing her debt payments. "Don't give up your money to the onerous interest you pay," she told her. This is how Sobeida came to request financing, and since then she has taken out two loans, the latest of which she plans to use to purchase higher volumes of fish and specialty seafoods. She tells us that her clientele has grown to more than 100 customers and her goal is to make some basic adjustments to her new home with her added income. In the future she wants to set up a sales post selling seafood cocktails prepared with delicious sauces, cilantro and onions picked from the outskirts of her neighborhood, and the people will walk from far away to enjoy her delicacies. Her customers prefer her products because she shows them how to prepare the fish by using unique recipes, which adds to the value of her business. It is very normal to see Sobeida explaining to housewives and small restaurant owners how to add carrots, beans, garlic, onion, lemon pepper to their fish, season it to taste, tie it with string and put it to roast. This is her famous Cabrito, which is served with fried plantain or cassava, green salad and sweet water. This is how she won the hearts of her customers and positioned herself to sell her exquisite products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a higher volume of fish and seafood

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Olga es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Olga tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende pollos, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pollos.
Los sueños de Olga son terminar de construir su casa y vender pollo al por mayor.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Sonrisa ("Smile") communal bank. She is 31 years old and has a live-in partner and 2 children. Olga operates a stall in the Nery García market, where she works every day selling chickens. Olga needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in purchasing chickens. Olga's dreams are to finish constructing her house and to sell chicken on a wholesale basis.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chickens

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Mrs. Gina M. is 44 years old and is married with two children. She presently lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. Gina has owned a sari-sari (variety) store for more than two years and her husband is a construction worker who is also supporting their needs. Their combined income is approximately 8,800 PHP a month. Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. As of now, she has a new loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC and the purpose of this loan is to have additional capital for her sari-sari store. It is her 2nd loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 43 años, está felizmente casado con Rosinda de 33 años, tienen 5 hijos, 2 de ellos adolescentes y 3 menores. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en la sierra central peruana.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a cultivar arveja y papa en sus terrenos propios, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa y eventualmente de sus hijos. Esta familia está convencida de que la agricultura es la actividad que les permite vivir cómodamente y cubrir sus gastos en general. Por esa razón Hugo quiere continuar trabajando con préstamos porque así puede asumir tranquilamente los gastos agrícolas y obtiene más ingresos económicos porque amplia su producción. Para el futuro piensa adquirir más propiedades que cederá a sus hijos para que puedan generar sus propios beneficios cuando crezcan.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP, por lo que vive agradecido con todas las personas que hacen lo posible para que acceda su solicitud y le permiten progresar. También se muestra contento de trabajar en su banco comunal, pues está integrado por personas responsables, puntuales y muy solidarias. Con los mil quinientos que solicita podrá comprar dos bolsas de semilla de arveja aprovechando la temporada de este producto.
texts.en:
Hugo is a 43-year-old man who is happily married to Rosinda, age 33. Together they have 5 children--2 teenagers and 3 younger ones. This family lives in their own house in the Central Peruvian Sierra.

For 4 years, Hugo has been cultivating peas and potatoes in his own crop fields. He has the help of his wife, and he will eventually have his children's help. This family is convinced that agriculture is the activity that allows them to both live comfortably and cover their general expenses. For this reason, Hugo would like to continue working with loans because this way, he can calmly take on his agricultural expenses and obtain a bigger income because the loans allow him to expand production. In the future, he plans to obtain more properties, which he will then hand over to his children so that they can generate their own income when they grow up.

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he is grateful to all the people who make these loans possible, allowing him to make progress. He is also happy to work in his communal bank, which is comprised of responsible, punctual, and united people. With the 1,500.00 PEN that he is requesting, he will purchase two sacks of pea seed, thus taking advantage of the pea season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seed

loans.name: El Clavel Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Clavel está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Yohana del Socorro Velásquez L. de 24 años tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en alimentos fritos. Ella inicio hace cinco años con la venta de helados, frescos y pan y conforme fue creciendo empezó a realizar tacos, enchiladas, tajadas con queso hasta crear su negocio.

Sus compañeros de grupo Ever Antonio C. comercializa piñas y naranjas y Maricela Auxiliadora F. tiene una pequeña fritanga. Estos invertirán el préstamo en mejorar sus negocios con la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
The El Clavel group is composed of three hard-working persons. One is señora Yohana del Socorro Velásquez L., 24, who has a popular restaurant specializing in fried foods. She started five years ago selling frozen treats, soft drinks, bread and the like, and as she grew she started making tacos, enchiladas, and cheese tajadas to develop her business. Her group companions are Ever Antonio C., who sells pineapples and oranges, and Maricela Auxiliadora F. who also has a small fried food stand. They will invest the loan funds to improve their businesses, purchasing raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, a 33-year-old single man living with his father, opened a car electricity repair shop in his village in 2002.  Joseph has been involved in this occupation for the past 15 years, and with the help of severA. microloans, he has been able to develop his business over the years.  Today, Joseph is asking for a Kiva loan of $1,200 to buy new tools to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income to help his father in the household and with the heavy expenses of life.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa, tiene 24 años y tiene una hija (Milagros de 7 años). Ellas viven en la ciudad de Urubamba. Su principal actividad económica de Carmen Rosa es vender desayuno en el mercado modelo de Urubamba. Ya son tres años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Su actividad complementaria es vender CD de música y de videos de películas. Ella tiene una tienda a fuera del mercado donde vende los CD y tiene una ayudante quien atiende el local. 

Carmen Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa.  Actualmente, ella requiere el crédito para ampliar el local de venta de CD.

Carmen Rosa es una mujer joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario dar un mejor futuro a su hija. El anhelo de la socia es construir su casa  y estudiar la carrera profesional de economía en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Carmen Rosa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is 24 years old and has a daughter (Milagros-7). They live in the city of Urubamba. Carmen Rosa's income is mainly from selling breakfast in the Modelo Market in Urubamba. She has been working at this business for 3 years now, and it is going very well for her. She also works selling music CDs and movies. She has a store outside the market where she sells the CDs and she has a worker who tends to the store. Carmen Rosa belongs to the "SAYHUA" community bank of the Arariwa Association. She needs the loan to increase the size of her CD store.

Carmen Rosa is a hard-working and enterprising young woman who seeks out every opportunity to get ahead, and by her daily efforts, provide a better future for her daughter. Her goal is to build a house and study economics in a university in the city of Cuzco. Carmen Rosa is thankful for the opportunity given to her and is committed to repaying the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the size of her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ya E. is 42 years old and a villager in Pean Meas Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Poeun Maen (pictured with her), earns a small income through his work as a motorbike taxi driver. The couple has four children – one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other three are students and also support their mother's businesses.
In order to increase the family income, Mrs. Ya E. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Housing construction

loans.name: Ma. Mildred

texts.en:
Ma. Mildred L. is a 42-year-old single woman who supports her family with a general store and as a rice retailer. She lives in Brgy. Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu City with her 12-year-old child who is currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and rice retailer business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Ma. Mildred is now borrowing 12,000 PHP so that she could use it as additional working capital for her general store. This will be her 4th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ma. Mildred aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for general store

loans.name: Vaimauga

texts.en:
Vaimauga A. is 42 and married with 6 children (ages 15-30 ).  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  Vaimauga has 2 years of experience in this business.  Vaimauga needs a loan of WST$1000 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010,Vaimauga joined SPBD.This is her 1st loan with SPBD.SPBD's loans are Vaimauga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: Confiar En Dios Group

texts.es: La señora Odilia F. M. de 50 años de edad, es originaria de patzicia, Chimaltenango, tiene tres hijos dos que aun estan a su cargo y uno casado, actualmente vive en Chimaltenango, ella tiene venta de tamales y chiles rellenos, hace seis años, ahora ella solicita el crédito para poder ampliar su negocio. Doña Maria, ella tiene una venta de joyas de oro, pero ademas de la venta de joyas, tiene venta de refacciones en chimlatenango. El señor Jose tiene venta de refacciones en chimaltenango y ademas tiene terrenos donde siembra milpa y frijol y y tiene dos personas que le ayudan a la siembra y cosecha de la milpa y el frijo, y también tiene un pick up donde hace fletes.
texts.en:
Odilia F. M. is 50 years old and originally from Patzicia, Chimaltenango, Guatemala. She has three children, two of whom are still under her care and another who is married. She currently lives in Chimaltenango. She has made a living selling tamales and chiles rellenos for the past six years, and is requesting the loan to be able to expand her business. Maria makes a living selling gold jewelry and also sells spare parts in Chimaltenango. Jose makes a living selling spare parts in Chimaltenango and also has some land where he plants maize and beans. He has two people who help him plans and harvest the crops, and he also has a pickup truck he uses to freight.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Beeda

texts.en:
Beeda owns a small eating establishment at the market in Bwaise, where she sells food items. She has been in this business for ten years. She buys her foodstuffs from the very market where she works and sells to all categories of people at retail prices. She wants to use this loan to buy more  cooking utensils and to purchase necessary foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, cassava, rice, and beef. She also hopes to buy a charcoal stove. Beeda decided to join MCDT because of the low interest charged.

She works six days a week. Her primary business challenge is the rainy season, because when it rains, her customers don’t reach out to her. She aspires toward owning a large hotel and is determined eventually to improve her family's standard of living. 

Beeda is married with six children. She also takes care of the three orphaned children of her late sister. She resides in a rented two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but has no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils, essential foodstuffs, and a charcoal stove for her business

loans.name: Thiat Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité THIAT est composé de 13 femmes. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. Elles sont des femmes très entreprenantes et très rigoureuses dans le travail. le groupe a vu le jour la veille du financement du Banc Villageois. 

Madame AÏDA S., debout à droite sur la photo, en pantalon noir et tee-shirt blanc, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 24 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant en charge. 

Elle s'active dans la vente de produits cosmétiques. Elle achète la marchandise dans des contenaires en provenance du Mali 

Son crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroître ses bénéfices.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The THIAT solidarity group consists of 13 women who were brought together by affinity, and because they are neighbors. They are very enterprising women, and rigorous workers. The group was created on the eve of the Banc Villageois inauguration. Mrs. AÏDA S. is the head of the group. She is seen standing at the right of the photo in black trousers and a white T-shirt. She is 24 years old, married, and the mother of a dependent child. She sells cosmetic products, which she buys in containers from Mali. Her loan will allow her to increase her stocks and boost her profits. Her goal is to be able to meet her personal needs and support her husband in providing for the family.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Manueli

texts.en: Hard-working and determined N. Manueli, aged 34, has been operating a livestock business rearing and selling goats in Ikoba trading centre, Kyenjojo. A married father of three children, he purchases goats which he grazes, fattens and sells. His wife works alongside him selling produce.This brings in 400,000 Ugandan shillings a month that has helped him in taking on family responsibilities like paying the children’s school fees. He wants to restock his goats on the farm and needs this loan to help motive him, earn more sales revenue, and thus improve the family's income.

loans.use: purchase more goats for fattening

loans.name: Elber Joel

texts.es:
Elber tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de su primo, ubicada en el asentamiento humano San José de Moro, una zona urbano – marginal situada cinco minutos antes de llegar a la ciudad de Chepén, el lugar pertenece a la región La Libertad y se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte), el brinda su servicio en la ciudad de Chepén contando con una demanda estable, ya que las mototaxis son consideradas un medio de transporte estable y rápido.

El continuo uso otorgado a su mototaxi ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, como no cuenta con capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Elber es un joven muy trabajador y bastante responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y de confianza.
texts.en:
Elber is 32 years old, single and lives in his cousin's house, located in San Jose de Moro, a marginal urban zone located 5 minutes before the town of Chepen in the La Libertad region, about an hour north of Chiclayo, the captial of the state of Lambayeque.

He is dedicated to cargo and passenger transport in a motorickshaw (motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcicle with an annexed cabin to realize transportation activities). He provides this service in the town of Chepen, and he counts on a stable demand, since motorickshaws are considered a stable and fast mode of transportation.

The continual use of the motorickshaw has caused it to suffer some problems that require urgent repair to guarantee correct performance; since he doesn't have enought working capital to repair it he thought he should request his first 2000 nuevos soles loan to Edpyme Alternativa.

Elber is a responsible young man who is a hard worker. The people who know him consider him someone who is calm and trustworthy.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of a motorickshaw

location.town: San José de Moro - Chepén - La Libertad

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Roxana de 23 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas, está acompañada y reside con su esposo y su hijito de 5 años, su madre y una hermana todos en una misma vivienda ubicada en Delicias de Concepción, departamento de Morazán; toda la familia se dedica a este oficio y lo realizan desde hace 5 años confeccionando y vendiendo las hamacas, su hermana además lleva hamacas a mercado de San Miguel para ofrecerlas y venderlas.  Roxana es el segundo préstamo que solicita ya que su negocio ha evolucionado satisfactoriamente por lo que ella sigue impulsándolo con la ayuda de los prestamos, en esta ocasión lo necesita para la compra de hilo de seda ya que este es el material principal para la confección de las hamacas.
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio, aumentar sus ganancias que le permita ahorrar para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Roxana is 23 years old and makes hammocks for a living. She lives with her husband, 5-year old son, mother and sister in a house in Delicias de Concepción, a district of Morazán. The whole family works in this trade and have been making and selling hammocks for 5 years. Her sister also takes the hammocks to display and sell at the market in San Miguel. This is Roxana's second loan request, and her business has grown well so she continues to boost it with the help of loans. On this occasion she needs it to buy silk thread, as this is the primary material needed for hammock-making.
Her dream is to expand the business, increase her profits and be able to save to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy silk thread

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel Antonio tiene 38 años, tiene en su casa de habitación un negocio de pulpería. Sus ventas en su mayoría son de contado pues siempre esta depositando mucho empeño para  ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. El inicio en este negocio desde hace 10 años, por lo que fue él el que estableció el negocio primeramente con muy pocos productos como es golosinas, refrescos y pan así con estas pequeñas cosas fue que empezó a llamar la atención de sus clientes. El está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de comprar materias prima. Algo que él hace es mantener la oferta de su producto a un precio que sea accesible a las personas. Su sueño es agrandar el negocio y por supuesto llegar a obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Miguel Antonio, 38, runs a grocery store from his home. He mostly sells in cash and he always tries very hard to provide good customer service. He started the business 10 years ago. Initially the store only stocked a few products, such as sweets, soft drinks and bread; it was these little things that began to attract the customers' attention. 

He is requesting the loan to buy raw materials. He would like to keep his product offering at a price that everyone can pay. His dream is to expand his store and of course to get higher revenues.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tea's Group

texts.en:
Fourteen members make up this village loan. They are located in Lvea S. Kraom village, in Kandal province. This village selected Mrs. Tea C., who is 45 years old, as the village bank president. With the loans, the members of this village will use the money to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Tea C. and her husband, Mr. Prum Doeun, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farming, Mrs. Tea C. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to cultivate rice. Aside from being a farmer, Mrs. Tea C. is also a tailor at home where she can earn a little extra income to support her family. 

This couple has four children who all are students in the local school and also help with their parent's farming activities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna C. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old. Myrna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
