Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby G. is from the village of Mimbunga, Gingoog City. He is 39 years old. Bobby is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Bobby owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Bobby has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bobby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bobby has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Bobby is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Bobby from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to maintain service

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina  C. is a married woman who lives in Fatima Village, Brgy.Rizal, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living as a Pepsi products wholesaler and operating a general store business. Her husband Escolastico, who is 56 years old, is a businessman, and also helps in Florentina's business activities. They have four children who are 20 to 27 years old.

Florentina  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her previous 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Florentina has been incrementally lifting her family's quality of life by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 26,000, which she intends to use as capital so she can sell soft drinks in the local school canteen, and expand her business.  She will continue to save up for future business improvements so that she can help in the education of her niece, nephew and her extended family. Florentina C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund soft drink wholesaling operations

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ilusión esta formado por 9 mujeres con un gran carisma y alegría a pesar de sus dificultades en el día a día, laboran en diferentes actividades que les a permitido aportar a la economía de sus hogares. Todas viven por la parroquia de Cumbe encontrando en ella la paz y la tranquilidad de la naturaleza, su gente es muy calida a pesar del frió que hay en el sector, la mayor parte su población se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos también laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades.

La Señorita Jessica B. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Ilusión, vive en la comunidad de Los Olivos en la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 19 años de edad es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y su padre es maestro de la construcción ya que es albañil, sus padres tienen casa propia. 
La Señorita Jessica estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y cursa el último año de sus estudios.
Es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mamá, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con este negocio. Su meta es llegar a ser una buena profesional.

La Señora. Carmen M. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Ilusión, vive en la comunidad 3 de Noviembre en la parroquia de Cumbe, se encuentra en su segundo crédito y fue invitada por una amiga y vecina a formar parte del banco comunal.
Tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción ya que es maestro albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos.
Doña Carmen se dedica a la cría de animales como ganado, ovejas y pollos, animales que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad, también los utiliza para el consumo de la casa.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y hierba para mejorar sus potreros. Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank "Nueva Ilusion" is made up of nine women with great charisma and joy despite their every day challenges. They work different jobs that have allowed them to contribute to the economy of their homes. They all live near the parish of Cumbre finding in it the peace and tranquility of nature. The people are very warm despite the cold weather in the area. Most of the population is engaged in animal husbandry and agriculture, many also work in the city of Cuenca in different activities.

Jessica B. is a member of the community bank Nueva Ilusion. She lives in the community of Los Olivos in the Cumbre parish. She is 19 years old, is single and lives with her parents. Her mother is a homemaker and her father is a master in construction since he is a construction worker. Her parents own their own home. 

Jessica is in school at a college in the city and she is in the last year of her studies. This is the second loan she has received from the community bank. She was invited to join by her mother. She will invest her loan in buying chickens so that she can start her business. Her goal is to become a good professional. 

Carmen M. is a member of the community bank Nueva Ilusion. She lives in the community of 3 de Noviembre in the Cumbre parish. This is her second loan and she was invited by a friend and neighbor to be part of the community bank. She is 35 years old, is married and has two children ages 13 and 11. Her first daughter is in school and her second son is at school in the city. Her husband works in construction since he is a master mason. They do not have their own home which is why they live in her mother's home and share the expenses. 

Carmen raises animals such as cattle, sheep and chickens. She sells these animals when she needs to and also uses them for consumption in her home. She will use the money from the loan in invest in the purchase of fertilizer and feed to improve her pastures. Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: Purchase chickens, fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Angel Fabian

texts.es:
Desde muy niño  exactamente a la edad de 12 años, Ángel Fabian A. se ha dedicado a trabajar  y esto le generó tanta  madurez y disciplina que hoy tiene un negocio donde fabrica cerámica con 6 empleados fijos , tiene una familia conformada por su cónyuge y un hijo de 3 años de edad. El inició  comercializando la cerámica y para ampliar su espectro  decidió él mismo producirlo, comenzando con dos operarias de la persona que lo abastecía. Con su disciplina e inteligencia   ha demostrado que a pesar de ser muy joven es un gran trabajador con ganas de triunfar y hacer las cosas bien para salir adelante al lado de su familia.
El mercado de Ángel Fabian está ubicado en  los municipios del departamento del Atlántico, ciudades como Santa Marta en el departamento del Magdalena y Valledupar en el departamento del Cesar, donde comercializa  a través de 14 vendedores que van de puerta en puerta a y a los cuales el  vende al por mayor y a de contado, pero también tiene unos cuantos clientes a crédito, mientras  sus compras  de materias primas como barbutina, yeso pinturas,  son  semanal  y de contado. Sus principales   productos son espejos, cuadros, relojes y productos varios elaborado con la técnica de yeso envejecido. En la actualidad su capital neto de trabajo es de $3.015.000 Cop, su rotación de cuentas por cobrar  es de 5 días, tiene una rotación  de inventarios 19 días, mientras su rotación de cuentas por pagar es 3 días y su rentabilidad sobre las ventas es de 18,9 %”.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y también su credikiva, el cual requiere para ampliar su capital de trabajo y poder provisionarse  con compras en mayor cantidad de materias primas  e insumos como pinturas, yeso, alambre, espejo, cinta y maquinas de reloj , con los cuales producirá hermosos  , cuadros,  relojes Consolas, floreros ,que ambientan con elegancia los espacios domésticos de las amas de casa, y también lugares los comerciales . 
Ángel Fabian A., tiene grandes sueños como joven emprendedor, como jefe de familia y miembro de una comunidad su principal meta es   tener una casa propia y que su negocio tenga una infraestructura moderna y muy elegante, aunque su gran desafío es lograr separar el espacio productivo de su vida familiar, porque en la actualidad  gran parte de la casa está ocupada por la fabrica y cada día se reduce mas su espacio doméstico.
texts.en:
Ángel Fabian A. has been working in this field since he was 12 years old.  Because of his discipline and maturity, he now has this ceramics business with six permanent employees.  He has a family, including a three year old son.  He started off by selling ceramic products, but later decided to broaden his horizons by producing them as well.  He's proven that, even though he's young, he is a hard worker with a desire to succeed and make things better for his family.

Ángel's markets are in the cities within the Atlántico department; cities such as Santa Maria, in the Magdalena department, and Valledupar, in the Cesar department.  There he sells through 14 salespersons that go door to door. He sells for cash but he also has a few customers to whom he extends credit.  He buys his raw materials, such as plaster and paint, weekly and in cash.  His main products are mirrors, frames, clocks, and various products made with the aged plaster technique.  His current net working capital is 3,015,000 COP, his revolving credit has a five day cycle, his stock rotates every 19 days, and his accounts payable cycle is three days.  His profit margin is 18.9%.

This will be his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva, which he needs in order to increase his working capital and buy supplies in quantity; supplies such as paint, plaster, wire, mirrors, and clock works.  With them he will make beautiful frames, clocks, consoles, and vases that will adorn living and commercial spaces.

Ángel Fabian A. has big dreams as a young entrepreneur, head of household, and member of the community.  His main goal is to have a home of his own, with a modern and elegant infrastructure.  His greatest challenge is to separate his work space from his family space because at the moment a large part of his home is dedicated to his work space.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Namulesa Twekembe Group-Lugazi

texts.en: 33-year-old N. Diana is a member of the Namulesa Twekembe group-Lugazi. She has been involved in a tailoring business for close to 14 years now in Nagunga-Lugazi. She says she began this enterprise 14 years ago. Before that the happily married mother of four was doing farming. Monthly she says this business generates shillings 120,000, and with this loan, she says she is going to buy more textiles for making clothing.

loans.use: The purchase of more textiles to make clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy inventory

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is 52 years old. She is married and has six children. To make a living, she runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for five years. Previously, she grew beans and maize for her living. Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business by adding more stock. She hopes to expand her shop into a supermarket in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to add to her stock of cooking fat, sugar, salt, and maize flour.

loans.use: to add stock of cooking fat, sugar, salt, and maize flour.

loans.name: Naeem

texts.en:
Naeem K. is a young man who is a father of three young daughters, Naeem has been building a small house for a long time and now he needs a loan from FATEN to install tiles, paint the walls, and fix the roof.

Naeem, who appears in the picture here, is from Jenin which is famous for its olive trees and agriculture.

loans.use: to fix up his house: paint, fix the roof and install tiles.

loans.name: Basem

texts.en: Basem is a 30-year-old, single man who lives in Nablus. He owns his own barber shop in Nablus. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to renovate the décor of his shop. He believes by doing so, he will attract more customers and increase his business.

loans.use: To renovate the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Diana María

texts.es:
Trabajar desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche no es un sacrificio para Diana María M. I. quien después de quedar viuda y convertirse en madre cabeza de hogar para sacar adelante a su hija, esta luchadora decidió crear su propio negocio, un almacén de ropa interior que se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos.

Aunque asumir las riendas del hogar no ha sido fácil para esta emprendedora, sus deseos de salir adelante y de ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hija, es lo que la motiva a seguir adelante pues en el futuro espera que su almacén crezca hasta el punto de ser reconocido e incrementar sus ventas. 

Actualmente, Diana necesita de un crédito para comprar surtido de pijamas y ropa interior el cual será de gran utilidad para seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Working from 8:00am until 9:00pm is not a sacrifice for Diana Maria Marin I., who after being widowed became the head of her household in order to help her daughter get ahead. This fighter decided to create her own business, an intimate apparel store that has become her only source of income.

Although taking the reins of the household has not been easy for this entrepreneur, her desire to get ahead and to give her daughter a better future is what motivates her to continue forward. In the future she hopes that her store grows until it is well-known and sales increase.

Currently, Diana needs a loan to stock up on pajamas and underwear which will be very useful for continuing her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies of pajamas and underwear.

loans.name: Elena Violeta

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer soltera de 46 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía. 
Elena  se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de pollo y gallina al por menor para el consumo de las personas y los vende en el mercado San José de Monsefú actividad que realiza desde hace algunos años, este trabajo lo realiza todos los días por las mañanas desde muy temprano, con la finalidad de tener todo listo una vez que empieza la atención en el mercado y así podrá atender a su clientela sin demora, como ya tiene una clientela fija no tiene porque preocuparse, al final de de su jornada tenga los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos.
El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles y su destino será para comprar mayor cantidad de carne de aves para seguir ofertándolo en el mercado a sus clientes ya que su  clientela se ha incrementado por vender productos sanos y de calidad.
El sueño de Elena es que más adelante sea proveedora mayorista de todo tipo de carnes en los diferentes  mercados, para que mejore la calidad de vida de ella y de sus padres.
texts.en:
Elena is a single 46 year old woman. She lives in her parents' house, which has electricity and running water and is located in the district of  Monsefú, 15 minutes from the province of Chiclayo. The inhabitants of this district work in agriculture, cattle raising and artisanal crafts. 
 
Elena buys and sells chicken meat for personal consumption and to sell in the market of San José de Monsefú. She has done this for some years, and she does the work every day from very early in the morning so that she can have everything ready to start serving her customers without delay in the market. She already has regular clientele and doesn't have to worry about having enough income at the end of the day to support herself. 

The loan she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for is for 2000 nuevos soles and it is to be used to buy a larger quantity of poultry meat to keep offering it in the market to her customers, since her clientele has increased by selling healthy, quality products. 

Elena's dream for the future is to be a wholesale supplier of all types of meat in different markets, so that she can improve her own quality of life and her parents'.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of poultry meat to offer her customers.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Mrs. Thao, 31, earns a living by braiding thatch for roof covering that she sells to her neighbors and other villagers. She learned this skill from her parents when she was single. From her handcraft business, she currently generates an income of approximately $2 per day. She has been married for many years to Mr. Mom, 39, a local farmer, and they have three single children. 

The rainy season is coming now and it is good for her to grow rice crops, but she lacks fund to do it. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Thao is asking for a loan towards purchasing farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.name: Nitron

texts.pt:
nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane tem 31 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 4 filhos dos 6 meses aos 12 anos, 3 dos quais vão a Escola. Concluiu o Ensino Médio Proficional de professorado estando agora a frequentar o Ensino Superior a distância. Vive na casa própria com sua familia e responsabiliza se pelos seus 3 sobrinhos que vivem com ele em sua casa.

Sai de Inhambane com seus pais para o Distrito de Namaacha onde cresce e se forma proficionalmente. E  Docente, funcionario permanente, trabalha das 6:45h as 13:50h auferindo mensalmente 9.055.75 mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra, consegue poupar 1.000.00mt mensalmente porque conta com ajuda da sua esposa que também e Docente. 

Ja teve empréstimo no BIM, conhece a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas que são clientes da instituição. Este é seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( cimento, barrotes, chapas de zinco, portas e mais) para concluir as minimas partes da mesma. Os anteriores de (10.000.00, 18.000.00 e 12.000.00) foram para a mesma finalidade.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir mais credito para comcluir  sua obra. Seu maior sonho é concluir os estudos e ter uma vida estavel.
texts.en:
Nitron was born in Inhambane province. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of four children between the ages of 6 months and 12 years. Three of the children attend school. He finished high school, where he trained as a teacher, and he would like to pursue higher education. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports his three nephews, who live with them.
He and his parents left Inhambane for the district of Namaacha, where he grew up and received his professional training. He has a permanent position as a teacher and works from 6:45 a.m. till 1:50 p.m. He earns 9055 meticals a month, which he uses for household expenses and for construction on the home. He is able to save 1000 meticals a month because his wife, who is also a teacher, also contributes to the household.
Nitron has also taken out loans with BIM. He learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also clients of the organization. This is his third loan with Hluvuku, and he will use the 20,000 meticals to buy construction materials (cement, rebar, sheet metal, doors, etc.) to finish his house. His previous loans (in the amounts of 10,000, 18,000, and 12,000 meticals) were also used for the same purpose.
He is confident that he will be able to pay off this loan early and request an additional loan to finish the construction. His greatest dream is to finish his studies and have a stable life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, rebar, sheet metal, doors, etc.) for his home.

loans.name: Rene Cesar

texts.es: El sr. Rene vive en casa anticrético en la zona norte es soltero se dedica al transporte publico con su movilidad, el se dedica al transporte desde muy joven es su principal fuente de ingreso es nuevo en la institución saco el crédito para comprar repuestos y algunas mejoras para su movilidad, el sr. Se fue muy contento con el crédito obtenido es nuevo en la institución y con el crédito Kiva.
texts.en: Rene lives in a house in "anticrético" ( a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia) in the the northern area.  He is single and works in public transportation with his taxi.  He has been working in transportation since he was very young and it is his main source of income.  Rene took the loan to buy spare parts and make some improvements for his taxi.  He was very happy with the obtained loan, as he is new to the field partner and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man living with his wife and one school-aged child in Lebanon.  

He has owned a cattle farm in his town since 2006. He works independently in his business. His farm produces dairy products all sold to local customers and markets. His is the only income source of the family.  

Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fodder for his cattle so that he can ensure a good quality and quantity of milk. He aims to increase his business productivity and earn higher income in order to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Dalila Del Carmen

texts.es: Dalila Del Carmen tiene 57 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido creciendo gradualmente ella es una persona muy responsable que disfruta de su actividad económica y del interactuar con sus clientes cada día. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de cremas, polvos, lápiz labial, pantalones, camisas, faldas entre otros. Sueña con seguir creciendo su actividad y surtir su inventario.
texts.en: Dalila Del Carmen is 57 years old.  Her business is selling clothes and cosmetics.  She has had this business for more than 10 years and, over time, it has gradually grown.  Dalila is a very responsible person who enjoys her business and enjoys interacting with her customers every day.  She is requesting this loan to buy creams, powders, lipsticks, pants, shirts, skirts, etc.  She dreams of continuing to grow and stock her business.

loans.use: to buy creams, powders, lipsticks, pants, shirts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: Joseph est un commerçant agriculteur, il est marié, il  a   35 ans et il a 3 enfants entre 3 ans et 5 ans et 2 enfants vont à l’ecole.il est ne au Rwanda .Il  a six ans des études primaire. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des matériels d’hygiènes pour les revendre au centre commercial de sa ville. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’améliorer les activités de commerce  en achetant les matériels de la qualité. Pour ses ambition il voudrait devenir un grand commerçant dans la région , il voudrait construire sa propre maison et pour sa famille  a usage résidentiel et payer le frais des études pour ses enfants .
texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer merchant. He is married and 35 years old, and he has three children, aged 3 to 5. Two of the children go to school. He was born in Rwanda and has a sixth grade education. This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. Joseph is going to use his loan to buy personal grooming merchandise for resale at his city’s commercial center. 

His strategy for the growth of his business is to improve his business activities by buying quality merchandise. As for his ambitions, Joseph would like to become a major merchant in the region and to build a house in which to live for himself and his family, as well as to cover the schooling costs for his children.

loans.use: to buy personal grooming items for resale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 31 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. She also earns income from selling onions. Stella took this loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase or order charcoal to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her in building up her business and paying the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Otilda Marta

texts.es:
La señora Otilda Marta es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 9 hijos 8 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al tricotado y tejidos de hilo, inicio como empleada para otro negocio, hasta el momento lleva 30 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilo de diferentes clase y colores, para tener mas producción de tenido y mejorar su condición de vida, ya que en el futuro espera tener un negocio amplio y mejor.
texts.en:
Sra. Otilda Marta is 48 years old, married, and did not have the opportunity to study. She has nine children, eight of whom are in school. Otilda knits and weaves articles out of yarn. She started out as an employee of another business. To date, she has accumulated 30 years of experience.

Otilda decided to request a loan so that she could purchase yarn of different types and colors so that she could increase production and improve her living conditions. In the future, she hopes to have a larger and better business.

loans.use: to purchase yarn for knitting and weaving.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica tiene 31 años, es una mujer alegre, y emprendedora. Está casada, y junto a su esposo construyeron una casita en una parte del terreno que sus suegros le cedieron. Ahi vive en compañia de sus tres menores hijos de 10, 08 y 02 años de edad, por ellos es que trabaja día a día para poder darles buena educación y mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Verónica consiste en salir a caminar por las calles de la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, pues vende fajas térmicas corporales, que ayudan a sus clientes a perder peso de manera mas rápida. Sus clientes mas importantes son sus propios amigos y familiares. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que puede admminsitrar su tiempo para realizar otras actividades dentro de su hogar, cuidar y ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas que le dejan en el colegio. Le va bien en este trabajo ya que tiene buenos clientes, por ello desea mas adelante poder tener mayor variedad de productos en su casa y no tener que estar caminando por largo tiempo. Este será el tercer préstamo que tiene, ante ello espera que continuen apoyandolo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más fajas y algunos artículos para el cuidado del cuerpo, ya que siempre le gusta traer novedades para que sus clientes puedan tener variedad para escoger.
texts.en:
Verónica, 31, is a cheerful, enterprising woman.  She’s married and together with her husband built a small house on part of a lot her in-laws gave them.  They live there together with their three minor children who are 10, 8 and 2 years of age.  She works hard for them daily to be able to provide them with a good education and better quality of life.

Verónica’s work consists in heading out to the city streets offering her products for sale.  She sells thermal girdles that help her customers to lose weight more quickly.  Her most important customers are her own friends and family members.  What she most enjoys about her work is being able to manage her own time to be able to do other household chores and to care for and help her children with their school homework assignments.

She does well in this work because she has good customers and this is why she wants to have a greater variety of products on hand at home and not have to go out on such long walks for so long.  

This will be her third loan and she hopes that you will continue to support her.  She will use the requested amount to buy more girdles and some other body care items because she always likes to bring novel items for her customers so that they can have an assortment to choose from.

loans.use: to buy girdles and body care items.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en su propia casa donde reina la armonía. Desde muy niña trabajaba en los campos de cultivo de sus padres. Luego de un tiempo, logró ahorrar y lo junto con la herencia que recbiera de su papá, hoy es propietaria de 03 hectáreas de terreno y los trabaja con mucho ahínco. En ella, ha arado y fertilizado, para cultivar cacao, café y raíces de barbasco, productos que luego son comercializados al por mayor en los centros de acopio en la ciudad de San Francisco y Santa Rosa. Éstos productos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y cubrir con los gastos familiares. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los tendales (lugar donde seca los granos) que se encuentran en su comunidad. Por tal razón debe contratar jornaleros que la apoyen con esta labor tan pesada.  Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este será su crédito número 06 con MFP y espera de una pequeña ayuda para cumplir con sus objetivos, asimismo se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos los integrantes son personas responsables. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Alejandra is from the city of Santa Rosa. She is 47, married and has three children at school. They live peacefully together in their own house. Since she was a very little girl, Alejandra worked in her parents' fields. After some time, she managed to save some money and put it together with the inheritence she received from her father to buy 3 hectares of land, which she works very hard. She has ploughed and fertilised the fields in order to grow cacao, coffee and barbasco root, products which are then sold wholesale in distribution centres in the cities of San Francisco and Santa Rosa.

These products have given Alejandra the necessary income to keep up with the household expenses. What she likes most about her job is caring for the crops, as she feels happy doing it. She has been doing this for 15 years and would say that the most difficult part is transporting the products from the farm to the area where they dry the grains, which is located in the town. For that reason she has to employ farmhands who help her with this heavy work. In the future, she would like to buy new land to grow more crops.

This will be Alejandra's 6th loan with MFP and she is asking for a little help so she can achieve her goals. For her part, she promises once more to keep up with her repayments. She is grateful for being part of her communal bank as all the members are responsible people. With the money she has requested, she will buy more cacao plants and graft them so that they will bear fruit more quickly.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Doña Elena tiene 39 años de edad está casada con el señor Israel desde hace 22 años tiene dos hijos aun que dependen de ellos Aldo Eruviel de 11 años que está cursando sexto año, José Manuel de cuatro años todavía no va  a la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante el vende artículos de licuadoras, vasos, aspa, rosca, empaque, y tapas.

Ella ha solicitado el crédito para invertir en su negocio de jarcería, donde comprara fibras, pasticos, fregones en cada producto piensa invertir mil quinientos pesos porque las cantidades no las puede dar exactas, la señora lleva 19 años en la actividad.

Ella considera que el problema que presenta son las bajas ventas ya que considera que no es como antes ahora ya casi nadie compra productos de este tipo. Sin embargo la meta que tiene en mente es que su negocio crezca un poco más, también le gustaría tener un local.

“Es la primera vez que participo en el crédito, espero no quedar mal, para que me sigan apoyando para yo poder salir adelante con mi negocio”
texts.en:
Doña Elena is 39 years old and has been married to Sr. Israel since she was 22 years of age.  They have two dependent children, Aldo Eruviel (age 11) who is in the sixth grade and José Manuel (age 4) who is still not in school.  Her husband is a merchant who sells household goods such as blenders, glasses, fans, thread, packaging, and lids.  

She is requesting a loan to invest in her cleaning supply business.  She plans to buy scrubbers, plastics, and scouring pads.  With each product she plans to invest 1500 MXN because the quantities are not exact.  Elena has been in this business for 19 years.  

She considers her problem with low sales to be one that she has not had to face before.  Almost nobody purchases these types of products nowadays.  Nonetheless, her goal that she intends to reach is to grow her business a little more.  She would also like to have a shop.  

Elena says, “This is the first time I have participated in a loan, so I don’t want to fail.  Instead, I hope you will continue supporting me so that I can move forward with my business.”

loans.use: to invest in her cleaning business, buying scrubbers, plastics, and scouring pads.

loans.name: Mahmadamin

texts.ru: Махмадамин возраст 53 года, женат, имеет 4 детей. Махмадамин трудолюбивый человек. Он 6 лет занимается  куплей и продажей крупного рогатого скота, и имеет накопленный опыт в этом бизнесе. Он продает скот на рынке и имеет хорошую прибыль. Он хочет получить займ на сумму $1700 США для  увеличения оборотных средств. Получение займа поможет ему расширению бизнеса.
texts.en: Mahmadamin is 53 years old, married and has four children.  He is a hard-working person.  Mahmadamin has been involved in buying and selling cattle for six years and has experience in this business.  He sells livestock at the market and has a good profit.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1700 to increase his revolving capital.  Obtaining this loan will help Mahmadamin to expand his business.

loans.use: to increase his revolving capital and expand his business

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with two children. Marlyn is 32 years old, residing at Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marlyn owns and operates a banana farm, planting banana to earn a living and she's been one year in this business. 

Each month, Marlyn earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase pesticides for banana growing. Marlyn is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Marlyn wants to build her own house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides for banana growing.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Elizabeth tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera pues aun no tiene hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Elizabeth  trabaja en la municipalidad del Manu en el área de gerencia como asistenta de gerencia. Ya son varios años que se dedica a trabajar y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Elizabeth requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa. El sueño de la Elizabeth es abrir una agencia de viajes. 

Elizabeth agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the “Del Futuro del Manu” communal bank.  The communal bank’s members meet every thirty days in the city of Salvación in Manu Province and Madre de Dios Department.

Elizabeth is 24 years old, single and does not have children yet.  She was born in the city of Salvación and lives still in the same city she was born in and where she carries out her economic activities.  Elizabeth works for the city of Manu as an assistant in the management office.  She’s been working for several years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion Elizabeth needs the loan to do some home improvements.  Elizabeth’s dream is to open a travel agency.  Elizabeth appreciates and values the loan and commits to meet her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 41 years old and is a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Eunice who is a business lady. They are blessed with two children aged 4 and 2 years old respectively. 

James has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 25,000 which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after having successfully repaid previous loans. 

James will use the loan amount to buy seedling and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profits from the business he will buy a dairy cow. His hopes and dreams are to buy a commercial plot, educate his children up to university level and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: To buy seedling and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 40 years old and married with six children aged from 1 to 22; three of the children attend school. She has been selling fish for the last 10 years.

The loan will be used to buy more fish and meat for sale. Peace will use the profits to renovate her house and create savings for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Martinez  vive y trabaja en la ciudad de Camaná, ubicada en el sur del Perú, un oasis extenso y seco ubicado en el desierto de Sechura que domina la costa en la parte sudoeste del país. Camaná ha sido históricamente un importante destino turístico en el Perú, sin embargo, los frecuentes y fuertes terremotos y tsunamis en la última década (un 8,4 en 2001 y 8,0 en 2007) diezmó la ciudad, destruido la industria del turismo en Camaná, y costando muchos de sus puestos de trabajo, los medios de subsistencia, y los hogares. Pero el resultado de un desempleo es que crea un ambiente preparado para las microfinanzas. El microfinanciamiento permite a las personas que no tienen muchos recursos y cuentan con un pequeño negocio tener una oportunidad como negociante en el mercado laboral.				
Jose empezó su negocio de alquiler de equipos de sonido y servicio de animación en fiestas o festividades que se realizan en la ciudad de camaná. En los contratos que tiene semanalmente puede llegar a ganar un promedio de S/.450 lo que le permite ahorrar una pequeña cantidad de dinero para las temporadas bajas. 

Gracias el préstamo de S/. 1,000 que recibirá gracias a KIVA Jose podrá comprar dos parlantes grandes para mejorar la calidad de sonido en los eventos donde lo contraten y así podrá lograr recomendaciones a otros clientes por parte de los suyos. Esta confianza depositada en su persona le permitirá pensar en un futuro mejor y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá comprar el terreno que quiere para tener una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Jose Martinez lives and works in the city of Camaná, which is located in the south of Peru.  Camaná is a vast, dry oasis located in the desert of Sechura which dominates the coastal area in the south-east part of the country.  It has historically been an important tourist destination in Peru, however the frequent strong earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and an 8.0 in 2007) have decimated the city and destroyed the tourism industry in Camaná, impacting the workplaces, means of subsistence and households of many.  But the result of unemployment is that it creates an atmosphere ready for micro-finance.  Micro-financing permits people who have limited resources and have a small business to have an opportunity as a business-person in the labor market.

Jose began his business renting sound systems and animation service to parties and festivities that take place in the city of Camaná.  He is able to earn an average of 450 soles from his weekly contracts,  which allows him to save a small quantity of money for the quiet season.

Thanks to the loan of 1,000 soles that he will receive thanks to Kiva, Jose will be able to purchase two large speakers to improve the sound quality at the events where he is hired, and so be able to gain recommendations for other clients from his current ones.  The trust that's being put in him allows him to think of a better future, and with great effort and dedication he will be able to purchase a plot of land, where he wants to build his own home.

loans.use: to purchase two large speakers.

loans.name: Samiah

texts.en: Samiah is a 40-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of five children. Samiah trades in perfumes and makeup. She is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase perfumes and makeup products for trading purposes. Samiah is operating from her home and she is looking to open a shop for her products so that she can expand her consumer base.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and makeup products for trading purposes

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
This is Lilybeth, 35, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ferdinand, an overseas contract worker, and she is the mother of three children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Lilybeth maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products such as popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on for their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Lilybeth fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera y aun no tiene hijos, ella nació en la provincia del Cusco departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Marilu se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños, ella no tiene un puesto de venta sino ella compra su mercadería de la ciudad de Lima y después distribuye a diferentes revendedoras. Marilu requiere el préstamo para comprar más ropa interior. Marilu también está estudiando la carrera profesional de contabilidad en una de las universidades particulares de la ciudad del Cusco. 

El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Marilu is 19 years old. She is single and doesn't have any children. She was born in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco and lives in the beautiful city where she was born. Marilu makes a living selling underwear for men, women and children. She doesn't have a stall but rather buys merchandise in the city of Lima and then distributes it to different retailers. Marilu needs the loan to buy more underwear. Marilu is also studying accountancy as a professional career in one of the private universities in the city of Cusco.

The communal bank "Nueva Esperanza" consists of responsible, hard-working people who help their families get ahead. The majority of its members live in the city of Cusco, where they carry out their business activities. Cusco is renowned for being a tourist and commercial area, for its traditional celebration of Inti Raymi and because it is located near to one of the seven wonders of the world "Machupicchu".

loans.use: to buy more underwear to sell.

loans.name: Pav

texts.en:
From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Mrs. Pav, age 48, cultivates both rainy-season rice and dry-season rice for her living. She usually earns around $2.50 per day to cover her daily expenses. She is a responsible mother of five children, two of whom are already married and live independently. 

At the present time, some parts of Pav’s house are broken like her thatched wall and planks. So she would like to seek some funds from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase some building materials to fix her house. In the future, she plans to buy a few additional plots of land to increase her rice output among the year.

loans.use: to purchase some building materials to fix her house.

loans.name: Odmaa

texts.en:
Borrower Ms. Odmaa is a 35-year-old woman who lives with her mother and younger sister in her sister's yard. She supports her family by operating a phone-selling stall business. She has one daughter who attends secondary school. She sells cell phones, phone headsets, chargers, and other phone accessories and supplies. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more headsets, chargers, and phones to sell in order to increase her working capital. She is a very active lady who desires to live successfully.

loans.use: to purchase more cell phones to sell in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Victor

texts.ru: Виктор в возрасте 57 лет, женат и имеет пятеро детей. Это примерная семья, трудолюбивая и очень ответственная. Он имеет в собственность 4,92 ха земли, из них 2,5 ха сада и 2,42 ха для выращивание других сельскохозяйственных культур: подсолнечник, пшеница и кукуруза. Виктор сталкивается с большими проблемами из-за нехватки сельскохозяйственных культур. Его мечта купить трактор, пусть он и не будет новым, но в хорошем состояний. Поэтому, он обращается за кредитом для покупки этой технике. Покупая этот трактор, ему не придется платить за услуги предоставляемые трактором. Виктор вовремя произведёт все технологические процессы по уходу за садом и остальных сельскохозяйственых культур. В конечным результате это вложение – принесет высокий доход и новые рабочие места.

loans.use: Для покупки трактора

loans.name: Julian Antonio

texts.en:
My name is Julian S. and I sell beef, pork, and chicken ( for reasonable prices) and I have had my business for 5 years. I also have the help of my son, and I have many customers because my product is fresh and of the best quality. My business generates earnings to support my family. My goal is to expand my inventory and with the additional earnings I will be able to open another butcher store at the other end of the capital city as well as be able to give my son, who is of University age, an education.

Mi nombre es Julian S. me dedico a la venta de carne de res, cerdo y pollo a precio de mayorista y al por menor, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la venta de mi producto, mis clientela es excelente ya que mi producto es fresco y de buena calidad, mi negocio me genera ingresos para mantener mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder abrir otra carniceria en otro punto de la ciudad capital tambien darle un buen estudio a mi hijo que esta en edad para ingresar a la universidad.

loans.use:
To purchase beef, pork, chicken, knives, sharpening files, wood, iron gloves.

Compra de carne de res, cerdo, pollo, cuchillos, limas para afilar, madera, ganchos de hierro.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: I am a single woman, mother of 2. I sell second-hand clothes. With this loan my life will improve because I’ll be able to meet the basic needs of my children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora has had four years of experience selling cleaning products and general supplies. She worked as a salesperson in a store selling imitation jewelry which had to close because many people had a bad impression of it. Her daughter helped her with money to start her business. She works every day of the week from 6 am until 11 pm. Even on week-ends, Pastora dedicated herself to the sale of food in the entrance area of her home.

Pastora would like this loan i order to purchas two perches/shelves to help in the display of her products. She would also like to supply her store with colas. In addition, she would like to purchase two tables to sell food on during the week-ends. The demand for her products has grown in proportion to the amount of food she has available for sale.

Pastrora is 50 years old, and has been separated from her husband for two years. She has two son and a daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Pastora tiene una experiencia de 4 años con la venta de artículos de limpieza y víveres en general. Ella trabajaba vendiendo bisutería negocio que tuvo que cerrar por que mucha gente le quedo mal. Su hija fue la persona que le ayudo con el capital para poner el negocio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m. También los fines de semana Pastora se dedica a la venta de comida en el portal de su casa.

Pastora desea el crédito para comprar 2 perchas que le ayudaran en la exhibición de sus productos. Y también surtir su negocio con colas. Además desea comprar 2 mesas para los fines de semana que vende comida. Su demanda esta aumentando con respecto a su comida.

Pastora tiene 50 años, esta separada de su esposo hace 2 años. Tiene 2 hijos. Su hija la mayor

loans.use: Invest in products for her store

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Ms. Amadu is a single parent with one child. She has two years of experience in the food business. As she is a single parent, this income generating activity is the one which permits her to survive and to ensure all the basic needs are met for herself and her child. Even if she has a lot of financial responsibilities, she will be able to pay back her loan because every day all her prepared dishes are sold out; there is always a demand for her food.

Ms. Amadu is a member of the group “ENTENTE” in which five people want to receive a loan of $125 each. The total loan solicited by the group is $625.

loans.use: To purchase rice and oil to increase her business.

loans.name: Judith Silvia

texts.es:
Judith dedicates her time to making memorabilia for different events such as baptisms, weddings, birthdays, etc. The designs are made up of plaster, wood, and stoneware. She has been making them for over 20 years. She is 38 years old and has three children. She belongs to the group Barrio Nuevo 4 together with Ms. Nereida Decelis Bautista (who sells fruits and vegetables) and Ms. Candelaria Guillen Martínez (who sells clothes). With this loan they will invest in supplies for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

JUDITH, se dedica a hacer en forma manual recuerdos que se entregan en diferentes eventos tales como bautizos , casamientos, cumpleaños , etc. Los diseños son confeccionados en yeso, madera, loza y los crea desde hace 20 años. Ella tiene 38 años, tres hijos, forma parte del grupo Barrio Nuevo 4 junto con doña Nereida Decelis Bautista (vende frutas y verduras) y doña Candelaria Guillen Martínez (venta de ropa) Con el préstamo invertirán surtiendo sus negocios respectivos.

loans.use: Decorative Sales

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
"I need to secure the windows at home as it is very unsafe.  A while ago, someone broke one of the windows.  I would like to spend the money to make the repair.  I have been concerned for my family's safety.  I seek a loan of $500 to secure the windows of my home. " 

 Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer. 


Tengo la necesidad de poner protecciones en las ventanas de mi casa ya que son muy inseguras, hace algún tiempo me quebraron el vidrio de una de ellas así es que prefiero hacer el gasto de ponerlas además me preocupa la seguridad de mi familia. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner protecciones en las ventanas de mi vivienda."

loans.use: security for windows

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.en: Matlyuba N. lives in the town of Spitamen, where she has worked in the local bazaar for the last eight years.  She is a very good saleswoman whose customers keep coming back to her shop because they like the quality of her products, the selection of goods she has to sell and the service she provides. Matlyuba has come to us for a loan which she will use to buy new items to sell and to attract new clients.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Iris Tavera

texts.en:
Iris is an eighteen year old girl that struggles to make a living.  She goes to a private school and she will enter the university in two years.  Currently, Iris sells gold and silver-plated jewel.  She explains that she began selling jewels by catalog for a company, two years ago.  She acquired a lot of experiences, and as she wanted to earn more, she decided to start her own business.  With her partner’s help, she invested in the purchase of the jewels, and she is running the business within her house in Palavé, community of San Cristobal.
Iris hopes she can achieve success with her business enterprise.  She wants to increase her income so that she can put aside money to support her forthcoming university studies.  The entrepreneur is asking for a loan to spend in the buy of more jewels to keep meeting her customers’ demand.  Iris is living with her young partner and she has to work hard to help him support the couple expenses.

loans.use: To purchase gold-plated and silver-plated jewels for a small business.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam P. is a widow with 5 children. She lives in Khachmaz town, Azerbijan. This woman was born in 1956. She has been in this business for 5 years. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Makhtoom's Group

texts.en: I have lived all my life in the mid-size industrial city of Faisalabad, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four: two boys and two girls. All of my kids attend school except the youngest. I want all of my kids to finish school and find decent jobs for themselves. My husband wants to buy a new rickshaw, and therefore we need a loan. There are three other women who are also in need of loans. Samina B. requires a loan to buy a stock of various items for her son’s grocery store. Nasreen B. will buy an additional dairy cow with her share of loan. Abida B. needs this loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business. These women have been together for many years and play an important role in bringing in incomes for their families.

loans.use: Buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Fatuma's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 19 years old and is a single woman. She owns a small salon, which she started in 2007. Every day, Fatuma works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her hairdressing services.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more supplies for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Maua, who has a business dealing in retail sales.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the rice harvest

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina is a craftswoman whose family is in the same business because they have always welcomed the tourists who visit the central rain forest zone. These visitors generate great profits for the locals during the tourist season in the locality of La Merced. In order for Paulina to be able to meet the demands of the tourists, she needs certain supplies so that she can make her handicrafts. Hence, she is requesting a loan that will help her purchase the supplies she needs for her original and lovely, handmade ornaments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina es artesana y su familia se dedica a esta labor ya que siempre ha tenido acogida por los turistas que visitan la zona de la selva central lo cual trae grandes ganancias acorde a las temporadas de visita en la localidad de La Merced.Para poder Paulina cubrir los requerimientos y la exigencia de los turistas requiere de ciertos materiales que le faltan para procesar sus artesanías y solicita un préstamo que le ayudaría a comprar materia prima para sus novedosos y hermosos adornos artesanales.

loans.use: Purchase greater quantity of supplies needed to make her beautiful ornaments

loans.name: Leagaioalii

texts.en:
Leagaioalii M., 36, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in the Ice-cake and ice-cream business. She sells to the school and villagers 7 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).

SPBD loans are Leagaioalii’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is working and helps her out with family needs.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as cordials, sugar, and plastic cups

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
My name is Ismael G. C.. I work in sales in a business located in Piedras Negras, Mexico. My wife and I acquired a house through social benefits and now that our family is beginning to grow we want to put up a wall around the property and protection over the windows. These changes will ensure the security of our baby who will arrive soon. For this reason we are asking for $625 US.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ismael G. C. trabajo en el área de ventas de una empresa de Piedras Negras, mi esposa y yo adquirimos una casa de interés social y ahora que nuestra familia empieza a crecer deseamos poner barda y protecciones en las ventanas de nuestra casa para la seguridad de nuestro bebe que viene en camino. Por eso solicitamos la cantidad de 625 dlls.

loans.use: To put bars over the windows of the house and build an exterior wall as a fence.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima B. is 37 years old and has three children. She lives in Lagos state with her family. Fatima sells provisions in her grocery store.  She started this business seven years ago. Fatima is LAPO client. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: La Señora Genoveva es una persona muy trabajadora, con 15 años D. experiencia, se dedica a la producción D. calzados D. "cholita", los mismos que venD. al por mayor, en los mercados populares D. la ciudad, tiene también pedidos D. las fraternidades para las distintas fiestas folklóricas D. las diferentes zonasD. la ciudad D. La Paz, Bolivia. Trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo y le ayudan también sus hijos; es con este trabajo que sacó profesionales a dos D. sus hijos mayores, mientras que los dos menores se encuentran estudiando todavía. Trabaja solamente con Emprender y es cliente antigua, muy puntual y responsable. El crédito será invertido en la compra D. una movilidad para la entrega D. los calzados, ella ya cuenta con un monto parcial, con este crédito ya tiene el monto completo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Genoveva is a hard-working person, with 15 years of experience, she makes “cholita” footwear (traditional costume footwear) which she sells wholesale in the popular markets in the city. She also has orders from the fraternal groups for the various folklore holidays in different areas of the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She works along with her husband and he helps her with the children. It is with this work that their two oldest children have been able to become professionals, while the two younger children are still in studying. She works only with Emprender and is an established client, very prompt and responsible. The loan will be invested in buying a vehicle for the delivery of the footwear, she now has a partial payment and with this loan she will have a complete payment.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an automobile

loans.name: Safina Birungi's Group

texts.en:
Safina is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 54-year-old widowed woman with 6 children, aged between 38 and 21. None of her children go to school. Safina also takes care of 4 grandchildren. She resides in and owns a 2-room house, where she is staying with 6 people. They don’t have electricity but have piped water at home.

The family gets one meal a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Safina operates a retail shop in Kyebando Nsooba, one of the city suburbs, and buys her products from Bwaise. Safina uses public transport to go back and forth to her business. She sells to all categories of people, and her monthly expenses include school fees, medication, rent, and food for the family.

Safina works 6 days a week and has been with MCDT for 6 years, servicing her thirteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business and aspires to sell wholesale.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Chika

texts.en:
Chika C. is 40 years old and married with 4 children.  She sells provisions and drinks in her community.  She started this business in 2006.  

She hopes for the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.  She hopes to stock her shop with more provisions and drinks so that she can meet the demands of her customers, and not lose them to competitors. 

Chika says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
“ I dreamed of having a bigger store in order to provide for all my family needs”, says Rosalinda A., 48-year old mother of two children from Polomolok, South Cotabato. She wants a good life for her children and she is doing her best to gradually realize all her dreams.

She is into retail business. She started putting up a mini-store last December 15, 2004 from her small savings and joined CEVI to finance her business.

She would like to purchase additional supplies for her store to increase her sales. She is also looking into some other income generating activities to support her family.

“CEVI has created a lasting impact on the people”, she said. “Through its credit program, everyone has the chance to have credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage”, she added.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Frine

texts.en:
Frine is a member of the Empecemos (“Let’s get started”) Village Bank.  Frine is 24 years old and lives with her partner and their two children. Frine sells vegetables on the street outside of her house seven days a week. Frine used to travel to different markets to buy cheeses, but she stopped after giving birth to her son, since she had to dedicate more of her time to caring for him.  Frine is requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar in order to offer her customers a wider variety of products. Frine’s dreams are to own a large store and to save more money. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Frinee es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos. 
Frinee es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Frinee vende verduras en la puerta de su casa de manera ambulatoria, actividad que realiza todos los días, Frinee anteriormente viajaba a las diferentes ferias de donde compraba quesos, actividad que dejo de realizar porque tuvo su bebe y tiene que dedicarse mas tiempo a su hijo.
Frinee necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar para surtir su negocio. 
Los sueños de Frinee son tener una tienda grande y ahorrar mas.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Mrs. K. Ly is a leader of a group of four who all live in the Andoung Snay village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a 52-year-old widow with a child who helps with her business. She has been selling basic products such as rice, sugar, salt, bean oil, and so on at her general store. Her business has been doing well and she wants to expand it. Thus, she needs a loan to be able to purchase more rice to earn more profits.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice, sugar, salt, and bean oil for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old and married with four children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria.

Joseph sells spare motor parts. He needs a loan of N140000 to purchase more spare motor parts to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more spare motor parts to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 56 años, enviudó hace 6 años, tuvo13 hijos, D. los cuales 4 están vivos y 3 D. ellos vive en su casa. Cuando su esposo vivía sembraban grandes extensiones D. cítricos, plátanos y café en las chacras D. sus suegros, pero ahora sus siembras han aminorado debido a que sus  hijos no les agrada las labores agrícolas, y ella ya no pueD. trabajar con la misma fuerza que en su juventud. DesD. entonces empezó a vender golosinas hace seis meses con el apoyo D. su hijo que trabaja en Lima, quien el envía la mercadería. Pero aun quiere mejorar su negocio con vitrinas, estantes  e incrementar su mercadería para que pueda competir con sus vecinos, para captar mayores ingresos económicos para la mejora D. su calidad D. vida; y no solo dependa D. las cosechas D. sus cultivos, que muchas veces no cubre sus expectativas. Rosa dice estar muy contenta por ser parte D. este nuevo banco comunal, tiene muchas expectativas acerca D. la metodología D. trabajo, asimismo hace compromisos D. realizar todos sus pagos en las fechas indicadas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra D. productos para su negocio en aras D. captar muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old. She was widowed 6 years ago. She had 13 children, of which 4 are still living and 3 of those live at home. When her husband was alive they planted large areas of citrus fruits, bananas and coffee in her in-law´s fields. But now her harvests have diminished because her children do not like agricultural work and she cannot work with the same intensity as when she was younger. Since then, six months ago, she began selling candies with the help of her son who works in Lima and sends her the merchandise. But she still would like to improve her business with display cases, shelves and greater inventory so she can compete with her neighbors, get more income and improve her standard of living and not just rely on the harvest of her crops, which often do not live up to her expectations. Rosa is very pleased to be part of this new communal bank and has many hopes regarding their methodology as well as being committed to making all her payments on time. The money she requests is to buy products for her business in hopes of capturing more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Asa

texts.en:
Asa Taafuli, 51, is married with 8 children. She has 2 years of experience in the Vegetable business. She sells to the village 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US $122).

SPBD loans are Asa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy more seeds and tools for use in her vegetable garden and also for home improvement.

loans.use: Vegetable gardening supplies and home improvement

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en: N. Robinah is the leader of the Matale loaning group. She is married and helps cater to four dependents. Robinah has a bar business where she sells cold drinks such as sodas, mineral water, wines, beers and local brew (malwa and tonto). She now has a banana plantation with food that she sells and uses for home business consumption. She says she is taking the loan in order to expand and restock because the profits from her business go towards her family.  Robinah needs to buy more drinks for her bar so that she can sell more because her loyal customers will drink all that she stocks. She is grateful for her loans and her loaning group because they are cooperative and advise each other through their businesses.

loans.use: Buying more drinks for her bar.

loans.name: Morgiane

texts.fr:
G. Morgiane est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Morgiane est mariée à DANKPENON André, soudeur de profession. Morgiane est mère de deux enfants. Morgiane a abandonné très tôt l’école pour apprendre la couture. La couture qu’elle n’a exercée que pour trois (3) ans seulement. En effet, c’est des produits vivriers que Morgiane  vend actuellement. Morgiane vend des sacs de  maïs et de farine de manioc ainsi que des fruits de saison. Morgiane a eu déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Morgiane veut acheter et stocker de maïs pendant que c’est moins cher, pour ensuite le revendre plus chers quand le prix va grimper. C’est pour cette raison que Morgiane sollicite de ALIDé un troisième crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Morgiane G. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Morgiane is married to André Dankpenon, a welder by profession. Morgiane is the mother of two children. Morgiane abandoned her education very early on in order to learn to be a dressmaker. She was a dressmaker for only three years. Indeed, it is the sale of staple foods that Morgiane works in currently. Morgiane sells bags of maize and manioc flour as well as seasonal fruit. Morgiane has already obtained two loans through Alidé, which she repaid properly. Morgiane would like to buy and stock maize when it is cheaper, and then to sell it when the price climbs. It is for this reason that Morgiane is seeking a third loan through Alidé. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its GDP per capita is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 24 bags of maize

loans.name: Amelio

texts.en:
Mr. Amelio is married to Mrs. Marcian. They have four children who all have their own income and live outside of the home.

He works in a bakery, and with the help of Kiva, saved enough money to be able to open a small grocery store next to his bakery. He is very thankful that he has alternative sources of income and more possibilities to increase his income. He says that investing is the only way to confront crisis. He also owns a taxi that brings in a small amount of family income. 

Mr. Amelio, at 66 years old, still has an enterprising spirit and motivation to continue to progress, which is very important in achieving goals.

loans.use: To purchase flour, oil, herbs among other things for his shop

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr: fatou bintou N. est parent beneficiaire dans la communaute de camberene qui evolue dans la vente de foulards et d'echarpes pour femmes.cette activite est pratiquee depuis 2004.son objectif est de diversifier les articles commercialises en y incorporant d'autres articles tels que chaussures et ou sacs a  mains pour femmes.par consequent elle sollicite un credit 75 000frs afin de satisfaire sa clientele et aussi accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Fatou Bintou N. is a beneficiary and a parent in the community of Camberene. She sells scarves and shawls for women. She has been in this business since 2004. Her goal is to diversity what she sells, adding such articles as shoes or handbags for women. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of 75,000 frs so as to satisfy her clientele and increase her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling articles for women

loans.name: Iraneo

texts.en:
“We must be patient in order to succeed,” says Iraneo, a motor tricycle driver in the village of Bonfal Proper in Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married to Myrna and blessed with loving children. He hopes that his children will finish their studies and be employed in good jobs.  

Iraneo wants to repair his motorcycle to have a smoother transporting business and for his passengers to be safe. For this reason, he seeks a loan from Kiva of PHP 6,000 for motorcycle maintenance and to buy some necessary motorcycle accessories. His wife, on the other hand, is working as domestic helper abroad. They help each other earn income for the future of their children.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Kalamera Group

texts.en:
This is Abibatu C., Mariatu K. and Mohamed S.. They are small-scale businesspeople in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They call their group Kalamera. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of previous loans, they were able to expand their businesses, make better profit and consequently improve on their standards living.

Abibatu C. (left) is the leader of the group. She was born in Magburaka and is now thirty-five years of age. She is married to a businessman and they have five children. One of their children is now in Junior Secondary School I, another is in class III and one is still not of school-going age. Abibatu sells market food and has been in this business for ten years now.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Rosa Lissai

texts.pt:
Rosa Lisa P. S. nasceu na provincial de inhambane no distrito de Vilanculos (a 790 km a norte de Maputo) casada e mãe de 2 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 21 e 24 anos. O primeiro filho trabalha numa empresa em Boane enquanto que o outro continua a estudar. Parou de estudar na 5 classe por falta de incentivo por parte dos pais que não tinham visão sobre o valor da educação.

Vive em boane a mais de 10 anos, proveniente de Maputo, donde se transferiu com toda sua família, na casa própria juntamente com sua mãe que se encontra sob sua responsabilidade. Seu marido trabalha na fabrica de cimentos de Moçambique enquanto que ela faz o negocio a mais de 12 anos sem empregados.

Aprendeu a fazer negocio ha 24 anos no mercado Fajardo na cidade Maputo.  Vende cereais, (milho e o que compra a 120,00MT o saco e vende a 255,00MT cada). Obtém uma renda diária no valor de 2.500,00MT e uma parte poupa no esquema tradicional de poupança rotativa (xitique).

Nunca teve empréstimo com outros Bancos e que teve informações sobre a existência da Hluvuku-Adsema através de vizinhos e tendo desembolsado 3 empréstimos (10.000,00MT; 20.000,00MT e 30.000,00MT) todos para comercio.

Com o presente credito de 15.000,00MT pretende comprar mais produtos (milho e outros cereais) para reforçar o seu negocio. Decidiu pedir pouco valor comparando com os créditos anteriores por causa da saturação do mercado. 

Pretende pagar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de expandir para novas zonas e contratar trabalhadores para lhe auxiliar a fazer o marketing.
texts.en:
Rosa Lisa P. S. was born in the Inhambane province of the Vilanculos district (790 km north of Maputo). She is married and is the mother of 2 children between the ages of 21 and 24. Her first son works in a business in Boane while the other studies. She stopped her studies in the 5th grade because her parents did not believe in the value of education.

She has lived in Boane more than 10 years, having come from Maputo, where she moved with her whole family, in her own home with her mother, whom she supports. Her husband works in the Cimentos de Moçambique (Cements of Mozambique) factory while she has run the business for the last 12 months without employees.
